story:
Hey friends!  I am super excited to be putting a cover album out “Songs I Like”.   May 28 will be five years since I bought my first uke and what an incredible five years it has been!!!   I have had an amazing time traveling and meeting so many of you!!   My favorite time is when I’m playing music and people are dancing and singing along. That is the whole idea behind this album. It is an album of  10(ish) “Songs I Like” and one of the reasons I like these particular songs is as I travel I have found that you all seem to like them as well!   Now you can sing along from home or your car or whenever you are!!!

         One of the difficult things in recording a album of covers is paying the copyright fees.  Well that’s where you all come in!! I am running a short Funding camand hoping to raise $1000.  Together we can do it!   The money will go to paying for the rights to the songs as well as the artwork and printing of cds.   I’ve included several reward level so hopefully there is one that is best for you!!   Thank you so much for your support and I hope to sing with you soon!!!!

story:
Short Summary

         My name is Dillan Mitchell and I'm a singer, songwriter, and musician from Columbia, MO. Over 8 years ago, God placed a calling on my heart to write and record worship songs specifically for Him and for the Church. Finally, in His perfect timing, He is bringing these songs to fruition! Through the ministry of His Musician Pool, the professional recording cost has been cut DRAMATICALLY, saving over $10,000. It is now time to mix and master these songs.

What We Need & What You Get

Here is how these songs are brought to life.

  • These songs will be mixed and mastered professionally by gifted and anointed audio producers with years of experience and a wealth of expertise. This will ensure a reliable experience and an extremely well done final product. 
  • All in all, between recording, editing, mixing, and mastering, it should cost between $15,000 and $20,000. 
  • HOWEVER, with your help in raising $4,000, we will be saving over $15,000!!! 

The Impact

When these songs are finally mixed and mastered...

  • The ultimate hope is that they bless the Lord and touch His heart.
  • The next hope is that these songs would minister to people in every situation and circumstance. No matter what season the listener may be in, each of these songs points to the ultimate reality of the goodness and love of God.
  • Logistically, the goal is to make these songs accessible on every major streaming platform and accessible to be sung in churches! 

Risks & Challenges

         To be honest, the only challenge in bringing this to fruition is the financial aspect. The songs have all been recorded and edited, the audio producers are all ready to go, and all we need to do is raise the $4,000 for this project to finally come to life! 

Other Ways You Can Help

Maybe assisting financially is something you just can't do. Understandable! However, here are a few other ways you can help make this happen.

  • Pray. Please pray! Not simply for the funding to come in, but for the name of Jesus to be glorified in all of the earth.
  • Spread the word! By sharing this campaign on your social media pages, you are greatly increasing the potential of reaching the goal!

story:
Be a part of our history by helping us recording our debut EP with the legendary producer Michael Wagener (Ozzy Osbourne, Metallica, Skid Row, Alice Cooper, Mötley Crüe and more).

My entire guitar playing life, I have listened to records that Michael Wagener had a part of. And to now have the opportunity to work with him, is a dream come true.

We have BIG plans for Black Smoke Trigger, and this really is just the beginning.

Thank you so much for your support, it means so much!

-Charlie

 

Back in 2011 I lived in a small flat on a hill in Napier, New Zealand…

The band had a bit of success at the time (under a different name), we were played on national radio, toured around New Zealand and toured internationally as well. 

The problem was the band wasn’t bringing in enough money to sustain our touring efforts.

I was doing my best to push the band forward...

But the reality was this, I was sleeping on a broken fold out couch that I would fold up to make room for my one-on-one guitar students. And every cent I got went on music gear or the band.

When I taught my students, they always got really, really fast results. And I knew that if I took my guitar lessons online, I could make a much bigger impact.

But I had to make a big decision… A decision that changed my life forever…

Do I continue to pursue my music career with my limited resources, or do I put it on hold to create a guitar instruction company and come back to the band when I’m ready to give it the best possible shot?

I decided to create something called Guitar Mastery Method.

It took 3 long years of pulling all-nighters, constantly learning and pushing through when my energy was at its lowest to finally release my first course (Guitar Mastery 101)...

And on Tuesday the 5th of August 2014, at 10:00am I sat up on my broken fold out couch and clicked a button which made Guitar Mastery Method go live. And at exactly 10:17am, GMM got its first member :)

I’ll never forget that day. 3 years of hard work and as soon as that one person had signed up, I knew it was all worth it.

Word started spreading about the awesome results our members were getting with my guitar courses. And I started receiving messages from members telling me their stories.

I fell in love with helping GMM members and wanted to help more and more. So I built a team, first with Elmar and Jonny. Elmar worked remote but Jonny worked with me in my tiny bedroom, we actually pulled the doors off a wardrobe to fit in another desk. We worked some crazy hours in that room.

Then Jevon joined and we got a headquarters. The team continued to grow, Will and Mike came on board, then Baldrick and Owen, then Jade, Josh, Marty, Alex, Arielle, Eddie, Dan and Nick.

Going into the 8th year of working on Guitar Mastery Method, I’ve now created a team that are better at a lot of things than myself. Which means that I can finally set out on a journey that I wanted to do a long time ago…

Give the world a kick-ass Rock N Roll band.

I'm still working really hard in GMM, and also going full force with the band (the 90 hour work weeks aren't anything new though :p).

This has been 8 years in the making. Now is the time.

 

Pictured above, left to right, Dan Fulton (Bass), Josh Coyle-Te Maro (Drums), Charlie Wallace (Guitar) and Baldrick (Vocals).

We have all known each other for years and we come from a special part of the world called Napier, New Zealand. We are all born and raised right here. 

We are a hard rock band, our influences span the decades, coming from Led Zeppelin, Black Sabbath, Van Halen, Guns N' Roses, Ozzy Osbourne, Mötley Crüe, Jimi Hendrix, Skid Row, Metallica and more...

We've been working like crazy over the past few months writing as many songs as we possibly could. In fact, we wrote 170 riffs, from that, we chose the 20 best and fleshed out some song ideas, then got that down to the best 11 to complete into full songs... Then only the best will make it onto the EP (more details about that below).

Needless to say, we have been working our butts off to make sure this is the absolute best EP we can possibly create. And very soon, we will be starting pre-production with the legend, Michael Wagener himself.

 

You can be a part of our history by backing us as we head into the studio by grabbing one of the perks available on this page.

With creating a professional recording, there are quite a lot of costs involved, and through this Indiegogo page, you can help us make it happen.

Where will the funds go?

Studio Time: $20,000
Return Flights for 4: $7,000
EP Art Work Design: $2,500
Car Hire: $1,200
AirBnb: $5,000
Indiegogo Fees (if goal reached): $4,000
Cost of CDs, Shirts, Hoodies & other perks: $8,000
Marketing for the EP: $6,300
Total: $50,000

Here's a graph to give a visual representation:

 

The more we raise, the more we have for marketing our songs. And the more ears we have listening, the bigger the opportunities. All funds over our original goal will be going directly to marketing the band. So we've added some extra goodies that will be added to EVERYONE who has backed us, once we reach these milestones:

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

To back us, you can click the "Back It" button at the top and enter any amount you'd like to back us by. Or you can select one of the many perks we have on this page.

Everything from limited Fan Packs & Guitars used on the EP... to coming to hang with the band in New Zealand to write and record.

If there's something you think we should add as a perk, let us know and we'll do our best! Just click the "Ask A Question" button at the top!

 

We leave the studio in August, that's when we'll be flying back to New Zealand. We are aiming for a late-September release date for the EP (remember, you'll get it before it is officially released). We will keep you updated via this page with any updates about the EP or any other developments.

After we have released the EP, we will be creating 2 music videos to promote the songs, then launching off on a New Zealand tour before planning shows around the world.

For more details on our plan after we release this EP, watch the video at the top of this page.

 

Even if you can't contribute to this page, please know that just by being here, you are supporting us, so thank you for your time and energy!

Other ways you can help include

- Sharing this page on your Facebook page (use the share tool at the top)

- Tell your friends and family about this page

- Spread the word about Black Smoke Trigger in any way, shape or form.

 

We can't thank you enough for your support to make this a reality. It wouldn't happen without YOU!

- Charlie, Baldrick, Dan & Josh
Black Smoke Trigger

 

P.S. If you have any questions, please let us know by using the "Ask A Question" button above.

P.P.S. After you have selected your perk, please head to the "Comments" page and let us know where in the world you are supporting us from!

story:
Music at the Blissful is releasing music for the first time.

 

It's taken me many years to get to the point where

     I wanted to record and release my own music for children.   

Together with some fantastic musicians; Aaron Trant (drums) Umar Zakaria (bass) and Geni Skendo (flute), we recorded some 4 songs. 

Brad Hyland (appletown gun shop, headband,  Fa5hion Colt)  produced and engineered the recordings and is presently mixing.                                                                     

Jeff Zeigler (Uniform Recording Studio) is presenlty mixing. 

 

  I am asking for your support to help this project become a reality.  There has already been so much work put into these songs and there is still more that needs to be done.

 

Your support will help pay for the costs of the musicians, the mixing and mastering, the licensing and distribution, and the promotion of the music. 

 

Thank you for being part of Music at the Blissful and making these recordings come to life.

story:
What's shakin'?

For the past few years, I've been in search of my own voice as a musician. Having been in two different bands in my 20s, my voice existed primarily through my guitar playing. But I've been pushing myself to dig deeper, branch out, and write what makes me happy - which has subsequently become The American Dream LP. These songs have brought me such joy, because they each offered their own set of challenges that made me wrestle with melody, words, and music - sometimes for a week, sometimes for months. And I refuse to release something that I personally can't play on repeat.

Cool! Now what?

Remember that scene where the Karate Kid is perfecting his "wax on" and "wax off" routine? Well your contribution will be used to mix my album (wax on!) and master it (wax off!). I have managed to write and record everything at my home or my brother's, but this is the final step before releasing it into the world.

The exchange

No, you're not gonna get a vinyl album, cassette tape, or a stinkin' CD.. you will have the choice of receiving a beautifully crafted garment I personally designed or a motorcycle t-shirt! All garments are unisex and fit true to size!

Other ways you can help

Even if you can't contribute financially, it helps greatly when you share this campaign and help us get the word out!  Thank you so much for your support!

story:
Got To know - Undergrooveland

 

The True Story

"From venues, to the streets. Shoved from numerous rehearsal spaces, Undergrooveland took their music to the streets of London in search of a new land to compose, jam and bring rock to the people. Back and forth, forth and back, developing their own style next to the daily commuters, tourists, extreme weather conditions and the strangest locations that would become their actual inspiration."

-George Alan, Trumpet player.

"After having self-produced their first EP, Undergrooveland developed the confidence to travel, share their music and cut distances between the artist and the audience. Visiting new spots, meeting new crowds, that has always been the driving force of what they do. Recently they managed to organise their biggest trip to date, travelling Europe on a Busking Tour that successfully sold out all of 500+ CD’s."

-Ferran Vergés, Photographer.

And so we have done, night and day; same old brush and same old canvas for us, but you, as a person, as an audience, have made the difference every time. Yes, YOU. There in the crowd making us smile and feel all connected to each other. YOU, a different person at every location, every session, every country, embracing groove and music together for that moment in time. This has been our inspiration to compose this album and because of that, we can’t wait to share it with you.

Ask and you'll Receive

With this flexible funding scheme we can set realistic goals to match our goals to the amount of supporters. These are the targets we can reach together:

  1. 200€ - Artist Reward:                                                                                                                    Our first goal is covering the costs of design, the first impression between the band/new listeners, rewarding the artist who is working with us. With a 1€ donation you will show your support to the project, getting in return a digital download of the album single featuring lyrics and 8 photos of the artistic process.
  2. 1000€ - CDs:                                                                                                                                                       The next step is making physical copies for you to receive at home, to play on road trips, have an intimate moment, rock out with your pals… to make yours. CD’s are the most common format to get the music directly to all you out there, so we are very keen on getting these to you.
  3. 2500€ - Vinyl:                                                                                                                        Exclusive to this campaign, the pressing of a limited vinyl run to cater to you audiophiles who really enjoy the warmth of your Audio Systems. It's an exciting thing we have yet to process and experience ourselves. 
  4. 4500€ - Japan:                                                                                                                                                Take our music to a new scenario where it is yet to be discovered. As the band originated thanks to influential Japanese busker -Stdrums- and his adventures crossing Asia to Europe, we would like to greet our 'senpai' by travelling to Japan, present him with a copy of the album, and play our debut shows in Tokyo.
  5. 6000€ - Europe:                                                                                                                                               Last but not least, getting Undergrooveland on the European touring scene. We have been on the road last summer proving that touring is possible if you keep up the hard work. On our return to Europe from Asia, we would like to continue to play venues and festivals.
  6. 10000€ - United States:

Given the fact that our momentum is unstoppable, by this point we would be ready to take our grooves to the streets of New Orleans, Chicago, New York, Kansas City, LA, San Francisco, etc.

In a nutshell, the funds will not only allow us to deliver a high-quality album to those who already know of us, but will enable the band to reach a fresh and new broader audience. The challenge has always been trying to manage these processes on our own, but with your support we will have a chance to improve our music, open a network of distribution, book shows and overall keep on creating music and vibes for you, which we commit ourselves fully to.

Why we started Crowdfunding

After busking for extended periods with different objectives, we have realised that our music gives purpose to our lives. Not only have the audiences always been a pleasure to play to, but they have shown us immense support. For this reason we are reaching out to all of you, to bring this mutual support and respect together in this unique act for music!

To continue further on our adventurous path to develop new songs and lyrics, we have to break from routine; turn earth itself upside down and play our tracks to a different audience in Japan. As we travel and gather experiences, we convert these into music, at this stage your support will actually become our music!

The music-scene today is a wild jungle of extreme opposites. Our homage to classic rock and funk has taken people back to the 70's as we approach the 2020's which present themselves in a very vague and style-less manner. We want to close the gap between generations, introducing a simple bridge to the old masters who influenced and taught us how to play live -even on records-.

What if I don't want to spend anything?

Even if you can't spare us a little change, we would really appreciate if you shared this campaign with someone who might like and support the band. We love making connections with people, you never know, one day we might be sharing some of your content! For further info check #Undergrooveland on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter.

 
Chemicalody (teaser) - Undergrooveland 

-[Full song included with every perk]-
story_txt:
Got To know - Undergrooveland
 
The True Story
"From venues, to the streets. Shoved from numerous rehearsal spaces, Undergrooveland took their music to the streets of London in search of a new land to compose, jam and bring rock to the people. Back and forth, forth and back, developing their own style next to the daily commuters, tourists, extreme weather conditions and the strangest locations that would become their actual inspiration."
-George Alan, Trumpet player.
"After having self-produced their first EP, Undergrooveland developed the confidence to travel, share their music and cut distances between the artist and the audience. Visiting new spots, meeting new crowds, that has always been the driving force of what they do. Recently they managed to organise their biggest trip to date, travelling Europe on a Busking Tour that successfully sold out all of 500+ CD’s."
-Ferran Vergés, Photographer.
And so we have done, night and day; same old brush and same old canvas for us, but you, as a person, as an audience, have made the difference every time. Yes, YOU. There in the crowd making us smile and feel all connected to each other. YOU, a different person at every location, every session, every country, embracing groove and music together for that moment in time. This has been our inspiration to compose this album and because of that, we can’t wait to share it with you.

Ask and you'll Receive
With this flexible funding scheme we can set realistic goals to match our goals to the amount of supporters. These are the targets we can reach together:


200€ - Artist Reward:                                                                                                                    Our first goal is covering the costs of design, the first impression between the band/new listeners, rewarding the artist who is working with us. With a 1€ donation you will show your support to the project, getting in return a digital download of the album single featuring lyrics and 8 photos of the artistic process.

1000€ - CDs:                                                                                                                                                       The next step is making physical copies for you to receive at home, to play on road trips, have an intimate moment, rock out with your pals… to make yours. CD’s are the most common format to get the music directly to all you out there, so we are very keen on getting these to you.

2500€ - Vinyl:                                                                                                                        Exclusive to this campaign, the pressing of a limited vinyl run to cater to you audiophiles who really enjoy the warmth of your Audio Systems. It's an exciting thing we have yet to process and experience ourselves. 

4500€ - Japan:                                                                                                                                                Take our music to a new scenario where it is yet to be discovered. As the band originated thanks to influential Japanese busker -Stdrums- and his adventures crossing Asia to Europe, we would like to greet our 'senpai' by travelling to Japan, present him with a copy of the album, and play our debut shows in Tokyo.

6000€ - Europe:                                                                                                                                               Last but not least, getting Undergrooveland on the European touring scene. We have been on the road last summer proving that touring is possible if you keep up the hard work. On our return to Europe from Asia, we would like to continue to play venues and festivals.
10000€ - United States:

Given the fact that our momentum is unstoppable, by this point we would be ready to take our grooves to the streets of New Orleans, Chicago, New York, Kansas City, LA, San Francisco, etc.
In a nutshell, the funds will not only allow us to deliver a high-quality album to those who already know of us, but will enable the band to reach a fresh and new broader audience. The challenge has always been trying to manage these processes on our own, but with your support we will have a chance to improve our music, open a network of distribution, book shows and overall keep on creating music and vibes for you, which we commit ourselves fully to.

Why we started Crowdfunding
After busking for extended periods with different objectives, we have realised that our music gives purpose to our lives. Not only have the audiences always been a pleasure to play to, but they have shown us immense support. For this reason we are reaching out to all of you, to bring this mutual support and respect together in this unique act for music!
To continue further on our adventurous path to develop new songs and lyrics, we have to break from routine; turn earth itself upside down and play our tracks to a different audience in Japan. As we travel and gather experiences, we convert these into music, at this stage your support will actually become our music!
The music-scene today is a wild jungle of extreme opposites. Our homage to classic rock and funk has taken people back to the 70's as we approach the 2020's which present themselves in a very vague and style-less manner. We want to close the gap between generations, introducing a simple bridge to the old masters who influenced and taught us how to play live -even on records-.

What if I don't want to spend anything?
Even if you can't spare us a little change, we would really appreciate if you shared this campaign with someone who might like and support the band. We love making connections with people, you never know, one day we might be sharing some of your content! For further info check #Undergrooveland on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter.
 


Chemicalody (teaser) - Undergrooveland  

-[Full song included with every perk]-

story:
WHO WE ARE

For a decade, Mad Anthony has been producing high-energy, emotional rock n' roll. Our mission has always been to be the band that's pushing the envelope and in 2016 we pushed it to the edge. We were tired of the write-record-release-tour-repeat routine and opted for something untraditional. For a year, we released new material every week via the internet, pushing ourselves to work harder, cross genres and collaborate with new artists. The result is Mad Anthology, a 52-song box set featuring contributions from dozens of the friends and colleagues we've met over our tenure.

WHAT NOW

Now, we're ready to bring these songs to life on a physical format. We're not wealthy by any means, so producing a 5-piece vinyl box set is not realistic. Instead, we decided to break the product into volumes.

  • Each Volume will be released on vinyl & CD
  • Volume One & Two feature 11 songs, including 10+ collaborators on each volume
  • 180 gram, collectors edition vinyl with full color packaging and images
  • Deluxe edition packaging available for collectors
  • Digital downloads of the complete Anthology

YOUR IMPACT

Obviously, this project is quite labor intensive and expensive, but your contribution means even more than you would think.

  • The ability to produce these records in the way we envision: Independent musicians often sacrifice their ideas to stay within budget, your support maintains our integrity.
  • With full funding we can afford to continue duplication of future Mad Anthology: Volumes but also continue creating Mad Anthology collaborations.
  • More media production: we're not out of ideas, and your contribution will fund future projects, including music videos and other interactive experiences.
  • Validation for the work we undertake to bring you new music in a new format

RISKS & CHALLENGES

We're not sharing our production costs with you. We spent over $10K recording these songs and that doesn't include our time, equipment and promotion. The financial burden is only part of the challenge when undertaking a enormous production.

The other big sacrifice, that is often overlooked, is time away. It's not just our time recording the songs, it's time touring to make money to record, time to rehearse, time away from loved, time not relaxing on vacation and used paid time off from work. Don't get me wrong, rock n' roll is fun, but we ended up missing a lot of other things that are also important to us.

Finally, the biggest risk was going alone. It's huge risk to go against the grain of the music industry, there were many people who laughed in our faces when we told them our idea. Others thought (or wished) we would fail. We had multiple publicists and promoters reject us because they were afraid of taking on such a massive project. We didn't have a team of professionals to guide us through the process. We had a team of the willing who were learning the ropes along with us, to whom we are forever grateful.

OTHER WAYS TO HELP

Maybe you can't contribute financially, and we completely understand, but here's some other ways to help out:

  • Share this campaign on your social media.
  • Talk about the project with your friends and family.
  • Attend a show, one of ours would be great, but any local musician would be lucky to have you.
  • Encourage your friends and local artists, even words can make a huge impact.
  • Love your neighbors, community and music scene.

Support your local music scene starts by being part of it. There's a lot you can do without leaving your house. Be part of the movement, reject the commercialization of music and art, invest in your community.

story:
From my own children

I came by it honest. I was a Dad first, then I started writing children's music for my own children and then I started performing children's music for other people's children.  I've been a professional actor, a singer, written songs and toured a great many places. I never thought I'd write and perform children's music for my living, my career, as a way to support my family, but here I am, and I love it. I've been writing children's music for the last 6 years and performed thousands of times and for 10s of thousands of children (not all at once, now). You can find me playing festivals,charity events and small private parties. I love it.  I love writing songs for my children, about the things they say, what they do and I love that it resonates with other people who have kids. To be fair, it's pretty cool to hear a bunch of under 6's and their adults singing along to a song I wrote. 

I self produced and recorded my first two full length CD's of children's music. I played various instruments, built drum tracks and played percussion, sometimes just about alright. These two CD's were a mix of my own work and more traditional children's songs. I'm happy with them. They were a simple way to get my music out to the wider world, but also they served a very specific purpose, to provide something the children coming to my music sessions could listen to at home.

I endeavour to write quality music for young children, for under 8's, for babies and toddlers. They deserve good music and so do their parents and carers. When I perform, I perform for the kids. They are my audience. My goal with this campaign, this full length album, is to provide in the highest quality possible my own original music for young children. I'll produce fully realised versions of my previously recorded material as well as brand new original work and deliver it to a growing worldwide audience. 

This campaign, fully funded, not only creates a high quality album of great children's music, the means to distribute both digitally and physically, but it provides a platform for me to bring my music to more people around the world. 

The monies... 

Woah! 11K, That's a lot. But I don't need all of it from you. All I need is the price of a CD from you and 857.692 other people (taking into account indiegogo fees). AND, when you contribute the price of a CD, using the €13 Perk, you will get an ACTUAL CD signed by me including a free digital download of the album. You don't spend Euro's I hear you say, well, indiegogo will sort out the conversion for you. Now...

Where is all that money going? 

  • professional studio musicians
  • a studio engineer
  • a producer
  • a public relations person to promote/distribute album
  • promotional photo shoot
  • Digital Distribution
  • CD- Layout/graphic design
  • Physical CD manufacturing
  • CD Distribution
  • If possible- brand spankin' new video for a track off the album

The Perks

In the most basic of terms, give as little or as much as you like, but I don't want you to just invest in this album, I want you to own it. If you'd like something to hold in your hand to show what you've invested in, I've come up with two perks. I like to keep things easy, so we'll start with the price of a CD and go from there. Any contribution of €13 or more will get you a signed copy of the CD and a free digital download of the album. A contribution of €50 or more will get you a signed copy, a digital download and a personalised thank you video dedicated to your child with a live performance of her/his favourite track. I'll provide a list to choose from in the perk, if you don't have either of my previous CD's you can listen to them on Spotify, iTunes, etc. There's no limit on how much you can contribute. and even the smallest amount is greatly appreciated. If you go huge, we'll sort a huge perk, but for the moment I'll keep it simple.

What happens if I don't make the campaign goal?

This is an 'All or Nothing' Campaign. So, if we don't reach our goal- nothing happens. 

Investors get all their money back. Simple as. I wouldn't try to produce this album, at this quality, without being able to fund it properly. 

The Impact

In a very simple way, the immediate impact is that you will hold in your hand a full length album of children's music that you helped make possible. You'll be able to listen to it with your kids. You'll be dropping them at school and heading down the road for 20 minutes listening to the album alone, singing the songs, bopping along and then you'll be like 'Wait, the kids aren't in the car. I don't need to listen to this anymore.' But you will. You will because you like it too. Or maybe you won't, but at least twice a week that will happen to you.

I know not everybody is in a position to help financially

but there's so much you can do without reaching into your pocket.

  • Find your inner toddler and make some noise about the campaign
  • Share the campaign on your social media networks
  • Tell people with kids
  • Tell grandparents
  • Tell other parents
  • It makes a great gift, have someone contribute on your behalf or do the same for another
  • Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thanks for taking the time to get this far, to read all that. I hope you'll consider making a contribution. And maybe I'll even get to sing for you. 

All the best,

Kyle Riley

story:
ENGLISH

WHO, WHY, WHERE

Hi!!!! Hola!! My name is Juana Luna, I´m a singer originally from Buenos Aires, Argentina. I´ve been living in the US for almost seven years now: four years in Boston and almost three in New York City. Fortunately I have been able to sing and play often these past years, and to write a lot of music. 

I have worked in musical theatre and with dance companies; I have toured the US with Sephardic music theatrical group “Tales of the Forgotten Kingdom“; I sang tango and Southamerican folkloric music internationally, with musicians from all around the globe;I have also sung Southamerican rock, I have formed a musical vocal trío with two of my favorite people in the world (Eleni and Jacinta) with which we perform regularly; and I have been involved in puppeteering for the past three years, as well as storytelling and improvisational theater.. And as I write these lines I can´t help smiling and feeling thankful for all the opportunities I´ve had, all the people I've met and played with and I love every new day, every new question, every new opportunity…

Now, here is the next opportunity: recording my first album. A musical/visual/energetic picture of what I am living through right now, of a very special circumstance in my life. This is a fantastic opportunity to work with some of the people I admire the most, and to sing songs that we all love, to record them in New York City, with an excellent group of extremely talented musicians who also happen to be outstanding human beings..

Let me proudly introduce them to you:

TEAM

-Musical production, arrangements and piano: Juan Andrés Ospina (Colombia)

-Percussion: Marcelo Woloski (Argentina)

-Electric Bass: Andrés Rotmistrovsky (Argentina)

-Guitar: Juancho Herrera Rey (Venezuela)

Special Guests: 

-Background vocals: Juana Luna (Argentina), Juan Andrés Ospina (Colombia), Eleni Arapoglou (Greece)

-Harmonica: Yotam Ben Or (Israel)

-Trombone: Matt McDonald (USA)

-Tenor Saxophone: Linus Wyrsch (Küssnacht, Switzerland)

-Cello: Maria Jeffers (USA)

-Electric Guitar: Chris McQueen (Texas, USA)

*Magda Giannikou (Greece) worked as co-producer at the studio for the song “Amándote” and “Oración del remanso”

-Videos: Alessio Romano (Milan, Italy)

-Photos: (at the Studio) Diego Rotmistrovsky (Argentina)

-Recording engineer: Daniel G. Sanint (Cali, Colombia), assistant Josh Welshman (USA). Recorded at Flux Studios (New York, US)

-Mixing and mastering engineer: Jeremy Loucas (Canary Islands, Spain)

-Co-Artistic Producer: Gustavo Szulansky (Buenos Aires, Argentina)

In order for this CD to be out (and about!) we need your help, and we have a lot of things to give back to you! On the right side of the page, there´s a list of many different Perks. You can choose one, and  you can also pre-order the album. I am sure there´s one that is just right for you. 

Your help means the world to me, because it helps us putting the final touches on the album, so that we can send it to you and then share it with the Universe!.   We need $12,000, just to cover the cost of the CD. Producing and recording a CD is an expensive process, especially if it is a high quality CD, as this one will be. Please see below a very partial list of what it takes to make a good record:

 

COSTS

-Musicians
-Production
-Video Man
-Studio fees
-Mixing and mastering 
-Album’s art fees
-Printing of the CD
-Handling and Promotion

OTHER WAYS TO HELP

If for any reason you cannot contribute by picking one of the wonderful Perks, you can also help by sharing this link with people that you think might be interested. Even if you get Perk, please share this link, post, repost, and disseminate far and wide!

THANK YOU

Producing and releasing an album is always a challenge and a very long process requiring great attention to detail. There is a lot of work involved, and a lot of things that just… need to happen! The music in this album is beautiful, and it is worth all the efforts. I can't wait for us to share it with you!


Thank you! ¡Gracias!

 

 

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

ESPAÑOL

¡Hola! Soy Juana Luna, soy una cantora oriunda de Buenos Aires, Argentina. Hace casi siete años me mudé a Estados Unidos, y aquí sigo, haciendo de todo un poco (primero estuve en Boston cuatro años y hace casi tres años me mudé a NY)*. Tuve la suerte de cantar mucho todos estos años, de escribir muchas canciones y viajar.

*curiosidad: en todos estos años ¡cambié por lo menos catorce veces de casa! ¡puras mudanzas!

Entre otras cosas, trabajé en Teatro Musical, compañías de danza, me fui de tour por los Estados Unidos con el grupo “Tales of the Forgotten Kingdom“ de música y cuentos sefardíes, canté tango y música folklórica latinoamericana acá y de tour por otros países. Formé un trío vocal con dos de mis personas favoritas (Eleni y Jacinta) con el que tocamos regularmente. También canté rock argentino, y sobre todo estos últimos tres años estuve muy involucrada con el teatro para niños, los títeres, conté muchos cuentos, hice improvisaciones teatrales.. y mientras escribo estas líneas sonrío y estoy sumamente agradecida por todas las oportunidades que tuve, toda la gente que conocí, los músicos con los que toqué, mis profesores.. me encantan las preguntas y los desafíos que cada día aparecen; estoy demasiado agradecida con/por la vida...

Y acá está la próxima oportunidad: grabar mi primer álbum.  Una foto musical/visual/energética de lo que está pasando ahora, de esta circunstancia, de este momento de mi vida. Una oportunidad de colaborar -creando- con algunas de las personas que más admiro, para cantar canciones que nos gustan a todos y de grabarlas en New York, con un grupo excelente de músicos (y personas). 

Déjenme introducirles -orgullosa- a mi equipo:

EQUIPO

-Producción Musical, arreglos y piano: Juan Andrés Ospina (Colombia)

-Percusión: Marcelo Woloski (Argentina)

-Bajo: Andrés Rotmistrovsky (Argentina)

-Guitarra: Juancho Herrera Rey (Venezuela)

Invitados Especiales:

-Armonías: Juana Luna (Argentina), Juan Andrés Ospina (Colombia), Eleni Arapoglou (Grecia)

-Armónica: Yotam Ben Or (Israel)

-Trombón: Matt McDonald (E.E.U.U)

-Saxofón (tenor): Linus Wyrsch (Suiza)

-Cello: Maria Jeffers (E.E.U.U)

-Guitarra Eléctrica: Chris McQueen (E.E.U.U)

**Magda Giannikou (Grecia) trabajó como co-productora en el estudio de las siguientes canciones: “Amándote” y “Oración del Remanso”.

-Videos: Alessio Romano (Milán, Italia)

-Fotos (en el estudio): Diego Rotmistrovsky (Argentina)

-Ingenieros de Sonido: Daniel G. Sanint (Cali, Colombia), su asistente Josh Welshman (Providence, RI, E.E.U.U), de Flux Studios (New York, US).

-Mezcla y Masterización: Jeremy Loucas (Islas Canarias, España)

-Co-productor Artístico: Gustavo Szulansky (Buenos Aires, Argentina)

Para que este CD esté terminado e impreso, necesitamos de tu ayuda, y tenemos mucho para ofrecer a cambio. A la derecha de esta página, hay una lista de recompensas, podés elegir una (o más de una), y también podés comprar el álbum por adelantado! (Digital o Físico- lo mandamos a cualquier parte del mundo). ¡Hay muchísimas cosas para elegir!Necesitamos $12,000 solamente para cubrir los costos de producción.
Grabar, producir y publicar un CD es un proceso muy costoso, sobre todo si se hace con la mejor calidad.

COSTOS

-Pago de los músicos
-Producción
-Videos
-Costos en el Estudio
-Mezcla y Masterización
-Diseño Gráfico/Arte de Tapa
-Impresión de CD
-Distribución y Promoción

OTRAS MANERAS DE AYUDAR

Si no podés contribuir obteniendo alguna de las recompensas, igual es de GRAN ayuda compartir esta campaña.

GRACIAS

Grabar y producir un álbum es un gran desafío, y un proceso muy largo. Hay que trabajar mucho, y tener mucha fe en que algunas cosas simplemente ¡van a darse! La música de este disco es muy bell y hace que todo el proceso valga la pena. GRACIAS
story_txt: ENGLISHWHO, WHY, WHEREHi!!!! Hola!! My name is Juana Luna, I´m a singer originally from Buenos Aires, Argentina. I´ve been living in the US for almost seven years now: four years in Boston and almost three in New York City. Fortunately I have been able to sing and play often these past years, and to write a lot of music. I have worked in musical theatre and with dance companies; I have toured the US with Sephardic music theatrical group “Tales of the Forgotten Kingdom“; I sang tango and Southamerican folkloric music internationally, with musicians from all around the globe;I have also sung Southamerican rock, I have formed a musical vocal trío with two of my favorite people in the world (Eleni and Jacinta) with which we perform regularly; and I have been involved in puppeteering for the past three years, as well as storytelling and improvisational theater.. And as I write these lines I can´t help smiling and feeling thankful for all the opportunities I´ve had, all the people I've met and played with and I love every new day, every new question, every new opportunity…Now, here is the next opportunity: recording my first album. A musical/visual/energetic picture of what I am living through right now, of a very special circumstance in my life. This is a fantastic opportunity to work with some of the people I admire the most, and to sing songs that we all love, to record them in New York City, with an excellent group of extremely talented musicians who also happen to be outstanding human beings..Let me proudly introduce them to you:TEAM-Musical production, arrangements and piano: Juan Andrés Ospina (Colombia)-Percussion: Marcelo Woloski (Argentina)-Electric Bass: Andrés Rotmistrovsky (Argentina)-Guitar: Juancho Herrera Rey (Venezuela)Special Guests: -Background vocals: Juana Luna (Argentina), Juan Andrés Ospina (Colombia), Eleni Arapoglou (Greece)-Harmonica: Yotam Ben Or (Israel)-Trombone: Matt McDonald (USA)-Tenor Saxophone: Linus Wyrsch (Küssnacht, Switzerland)-Cello: Maria Jeffers (USA)-Electric Guitar: Chris McQueen (Texas, USA)*Magda Giannikou (Greece) worked as co-producer at the studio for the song “Amándote” and “Oración del remanso”-Videos: Alessio Romano (Milan, Italy)-Photos: (at the Studio) Diego Rotmistrovsky (Argentina)-Recording engineer: Daniel G. Sanint (Cali, Colombia), assistant Josh Welshman (USA). Recorded at Flux Studios (New York, US)-Mixing and mastering engineer: Jeremy Loucas (Canary Islands, Spain)-Co-Artistic Producer: Gustavo Szulansky (Buenos Aires, Argentina)In order for this CD to be out (and about!) we need your help, and we have a lot of things to give back to you! On the right side of the page, there´s a list of many different Perks. You can choose one, and  you can also pre-order the album. I am sure there´s one that is just right for you. Your help means the world to me, because it helps us putting the final touches on the album, so that we can send it to you and then share it with the Universe!.   We need $12,000, just to cover the cost of the CD. Producing and recording a CD is an expensive process, especially if it is a high quality CD, as this one will be. Please see below a very partial list of what it takes to make a good record: COSTS-Musicians-Production-Video Man-Studio fees-Mixing and mastering -Album’s art fees-Printing of the CD-Handling and PromotionOTHER WAYS TO HELPIf for any reason you cannot contribute by picking one of the wonderful Perks, you can also help by sharing this link with people that you think might be interested. Even if you get Perk, please share this link, post, repost, and disseminate far and wide!THANK YOUProducing and releasing an album is always a challenge and a very long process requiring great attention to detail. There is a lot of work involved, and a lot of things that just… need to happen! The music in this album is beautiful, and it is worth all the efforts. I can't wait for us to share it with you!Thank you! ¡Gracias!  ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ESPAÑOL¡Hola! Soy Juana Luna, soy una cantora oriunda de Buenos Aires, Argentina. Hace casi siete años me mudé a Estados Unidos, y aquí sigo, haciendo de todo un poco (primero estuve en Boston cuatro años y hace casi tres años me mudé a NY)*. Tuve la suerte de cantar mucho todos estos años, de escribir muchas canciones y viajar.*curiosidad: en todos estos años ¡cambié por lo menos catorce veces de casa! ¡puras mudanzas!Entre otras cosas, trabajé en Teatro Musical, compañías de danza, me fui de tour por los Estados Unidos con el grupo “Tales of the Forgotten Kingdom“ de música y cuentos sefardíes, canté tango y música folklórica latinoamericana acá y de tour por otros países. Formé un trío vocal con dos de mis personas favoritas (Eleni y Jacinta) con el que tocamos regularmente. También canté rock argentino, y sobre todo estos últimos tres años estuve muy involucrada con el teatro para niños, los títeres, conté muchos cuentos, hice improvisaciones teatrales.. y mientras escribo estas líneas sonrío y estoy sumamente agradecida por todas las oportunidades que tuve, toda la gente que conocí, los músicos con los que toqué, mis profesores.. me encantan las preguntas y los desafíos que cada día aparecen; estoy demasiado agradecida con/por la vida...Y acá está la próxima oportunidad: grabar mi primer álbum.  Una foto musical/visual/energética de lo que está pasando ahora, de esta circunstancia, de este momento de mi vida. Una oportunidad de colaborar -creando- con algunas de las personas que más admiro, para cantar canciones que nos gustan a todos y de grabarlas en New York, con un grupo excelente de músicos (y personas). Déjenme introducirles -orgullosa- a mi equipo:EQUIPO-Producción Musical, arreglos y piano: Juan Andrés Ospina (Colombia)-Percusión: Marcelo Woloski (Argentina)-Bajo: Andrés Rotmistrovsky (Argentina)-Guitarra: Juancho Herrera Rey (Venezuela)Invitados Especiales:-Armonías: Juana Luna (Argentina), Juan Andrés Ospina (Colombia), Eleni Arapoglou (Grecia)-Armónica: Yotam Ben Or (Israel)-Trombón: Matt McDonald (E.E.U.U)-Saxofón (tenor): Linus Wyrsch (Suiza)-Cello: Maria Jeffers (E.E.U.U)-Guitarra Eléctrica: Chris McQueen (E.E.U.U)**Magda Giannikou (Grecia) trabajó como co-productora en el estudio de las siguientes canciones: “Amándote” y “Oración del Remanso”.-Videos: Alessio Romano (Milán, Italia)-Fotos (en el estudio): Diego Rotmistrovsky (Argentina)-Ingenieros de Sonido: Daniel G. Sanint (Cali, Colombia), su asistente Josh Welshman (Providence, RI, E.E.U.U), de Flux Studios (New York, US).-Mezcla y Masterización: Jeremy Loucas (Islas Canarias, España)-Co-productor Artístico: Gustavo Szulansky (Buenos Aires, Argentina)Para que este CD esté terminado e impreso, necesitamos de tu ayuda, y tenemos mucho para ofrecer a cambio. A la derecha de esta página, hay una lista de recompensas, podés elegir una (o más de una), y también podés comprar el álbum por adelantado! (Digital o Físico- lo mandamos a cualquier parte del mundo). ¡Hay muchísimas cosas para elegir!Necesitamos $12,000 solamente para cubrir los costos de producción.Grabar, producir y publicar un CD es un proceso muy costoso, sobre todo si se hace con la mejor calidad.COSTOS-Pago de los músicos-Producción-Videos-Costos en el Estudio-Mezcla y Masterización-Diseño Gráfico/Arte de Tapa-Impresión de CD-Distribución y PromociónOTRAS MANERAS DE AYUDARSi no podés contribuir obteniendo alguna de las recompensas, igual es de GRAN ayuda compartir esta campaña.GRACIASGrabar y producir un álbum es un gran desafío, y un proceso muy largo. Hay que trabajar mucho, y tener mucha fe en que algunas cosas simplemente ¡van a darse! La música de este disco es muy bell y hace que todo el proceso valga la pena. GRACIAS

story:
We are 20StoriesFalling, a Post-Hardcore band from Salt Lake City, Utah. We’ve been playing music together for nearly half a decade and, at long last, we’ve managed to overcome setbacks, personal tragedy, and financial hardship to bring you Existence. We have assembled this campaign to allow our friends, family, and anyone else who has been to our shows, supported us along the way, or been a friend to reserve a copy through a pre-order.

Since pressing a record on vinyl is a hugely expensive undertaking, we are extremely grateful for any and all donations beyond the pre-order. In return, we will be releasing newly recorded material just for donors, handwritten lyrics, previously unreleased demos of the record, and several other goodies.

We cannot express enough how important releasing this record in such a high-quality, commemorative format is for all of us. We have spent years struggling to get these songs recorded, bouncing between studios, existing between practice spaces, and dealing with the loss of loved ones along the way has made this record a deep reflection upon the hardest of times and the vindication that comes with completing a body of work that represents all of these emotions.

Our campaign goal is $3,000. It sounds like a lot, because it is, but every penny counts. From pressing to shipping, vinyl records are an expensive endeavor, but the final product is absolutely worth the effort. All of the money we receive from this campaign is going directly towards the pressing of this vinyl. The final product will be a high-quality 180 gram 12” white vinyl with a “fake out” gatefold jacket. The artwork for Existence is being painted by renowned local artist Christian Degn Petersen.

Years ago, Existence was nothing more than a dream, an idea that existed in a vacuum. Now the day has come where it has been realized, and it has been completed. Help us make the last push, climb the last mountain. We’re almost there, and with your help we will gracefully exorcise the ghosts of the past and look onward to a bright new future.

story:
This recording project means a lot to us because:

1. It will help bring our quirky lit-pop songs to all-new audiences. As you probably know, much of our music celebrates misunderstood and maligned characters from history and literature. Just because they're pariahs, outlaws and weirdos doesn't mean we can't take a moment to stand in their shoes. Maybe the world would be a better place if we all did more of that.  

2. Having a recording with our full band will help bookers and other industry folk connect with our current sound, so we can take our music to new venues. We're ready to keep on keeping Portland weird.

3. And, finally, it will enable us to produce versions of our songs that would be difficult (or impossible) to achieve live in a bar (as much as we do love playing in bars). So expect more textural details and aural goodies! Hear the songs the way we've always wanted them to be heard. (And maybe be able to actually hear all the lyrics - ha!)

Your donations will go toward:

  • Studio sessions & recording engineer time, with the amazing Sean Flora
  • Mixing & mastering
  • More of Molly Sokolow Hayden's stunning illustrated hex signs

How many songs we're able to complete will have a lot to do with how much support we're able to raise for this effort.  We've already laid tracks for four songs. Whatever you are able to donate will help us finish these and more! We expect to have the recordings complete later this fall.

Your support really means a lot to us. Every small amount will make a big difference. Thank you so much for your love.

little hexes
Anmarie, Amy, Karamy and Jen
info@littlehexes.com

littlehexes.com

story:
THE STORY OF DEAD REJECTS

- Dead Rejects is and always has been a solo/duo musical project between friends. A healthy way to cope with the many ups and downs life throws our way. Throughout the years I have used Dead Rejects as a way to help me through life, to express my thoughts and spill my guts to the world instead of turning to darker roads. I never in a million years thought I would have the support I have but here we are in 2019 and you all continue to surprise me with your passion for DR.

While mostly being a solo project has its benefits, like being able to write on my own time and being in complete control of every song it also means going to professionally record each new release is extremely costly. What would be normally be divided between a full band falls solely on my shoulders. This is why I am reaching out to you once more in hopes these new songs can get the proper DR treatment! I have said this many times throughout the years but this will most likely be the last release I can record. Its a little different than most of our albums but still has plenty of the catchy hooks and aggressive attitude you've come to know DR for, and I would love to have you all along for the ride! 



Our current album collection!


WHAT DOES YOUR MONEY GO TOWARD?

- This will be our 3rd album funded through Indiegogo, there are a lot of things to cover but its a fairly straight forward goal. With your help we will be able to record the new EP, as well as provide you backers with exclusive merch as a way of saying thank you! Lets break it down.

$2000 - This covers the cost of recording. That includes the actual recording process, mixing and mastering.

$200-400 - This covers the cost to print CDs. The more money we receive the more CDs we can print. Anyone who has purchased our CDs can tell you they are always high quality and professionally made!

$500-700  - This covers the cost to create new shirts, hoodies and other merch. As with the other indiegogo campaigns the more we receive the more shirts we can make. 

$200-300 - This covers potential costs for paying those that provide us with the artwork. Whether that's the cover, merch designs or extra goodies we might include. 

$100+ - This covers any unforeseen expenses that can pop up during and after recording. Including costs for shipping which often change drastically based on weight.

Our last album Grave Mistakes On CD!



Exclusive Merch Only For Contributors! Bottom right is a sticker!

STRETCH GOALS AND PROBLEMS TO OVERCOME

- Both of our albums funded through Indiegogo exceeded our goals allowing us to include more songs on the albums. As of right now the EP will feature 5 tracks, but I have a large amount of songs I also want to include but cant due to our budget. Exceeding our goal will make it easy to include more songs on the album!  Extra money also allows us to create extra shirts and merch for you and your friends.

- Many potential problems can show up before and after recording. The biggest mistake of the first indiegogo was not including shipping costs within the base Perk prices which caused me to pay over 500 dollars out of my own pocket on shipping costs. Overseas orders can cost over 20 dollars in shipping! Being our 3rd crowdfunded release means this should go over much smoother, but having a little extra in donations means we're prepared in case anything is to happen. 

WHEN CAN YOU EXPECT THE ALBUM AND MERCH?

- Recording is set to start around early spring/summer. It can be anywhere between 2 to 3 months after that until we have a final mastered version in our hands. Contributors will get early access to the digital version of the album before release. Depending on how many orders there are your merch packages will be mailed out in waves, from early contributors first to later donations after and so on and so fourth. This can take anywhere from several weeks to a couple of months as there is only so many orders I can bring to the post office at once. International orders will take longer due to delays in shipping so please be mindful of that when waiting for your order to arrive. Each and everyone of you will receive a confirmation when your order has shipped so you know your package is on the way as well as a personally written thank you note in your order!

WHY SHOULD YOU CONTRIBUTE?

- Since day one I have always made sure my music was free to download for everyone. I dont believe people shouldn't have access to new music because they cant afford it. By you helping fund this album you allow me to return the favor by keeping it free for everyone. In addition you get awesome new merch and allow us all to sing together from across the globe. Don't worry if you cant contribute, I understand money is tight for everyone. If you want to help out but cant donate anything you can share this page or like us on facebook to help spread the word! Or even download our albums from our Bandcamp!


One of the most commonly asked for merch items will now be available! 

A PERSONAL THANK YOU

- I've tried many years to make DR into something bigger than it is. I fear the burdens of everyday life and my own issues have blocked my path many times. While I never managed to keep a full band or tour the world, I am still so incredibly thankful to each and everyone of you. Your support for DR has truly meant the world to me. You have allowed me a way to cope with my problems, with life and its obstacles. Its never been about money or fame, you gave me an outlet to express myself in a way that few people get to. I truly hope you enjoy these new songs, they are different in a lot of ways and in just as many are as DR as ever. As always, play it loud. - Shane

Our celebration shot after recording Downers!

story:
Peer Reviewed Rap

"It is that rare thing, both brilliantly entertaining and hugely informative"
★ ★ ★ ★ ★ – Broadway Baby

***Update: the first two songs on the album are done and streaming here. The rest are well along in the mix process and I hope to offer a sneak preview to backers shortly. Thanks for supporting!!!

I create rap music about complex scientific topics, bringing them to life with hooks, melodies, beats and rhymes. In the past seven years I have produced albums about Evolution, Psychology, Wilderness, Religion, Medicine, and Climate Change. The next album in this series is about the science of Consciousness. Check out my music catalogue to see/hear the quality of these previous projects.

I will be performing "Rap Guide to Consciousness" at the Edinburgh Fringe Festival in August, but first I'm working hard to record the songs as a full-length hip-hop album. Play it while you drive, or on your speakers at home, and discover the science of human experience in a completely new way.

My chief science advisor on the project is Professor Anil Seth at U of Sussex, and my wife Heather Berlin is a neuroscientist who studies consciousness, so my interest in the subject and access to expertise start close to home. In addition, these are the main books I used to research the show (all highly recommended):

 


Recording the Album

The lyrics are (mostly) already written, with songs about octopus consciousness, consciousness in babies, Global Workspace Theory (GWT), free will, philosophers' zombies, psychedelic consciousness, artificial intelligence, cognitive implants, and other heady topics.

Funds from IndieGogo will go towards hiring session musicians and producers to get the album recorded and mixed, as well as designing the artwork and covering other administrative costs. I record and edit the vocals myself, and I'm working with the same (awesome) production team behind my recent Rap Guide to Climate Chaos album, including Tom Caruana, Simon Kendall, and Dan Moross (Soulful Spider). Here's a cost breakdown for the new project:

Raising Consciousness

By backing this project you are supporting the creation of a new kind of conscious hip-hop album, possibly the most conscious hip-hop album ever made.

The goal of the record is to take you on a tour of your own brain and how it generates your inner experiences. It's also a celebration of scientific inquiry and the naturalistic perspective, which challenges us to understand and explain the world around us (and within us) by looking for natural causes, while rejecting untestable hunches and superstitions. No immaterial souls, no ghosts, no magic, not in science. Consciousness is one of humanity's final frontiers of knowledge, and this album will give you a sense of the state of play. It will change the way you think, and change the way you think about thinking, by showing you things about your mind that were always staring you in the face unnoticed.

"Engaging and humorous... sends synapses racing!"
★ ★ ★ ★ 1/2 – The Reviews Hub
 

Risks & Challenges

My aim is to finish this album in time to pre-release it to supporters in August when I'm at the Edinburgh Fringe. Worst case scenario is I only get some of the songs finished and not all, in which case I'll give you a sneak preview and finish the full record in September. But I'm a workhorse and the songwriting is almost finished, so I bet I can get 'er done.
 

Ways You Can Support

Pre-order the album and get one of the awesome perks on the right.

And whether or not you can contribute, please share the campaign on social media and help it infiltrate a few more brains!
story_txt:
Peer Reviewed Rap
"It is that rare thing, both brilliantly entertaining and hugely informative"★ ★ ★ ★ ★ – Broadway Baby
***Update: the first two songs on the album are done and streaming here. The rest are well along in the mix process and I hope to offer a sneak preview to backers shortly. Thanks for supporting!!!I create rap music about complex scientific topics, bringing them to life with hooks, melodies, beats and rhymes. In the past seven years I have produced albums about Evolution, Psychology, Wilderness, Religion, Medicine, and Climate Change. The next album in this series is about the science of Consciousness. Check out my music catalogue to see/hear the quality of these previous projects.

I will be performing "Rap Guide to Consciousness" at the Edinburgh Fringe Festival in August, but first I'm working hard to record the songs as a full-length hip-hop album. Play it while you drive, or on your speakers at home, and discover the science of human experience in a completely new way.My chief science advisor on the project is Professor Anil Seth at U of Sussex, and my wife Heather Berlin is a neuroscientist who studies consciousness, so my interest in the subject and access to expertise start close to home. In addition, these are the main books I used to research the show (all highly recommended):


 

Recording the Album
The lyrics are (mostly) already written, with songs about octopus consciousness, consciousness in babies, Global Workspace Theory (GWT), free will, philosophers' zombies, psychedelic consciousness, artificial intelligence, cognitive implants, and other heady topics.Funds from IndieGogo will go towards hiring session musicians and producers to get the album recorded and mixed, as well as designing the artwork and covering other administrative costs. I record and edit the vocals myself, and I'm working with the same (awesome) production team behind my recent Rap Guide to Climate Chaos album, including Tom Caruana, Simon Kendall, and Dan Moross (Soulful Spider). Here's a cost breakdown for the new project:


Raising Consciousness
By backing this project you are supporting the creation of a new kind of conscious hip-hop album, possibly the most conscious hip-hop album ever made.The goal of the record is to take you on a tour of your own brain and how it generates your inner experiences. It's also a celebration of scientific inquiry and the naturalistic perspective, which challenges us to understand and explain the world around us (and within us) by looking for natural causes, while rejecting untestable hunches and superstitions. No immaterial souls, no ghosts, no magic, not in science. Consciousness is one of humanity's final frontiers of knowledge, and this album will give you a sense of the state of play. It will change the way you think, and change the way you think about thinking, by showing you things about your mind that were always staring you in the face unnoticed.
"Engaging and humorous... sends synapses racing!"★ ★ ★ ★ 1/2 – The Reviews Hub 

Risks & Challenges
My aim is to finish this album in time to pre-release it to supporters in August when I'm at the Edinburgh Fringe. Worst case scenario is I only get some of the songs finished and not all, in which case I'll give you a sneak preview and finish the full record in September. But I'm a workhorse and the songwriting is almost finished, so I bet I can get 'er done. 

Ways You Can Support
Pre-order the album and get one of the awesome perks on the right.
And whether or not you can contribute, please share the campaign on social media and help it infiltrate a few more brains!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Dimitri Scarlato, and I am a freelance composer and conductor who works in contemporary classic music, opera and films/theatre.

I have a huge passion for opera, especially contemporary opera and I was lucky enough to have 2 of my own operas fully staged and produced. That is why last January 2016, I launched the Stara Zagora Opera Competition for composers, stage directors and singers, to reach out to young talented artists. This competition has been supported by the Stara Zagora Opera House in Bulgaria, thanks to its artistic director Ognian Dragonoff. 

An international panel of composers, conductors and stage directors, has discovered some very gifted composers, singers and young stage directors. We have selected 3 new operas, which will be premiered on the 22nd March 2017 at the Stara Zagora Opera House.

The  3 operas are based on social issues of our contemporaneity.

  • If you would support this project you would help emerging artists to realise their dream of being part of a new operatic project, you would give the unique opportunity to composers to see their operas fully stage in a theatre. There are many talented people who have not the chance to showcase their skills and their creativity because of a lack of opportunities. That is why your contribution would be vital to nurture these talents!

What We Need & What You Get

  • The theatre is supporting this project by giving its resources for 17 days (additional staff, set designer, equipment, costumes, free rehearsal spaces, orchestra, dancers).   Your support would be vital in making this happening, by contributing to part of the expenses that staging 3 new operas requires such as:
  1. Part of the costs (travel, accommodation, living expenses) of 10 artists  (3 composers, 1 stage director, 6 singers) coming from all over Europe for 17 days. £3400
  2. Professional audio/video recording of some rehearsals and the staged performance which will happen on the 22nd March 2017. Estimated price £1300
  3. Additional set design and costumes expenses. Estimated price £700
  4. Indiegogo fees. Estimated price £600

We have devised lots of operatic perks for you, which you can also use for a friend or a person you care about!

The funds will still go towards all the costs described above, even if we don't hit the main target. But with your help we can reach the £6000 target!

The Impact

If you are passionate about contemporary music, singing, and opera, then your donation could have a huge impact on the career of those emerging artists, who are developing their craft! There are more than 40 people involved in this project, and they all share the passion and commitment to develop and launch new operas!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate, please share the campaign and help us reach out your friends and connections! All together we can help emerging artists and realise new wonderful operas available for everyone around the world!

Thank you from all of us!

http://www.dimitriscarlato.com/

http://karlfiorini.com/

story:
(Update: WOW.  We hoped to make our goal by the end of the 60 day period.  We never expected that everyone would exceed our target within 4 days!  We are filled with gratitude and can't thank all of you enough.  No specific stretch goals - any further contributions will simply go to making more copies for the bands!  Thanks again - you are all completely awesome!)

A Flame In The Dark is a yearly compilation CD, focusing on U.S. Power Metal bands that would benefit from additional exposure to a wider audience.  We distribute these CDs for free at major festivals and shows and provide a large number of copies to the participating bands to hand out at local shows, thus spreading the music across the United States and Canada. We do not accept money from the bands selected for each year – they provide their best new track, and we make sure we get it to as many ears as possible.

We started in 2014 as a self-funded organization, producing 300 copies out of our own pockets.  In 2015, with a simple donation campaign spread by word of mouth, we were able to produce 600 copies, including 200 that were distributed at ProgPower USA's infamous afterparties and by Divebomb Records. This year, we’re shooting for the moon and hoping to produce at least 1500 copies, with every dollar raised going to making more CDs.

Any perks (including shirts, all CD shipping, and meals) and the artwork costs are paid out of our own pockets, leaving every dollar contributed going to the production of even more CDs, which means more discs to hand out and more for the bands themselves to use to promote the scene.

Some of your favorite bands that have benefited from the previous releases of A Flame In The Dark? Seven Kingdoms, A Sound Of Thunder, Enceladus, Tanagra, Everthrone, Helion Prime, Infidel Rising, Automation, Forevers’ Fallen Grace, Skyliner, Cellador, Dire Peril, Noble Beast, Scars of Armageddon, MindMaze, ShadowStrike, Judicator, Avalon Steel, Disforia, Vacant Throne, Project: Roenwolfe, and Steamforged…. And you haven’t even seen the lineup for this year!

So, the perks are cheap and cheesy, yes, but we’re all in this to help spread the gospel of U.S. power metal.  Give til it hurts, or at least just stings a bit. Arthur and Albus would love to wear out their paws autographing pictures, and I know everyone is looking forward to Tommy and Frank making themselves look like morons for your edification.

(Regretfully, due to shipping costs, we can't offer standard perks outside of the United States.  If you would like to contribute from outside of the U. S. , private message us at our Facebook page and we'll see what we can do.)

Arthur Zaber and Albus Dumblepurr thank you for your support!


The geniuses behind A Flame In The Dark!

story:
For those who are familiar with my music, and those who aren't - I've been playing instrumental acoustic guitar or "Fingerstyle" far longer than I've been singing, writing traditional/pop songs and even gigging professionally! I am extremely excited to finally release a complete 10-track album featuring the songs I think best represent the last few years' writing sessions and life experiences. I would say without a doubt that this record is the most important to me out of the 3 I have now composed, and it's arrival has been in the back of my mind since 2011 when I first began this journey of pursuing the craft of writing deep, inspiring, soulful, acoustic music. It's been my dream to work with the folks at the top of their fields that helped produce this album: Kim Person (Tommy Emmanuel, Stephen Bennett) and Sean De Burca (CandyRat Records), but for it to finally be released I will need your help.

 

What I Need & What You Get

For my campaign I am basically hoping to recover half of the total cost of this album's production in efforts to help smooth out the "final stretch" costs of production and hopefully rent a venue for the release party! My plan was to release "Woodscapes" worldwide in March but now it looks like it's official release date will be April 15th. Production costs ended up being outside my original budget and post-production will take a bit longer to finish than expected so I want to offer pre-release CD's and digital downloads to those who contribute to this campaign as a special "Thank you" for all the support!

Contributors will receive their CD's/downloads in the mail or via email just after the campaign is finished on April 1st. (No April Fool's jokes here!) while the worldwide release online will be April 15th.

​About the Album:

Working with Kim Person, Mike Monseur and Sean De Burca has been nothing short of a dream! When I first listened to "The Mystery" by Tommy Emmanuel and "Ten" by Stephen Bennett I was just as inspired by the warm, resonant quality of the audio as I was their playing. I think Kim and I nailed something reminiscent of that sound but also unique, thanks to her impeccable knack for capturing the individual artist's "soul" and their guitar's unique tonal qualities. There are 6 brand new tracks and 4 "reimagined" tracks of some old favorites fans will recognize that are in different tunings!

While I actually made the graphics/CD covers for my first two releases with Pixlr and the contribution of some great local photographers - I knew this one HAD to be done right. If you're familiar with the modern-fingerstyle genre you're probably also acquainted with the work of Sean De Burca - whether you knew it or not. He is the designer for a majority of CandyRat Records' artwork and many other virtuoso artists pursuing high-quality music and production. It's been an honor and a privilege to work with him! 

Risks & Challenges

With the music business being what it is today, if you're not a pop-star or viral-success-prodigy then streaming music payments like those from Spotify, Apple Music and Pandora don't provide anywhere near the amount of funds needed for a project of this scale, so I am asking for your support to either pre-order 'Woodscapes' or take an even larger role and donate extra!

I have always made my living off of performing live and selling physical copies of my work so my hope is to continue doing that and maintain a lasting connection with my beloved fans.

Other Ways You Can Help

I absolutely understand money can be tight. There's a few ways you can still play a helpful role in this project -  help me spread the word about this campaign by sharing the link on social media and telling your friends, believe it or not this will make a huge difference!
