story:
Short Summary

After self releasing an EP and a mixtape, touring as a solo singer-songwriter, and working as a featured artist on projects by other artists, I am now diving into releasing a full album of my own. These songs are intimate, vulnerable, and personal, although some focus on social and political issues. They illuminate a woman’s perspective of a society slowly shifting away from toxic masculinity. 

  • I am a singer-songwriter, producer, educator and performing artist; jazz trained, hip-hop educated, and influenced by my Jewish roots. I have studied with master musicians of both American and world music genres, master poets and theater makers. I've toured nationally and internationally as a solo theater artist, singer-songwriter and backup singer for world renowned artists. I grew up dancing professionally in world folk dance and music ensemble and have decades of experience bridging the gap between professional and community art scenes centered in empowerment and social justice. I hold a BA in art and social change from Hampshire College and an MFA in music and theater from CIIS. www.sariyahidan.com
  • This campaign will help fund the completion of my debut full length album as a singer-songwriter and producer.
  • BREAKING SHADOWS is huge milestone for me personally and professionally. While I have produced other artistic projects BREAKING SHADOWS is the articulation of a vision I've held since I was a young girl. The recording will be finished predominantly in Berlin and Portugal where it is more cost effective for me to complete this process with high quality production and where local musicians are skilled in the genres I am blending. 

For a more detailed story of how this album was written and began coming together, visit my blog on my website. For questions about the campaign please email us through the contact form or email listed here. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

The main thing you get is high quality music of a unique genre and thoughtful content! You get to join me and my community in BREAKING SHADOWS. 

  • ABOUT THE PERKS: I'm thrilled that artists and teachers in my community have contributed their work to the campaign! To find out more about a particular perk package Click anywhere in the perk description box or photo and it will expand to show all details of that particular package. My personal favorite is the exclusive #MorningPages ceramic mug by Stef Grundy with excerpts of my morning pages writings hand glazed on the side and a chapbook of some of my #MorningPages writings. There are yoga classes with Sam Barber, digital art by Yagama, Joshua Coffey, and Jenelle Campion. You can donate to have me write and record a personalized song for you with low-fi production, or get creative and project coaching from me along with a t-shirt from Iraywear! I'm very much looking forward to playing house concerts and private parties as campaign perks and getting to know some of you better at these special intimate events.
  • THE MONEY: We need $8000 to finish recording and mixing the music. The additional $5000 will go towards a publicist, creating at least one music video and one performance projection to add visual components to the project, manufacture a short run of CDs and other merch.
  • ABOUT THE GOAL: If we do not make the $13,000 goal it will simply take longer to finish the album. I'm committed to making it happen. If we raise more than the goal, we'll make more videos of higher quality, press vinyl, and hire a better connected publicist to push the project farther. Donations of all amounts are greatly appreciated. You don't need to claim a perk to make a contribution AND you can always contribute a higher amount than the perk level you wish to claim.

 

 

The Impact

The completion of this album will make a huge positive impact on my career opening new doors and possibilities. The music and content I believe will make a positive impact on our society. 

  • This is an important time for nuanced material created by women, with women. I am intentionally working with other female producers and engineers on this album. The lyrical content fluctuates from melancholy to confessions and calls to action. It passionately raises concern about gender inequality, the history of racial injustice, and contributes #MeToo movement stories along with compassion for the challenges patriarchy has placed on men.

  • Musically the album is a manifestation of my intentional fusion of genres. It is my current contribution to the conversation of cultural influence and appropriation in music. I honor both influences and ancestors as a way to pay homage to the ancestral lineage of my body and the lands that I've lived on. From New York to Los Angeles, eastern European Jewish melodic cadence to Afro-Caribbean flavored hip-hop, Americana folk, jazz voicings, and a soulful backbone. The intention of my music is to embody reverence for those who have influenced me, reverence for diversity and the cultural context in which music genres have developed.

  • While this is my most ambitious project and campaign, I hold a positive track record with fundraising and have competed all the projects I set out to fund, on both Indiegogo and other platforms.

 

 

Risks and Challenges

If I am met with obstacles achieving the campaign goal and completing the project I will rely on my previous experience to push through.

  • My plan will be to take a short break, assess my creative team and our dynamics, save some money from other work, possibly shorten the length of the album, and MAKE IT HAPPEN!
  • I have experience creating high quality content on small budgets and the constantly changing realities of my collaborators.

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot make a contribution:

  • Please share the campaign with friends and all! Please follow me on whatever social media platform you prefer. You can also stream the first two singles when they release during the campaign and share those with friends. Those songs and my previous releases are on all streaming platforms including Spotify, Apple Music etc.
  • You can share the campaign on social media and email by using the share tools provided by Indiegogo to the right of the campaign video by the top of the page.

 

Thank you for your support and engagement with my work.

 

 

List of Collaborators

All songs written, composed and produced by Sariyah Idan.

 

Sariyah Idan - Vocals, Guitars, Keys, Percussion, Music Producer, Executive Producer

 

LOS ANGELES SESSIONS (phase 1)

Lynne Earls - Producer, Recording Engineer, Mixing Engineer, Melodica, Drum Programming 

Jennifer Condos - Bass

Andre De Santana - Bass

Peter Walden - Cello

Jay Belarosa - Drums

Ivan Edwards - Drums

Daniel K Mandelman - Keys, Melodica

Alberto Lopez- Percussion

Krishna Booker- Percussion

Shaunte Palmer - Pocket Trombone

Elizabeth Lee - Trombone

Dave Locke - Mastering Engineer

 

 

BERLIN SESSIONS (phase 1)

Stefan Fuhr - Bass

Christian Dawid - Clarinet, Trombone

Jan Stix - Drums

Chriz Keys - Keys

Sugbear - Lead Guitar

Gabriel Do Val - Recording Engineer

Rita Senhor - Recording Engineer

Andy Schlegel - Mixing Engineer

 

 

LOS ANGELES SESSIONS (phase 2)

Hector Guardado - Bass

Evan Berg - Drums, Percussion

Ryan Parrish - Bass Saxophone

Artson - Vocals

Sy Anon - Vocals

Jason Schimmel - Recording Engineer

 

 

PHOTO AND VIDEO

Liz Bretz - Photo

Dyalekt - Typography

Ervin Arana - Photo

Lynne Earls - Photo

Hal Masonberg - Video

Odin Rock - Video & Video Editing

You can donate to have me write and record a personalized song for you with low-fi production, or get creative and project coaching from me along with a t-shirt from Iraywear! I'm very much looking forward to playing house concerts and private parties as campaign perks and getting to know some of you better at these special intimate events.
THE MONEY: We need $8000 to finish recording and mixing the music. The additional $5000 will go towards a publicist, creating at least one music video and one performance projection to add visual components to the project, manufacture a short run of CDs and other merch.
ABOUT THE GOAL: If we do not make the $13,000 goal it will simply take longer to finish the album. I'm committed to making it happen. If we raise more than the goal, we'll make more videos of higher quality, press vinyl, and hire a better connected publicist to push the project farther. Donations of all amounts are greatly appreciated. You don't need to claim a perk to make a contribution AND you can always contribute a higher amount than the perk level you wish to claim.


 
 
The Impact
The completion of this album will make a huge positive impact on my career opening new doors and possibilities. The music and content I believe will make a positive impact on our society. 

This is an important time for nuanced material created by women, with women. I am intentionally working with other female producers and engineers on this album. The lyrical content fluctuates from melancholy to confessions and calls to action. It passionately raises concern about gender inequality, the history of racial injustice, and contributes #MeToo movement stories along with compassion for the challenges patriarchy has placed on men.
Musically the album is a manifestation of my intentional fusion of genres. It is my current contribution to the conversation of cultural influence and appropriation in music. I honor both influences and ancestors as a way to pay homage to the ancestral lineage of my body and the lands that I've lived on. From New York to Los Angeles, eastern European Jewish melodic cadence to Afro-Caribbean flavored hip-hop, Americana folk, jazz voicings, and a soulful backbone. The intention of my music is to embody reverence for those who have influenced me, reverence for diversity and the cultural context in which music genres have developed.
While this is my most ambitious project and campaign, I hold a positive track record with fundraising and have competed all the projects I set out to fund, on both Indiegogo and other platforms.

 

 
Risks and Challenges
If I am met with obstacles achieving the campaign goal and completing the project I will rely on my previous experience to push through.

My plan will be to take a short break, assess my creative team and our dynamics, save some money from other work, possibly shorten the length of the album, and MAKE IT HAPPEN!
I have experience creating high quality content on small budgets and the constantly changing realities of my collaborators.


 
 
Other Ways You Can Help
If you cannot make a contribution:

Please share the campaign with friends and all! Please follow me on whatever social media platform you prefer. You can also stream the first two singles when they release during the campaign and share those with friends. Those songs and my previous releases are on all streaming platforms including Spotify, Apple Music etc.
You can share the campaign on social media and email by using the share tools provided by Indiegogo to the right of the campaign video by the top of the page.

 
Thank you for your support and engagement with my work.
 
 List of CollaboratorsAll songs written, composed and produced by Sariyah Idan. Sariyah Idan - Vocals, Guitars, Keys, Percussion, Music Producer, Executive Producer LOS ANGELES SESSIONS (phase 1)Lynne Earls - Producer, Recording Engineer, Mixing Engineer, Melodica, Drum Programming Jennifer Condos - BassAndre De Santana - BassPeter Walden - CelloJay Belarosa - DrumsIvan Edwards - DrumsDaniel K Mandelman - Keys, MelodicaAlberto Lopez- PercussionKrishna Booker- PercussionShaunte Palmer - Pocket TromboneElizabeth Lee - TromboneDave Locke - Mastering Engineer  BERLIN SESSIONS (phase 1)Stefan Fuhr - BassChristian Dawid - Clarinet, TromboneJan Stix - DrumsChriz Keys - KeysSugbear - Lead GuitarGabriel Do Val - Recording EngineerRita Senhor - Recording EngineerAndy Schlegel - Mixing Engineer  LOS ANGELES SESSIONS (phase 2)Hector Guardado - BassEvan Berg - Drums, PercussionRyan Parrish - Bass SaxophoneArtson - VocalsSy Anon - VocalsJason Schimmel - Recording Engineer  PHOTO AND VIDEOLiz Bretz - PhotoDyalekt - TypographyErvin Arana - PhotoLynne Earls - PhotoHal Masonberg - VideoOdin Rock - Video & Video Editing

story:
Help Ayomilly Launch His Debut Album!

My name is Joel Craig, otherwise known as Ayomilly. I'm an independent recording artist from Toronto, who is passionate about creating honest music that has a positive impact on our culture and in the lives of my listeners. I’ve been making music since I was fifteen years old. Now, I’m twenty-one and I am finally ready to release my first studio album!

My goal with this campaign is to raise funds to help launch my debut project this November. The album has already been recorded, but I will need your help to finish it. Your donation will cover the cost of professional engineering, artwork, distribution, and promotion. Most importantly, you will be joining me in my mission to produce art that will have a positive influence on our society. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

The main expense that I need your help with is the cost of high-quality studio engineering. To complete my album, I will need each song to be professionally mixed and mastered. This will cost $3500 CAD. If I reach this main goal, I will have a stretch goal of $5000 CAD. These funds will cover the cost of the professional engineering of my project as well as the promotion for my album and the live-stream release event. 

Here is a breakdown of the estimated expenses for my album:

Mixing & Mastering: $3500 CAD
Social Media Promotion: $1900 CAD
Total: $5400

There are serval perks that you will receive if you choose to donate to my campaign, such as a digital copy of my album, some shoutouts, exclusive merch, and even the chance to write a bar for a future song! You can check out the perks section of my campaign for more details.  

If I do not reach my target goal, your donations will still be used to help cover the cost of mixing and mastering my album. 

 

The Impact

As I said, my goal as an artist is to create honest content that will bring positivity and hope to my listeners. My songs are heavily inspired by my faith and my story. This project is a testimony of how my faith rescued me from a life of hopelessness. By sharing my life through my music, I hope that others like me will realize their need to find hope and purpose in something greater than the things of this world. 

By contributing to my campaign, you will be joining me in my mission to produce art that will create a positive change in our culture. A lot is going on in our world right now. Twenty-Twenty has been a difficult year for so many. I believe that this project will offer my listeners hope amidst the hardship. Your support will not only encourage me but will inspire anyone who hears my music. 

To learn more about my story and my vision, you can listen to my music on all streaming platforms. You can check out the music video for my latest song, “Over Me,” on Youtube as well as the video for my first track, “Never Know,” which will be featured on the album.

 

 

Risks & Challenges

My main challenge has been finding the right engineer to mix my music. I need someone who shares my vision and my passion for my versatile sound. Luckily, I have found a great man for the job. 

Another challenge is, of course, the COVID19 pandemic. My dream was to launch this project with a concert, but because of restrictions that is not a possibility anymore. Instead, I would rather invest in promotion so that my music can reach more listeners. I also had plans to visit the United States this year to coordinate with artists there who share my vision. I still have plans to do this, but, for now, I have been able to use social media to meet other artists who love making music that speaks to a higher purpose. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Your contribution to my campaign will mean so much to me, but your overall support will impact my goals even more. There are still so many ways to support me without donating. The main way to do this is to stream and share my music. Another way is to let people in your circle know about my campaign. You can use the Indiegogo share tools to do this. This will help me out just as much as a donation. 

I am so thankful for those who have already been supporting me on my journey. I'm thankful that you have taken the time to read this page. I hope that you will consider joining me in my dream to produce uplifting music. 

 - Joel (Ayomilly) 

"So whether you eat or drink or whatever you do, do it all for the glory of God."
1 Corinthians 10:31

story:
Hello, my name's Ricky and I'm a musician based in London. 

I've wanted to make a full album for many years now, having only released EPs in the past. I wanted to hear all those other instruments that I could hear in my head when writing the songs.

This has finally been achieved (nearly 4 yrs in the making)  and its now really important to me that these songs are heard and the album given its best chance possible out there in the world!

Your help with this would be absolutely invaluable  & appreciated. Making this record has been a very collaborative process and it feels right to continue in that collaborative vein, I'd love for you to come on board and share the experience with me. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • So, now the album has been recorded and mixed, but the expense doesn't end there unfortunately. I've managed to finance things myself so far  but now need help with some of the most expensive aspects of making an album, the mastering, marketing, manufacturing and also touring. I'll break down some of the costs ..
  • Mastering - £160 per hour (And to master the album will take around 6 hours) So allowing for over running, potential amendments etc .. we're looking at £1000 .. There are cheaper mastering engineers out there but we wanted to go for the very best to bring out the dynamic elements of the album and so we have chosen the legendary Bob Katz!
  • Marketing (PR - Press) - £400 - Invaluable help that goes beyond the norm for PR from the very lovely Jasmine Robinson
  • Manufacturing - So we want a physical representation of the album and while there will be a small batch of CDs (Costing around £200) this format is becoming less popular, however, the  flip side is a rise in the popularity of vinyl, which is great .. but .. its very expensive. I've been quoted £1500 for a batch of 300. The music will of course also be available digitally. 
  • We have some beautiful artwork for the front of the album (Which I'll be talking a bit more about later) but I'm also hiring someone to design the reverse side of the album and to ensure all is correct and ready for physical release at the cost of £100
  • As you can see, the costs quickly mount up and that brings the total up to £3200 (Gulp) It would be absolutely amazing if we can hit this target and in the 'miraculous situation' that we managed to go past the target then any further funds would go towards 'musicians fees' to join me on the album launch show and subsequent tour. 
  • So, as well as simply pre-ordering the album in one of its forms there's also lots of great perks on offer, including signed prints of the album artwork (See above) by the amazingly talented and renowned artist Daria Hlazatova .. Also, House concerts, An acoustic song written & recorded for you, your child, your dog or whoever you like really and more!! 
  • I'm extremely proud of this album. It's by far the best thing I will have ever released and of course I'd like to hope that many of you will also share my enthusiasm for the project.
  • We've tried to create an album that perhaps in some ways harks back to the way music often sounded some decades ago. The songs I write are often pretty dynamic and non-standard in their style & we wanted to try and capture those elements on this record. We wanted to retain the eclectic and sometimes unusual musical style in which they were written, to really come through. 
  •  Although I believe in the open interpretation of art, there are some fairly clear themes and important messages I think that come through on this album. 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

  • I understand that not everyone can afford to help financially and if that is the case It would be much appreciated if you could help me to spread the word. Sharing posts, links to this campaign etc using the Indiegogo share tools would be fantastic!

 Although I believe in the open interpretation of art, there are some fairly clear themes and important messages I think that come through on this album. 

Other Ways You Can Help
 
I understand that not everyone can afford to help financially and if that is the case It would be much appreciated if you could help me to spread the word. Sharing posts, links to this campaign etc using the Indiegogo share tools would be fantastic!

story:
Making Music More Accessible

The heavy metal and rock music genres have some highly aesthetic songs, of which people who avoid the genres are unknowingly depriving themselves.  By arranging acoustic cover versions of these hidden gems, we can help more people have access to the experiences they're missing.

What Your Funds Help Provide

Making a high-quality, highly technical recording takes a lot of effort by a lot of folks:

  • Recording studio engineers
  • Other musicians in the recording
  • Mastering helps make albums sound their best
  • The original songwriters deserve their royalties, too!

All the above costs about $250 per song, some more, some less.  With 16 songs in total planned for the album, that comes to $4,000.

What you'll get for backing the project

  • Everyone giving $10+ will receive a pre-release digital copy of the album.
  • Backers giving $25+ may receive a limited edition CD if we have 50 or more backers at this level of patronage.
  • For $250, you (or your company) will be listed as the sponsor of one of the songs.
  • Or, if you have another option, feel free to contact Danny directly at narcolepianist@hotmail.com 

Why is Danny the right person to make this project happen?

The simple answer is, I have the right set of skills for the task.  The longer answer is:

  • I have been a masters degree-level music therapist for over a decade
  • I am trained as a vocalist, instrumentalist, conductor, and composer
  • I have performed as a soloist, in choirs, musicals, operas, barbershop quartets, bands, Carnegie Hall, recording studios, music videos... the list continues.  (If you have a sharp eye, you may have even seen me performing in a show currently on Netflix.)
  • I have published continuing education on advanced lyric analysis and am also an author and editor, so I really know impactful lyrics when I hear them!
  • I've put out multiple albums already, including the most recent one funded by crowdsourcing, so I know how to see a project through to completion.

You can help without donating!

If you know of someone who would enjoy hearing or backing this album, simply let them know of its existence!  Also, if you have an acquaintance who is a music blogger, a rock magazine journalist who is looking for an unusual story, or the like -- same thing; win-win!

Thank you for considering.

story:
Overview

Christopher Peifer / Suicide Mission
Pre-Order the New Album Now!

25+ years writing, recording, touring, and performing, as a collaborator, bandmate, and sometimes sideman, Chris has never been in the shadows.  At long last the time is right to embark on his first full-length record, as primary driving force.

Chris is recording the new album at Roots Cellar Studio, in a beautiful-sounding converted barn in Cold Spring, NY.  Todd Giudice is masterful at the controls, and on drums for these sessions.
Inspired by some favorite time-tested records, like Elvis Costello's "Taking Liberties," with its plentiful 2-to-3-minute catchy power pop gems, this music is highly melodic and infectious.  Additionally influenced by the likes of The Replacements, Bash & Pop, Hüsker Dü, Bob Mould, The Figgs, Roy Orbison, Nick Lowe, Big Star (and maybe a little tequila), Chris is forming a new regional trio, and will release the new album and begin touring in 2020.

With The Kowalskis, Sir, and Frances Farmer My Hero, Chris has performed in 14 countries (and counting).  Formerly with Another Saturday Night, and Heavy Creatures (both receiving international critical praise), and Blockhouses (with Guy from The Figgs; record produced by Pete Donnelly), Chris additionally writes, records, and performs with Steve Shiffman & the Land of No, and Todd Giudice's Pig Iron (with Vito Luizzi of Johnny Winter and Allman Brothers).
 

What They Say

with Blockhouses:
"Essential album alert! A power pop enthusiast's dream - full of catchy, high energy tunes that just plain rock ... Christopher Peifer ... make up the formidable rhythm section that really drives these songs. Sometimes "power trio" is just a euphemism, but I can't think of a more fitting way to describe ... If you wanted a textbook demonstration of how to put the power in the pop, this is it. Punchy guitars? Check. Driving energy? Check. A chorus that will be stuck in your head from the first time you hear it? Check!" - ("Greatest Hit Songs of All Time" record review) Lord Rutledge, Faster and Louder

with Stephen Clair and the Millionaires:
"Christopher Peifer (who you may also know as the bass man with Blockhouses) was thrumming up a storm." - Greg Haymes, Nippertown
“These guys boast national-caliber talent.”  - Michael Hochanadel, The Daily Gazette

with Heavy Creatures:
" ... had my head bobbin' and toe tappin' as they tore through an assemblage of nifty little riffs, plus their bassist, Christopher Peifer, was popping off some supercool John Paul Jones-esque melodies." - (live review, KEXP showcase at Mercury Lounge) Tudd's Mudd

More here:  https://www.chrispei.com
 

What We Need & What You Get

WHAT IT COSTS / WHERE THE FUNDING GOES:
• Studio Time for Recording and Mixing:  $2,000
• Mastering:  $1,000
• Art & Layout:  $200
• CD Manufacturing & Delivery:  $400
• PR First Wave:  $250
• Transportation: each roundtrip train between NYC and Cold Spring = $26 

Choose your favorite way to enjoy our music:  Download (mp3, high quality FLAC or WAV), or CD (includes download).
 

Risks & Challenges

Timing, as they say, is everything (ha!) ... This is art and love in the time of coronavirus.  Your support directly benefits working musicians - especially at this difficult time.
That said, the record is already 75% complete, with just two more songs to track, then master, and on to the press.  So it WILL happen.  The projected release is June, 2020.
Your support will ensure the band is able to rehearse, and be ready for live shows, and tour (starting with the Northeast) in support of the record.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please help us spread the news about our pre-order. Please share the link with your friends!
https://igg.me/at/peifer

xo,
​Chris

The cover illustration to “Suicide Mission” is by Sarah MacGhee!

Sometimes "power trio" is just a euphemism, but I can't think of a more fitting way to describe ... If you wanted a textbook demonstration of how to put the power in the pop, this is it. Punchy guitars? Check. Driving energy? Check. A chorus that will be stuck in your head from the first time you hear it? Check!" - ("Greatest Hit Songs of All Time" record review) Lord Rutledge, Faster and Louderwith Stephen Clair and the Millionaires:"Christopher Peifer (who you may also know as the bass man with Blockhouses) was thrumming up a storm." - Greg Haymes, Nippertown“These guys boast national-caliber talent.”  - Michael Hochanadel, The Daily Gazettewith Heavy Creatures:" ... had my head bobbin' and toe tappin' as they tore through an assemblage of nifty little riffs, plus their bassist, Christopher Peifer, was popping off some supercool John Paul Jones-esque melodies." - (live review, KEXP showcase at Mercury Lounge) Tudd's MuddMore here:  https://www.chrispei.com What We Need & What You GetWHAT IT COSTS / WHERE THE FUNDING GOES:• Studio Time for Recording and Mixing:  $2,000• Mastering:  $1,000• Art & Layout:  $200• CD Manufacturing & Delivery:  $400• PR First Wave:  $250• Transportation: each roundtrip train between NYC and Cold Spring = $26 Choose your favorite way to enjoy our music:  Download (mp3, high quality FLAC or WAV), or CD (includes download). Risks & ChallengesTiming, as they say, is everything (ha!) ... This is art and love in the time of coronavirus.  Your support directly benefits working musicians - especially at this difficult time.That said, the record is already 75% complete, with just two more songs to track, then master, and on to the press.  So it WILL happen.  The projected release is June, 2020.Your support will ensure the band is able to rehearse, and be ready for live shows, and tour (starting with the Northeast) in support of the record. Other Ways You Can HelpSome people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:Please help us spread the news about our pre-order. Please share the link with your friends!https://igg.me/at/peiferxo,​ChrisThe cover illustration to “Suicide Mission” is by Sarah MacGhee!

story:
THE GRUNIONS are Montreal's premiere  instrumental Spy-Core/Surf-Jazz band and we need your help!  With less than a year under our belts we've managed to write enough material for our new full length album STAR FISH PRIME! We love playing live, but now's the time to get our music in the hands of our fans and music lovers alike! 

In September, Andrew, Jeremy, Christian and Nick descended upon Skybarn Studio to record the bands first single "The Dark Comet Suite" which you can find on Spotify, or listen to it here: https://soundcloud.com/thegrunions 

If you thought that was good,  just wait 'till you hear the rest!!! We are really excited to get back in the studio on October 27th, 28th and 29th to finish the rest of the album and that's where you come in! 

Our goal is  to raise 5000$ to cover studio/engineering costs as well as to offset the marketing and manufacturing costs of our album. Our campaign wraps up on October 31st, so make sure you are following us in order to get updates from the studio in the final days!!!

We have a lot of great perks in store for our supporters: vinyls, fine art portraits, a custom gibson grunion-bird (OMG), and even a mystery bag!!! We even have perks to help fulfill your rock 'n roll dreams: join us on stage to play a song, hire us as your backing band, or join us in the studio and sing on STAR FISH PRIME! 

A lot of the perks are limited so don't hesitate to participate! Let's make 2020 the year of THE GRUNIONS! 

Thank you for supporting independent artists!

story:
I spent six years in the late 70s and early 80s travelling and busking. In 1984 I had to give up music for 17 years but the inspiration to play and enjoy making and listening to music has never gone away. 

Partly as a tribute to Sonja, partly to fulfill a long time ambition and because you may enjoy listening to the songs as much as I do,   I started recording about a year ago. Now the album is almost ready.

Funding Goal:

There are 13 songs which are in the final stages of recording.

A few days more in the studio and the recording will be complete.

Then it will take 40  hours of studio time for mixing and mastering. 

The design of the cd and insert. the cost of uploading the songs to online streaming sites.

As a thank you for your help anyone who donates will receive a free signed CD.

Recording:  3  days £450

Mixing mastering: £800

Cd Design and Pressing:  £550

Publish online to streaming services: £75

Total £1875

story:
Who Is This Guy and What Does He Want?

Hey there... my name is JW-Jones, I am from Ottawa, Canada and my band is excited to be releasing our 7th CD, called 'SEVENTH HOUR'.  Mmmm... has a nice ring to it, eh?  We've toured 17 countries and 4 continents, and through our travels we've have made some cool friends.  Dan Aykroyd calls us "an amazing blues band", wrote the liner notes for one of our CDs, and even intros our promo video - http://youtu.be/NuIfTn89lcY


[SEE PRESS RELEASE FOR NEW CD BELOW]


Make A Difference:  Give And You Shall Receive!  

This is an opportunity to support real music.  In a time where so much has gone to the digital world, we're playing real grooves through tube-amps and Hammond organs to keep everything right in the music world.  We've been playing blues, rock'n'roll, and swing for over a decade.  Though we're slowly moving up the food chain, we can't do it without a little help... your help.


We're looking to raise $5,000 to cover the costs of manufacturing and shipping of promo CD's to radio, television, venues, and blues societies that will help us create a buzz about this wicked project.  It's not cheap to get the CD into the hands of each contact, but it's important!  They are the people that make it possible for us to continue writing, recording, and playing live music... and we like making music, to entertaining good folks like you!


The best part about Indie GoGo is that no pledge goes unrewarded!  On the right hand side of the screen you will notice a list of "perks" that we will offer in return for pledging your support.  

We hope to reach our goal within 15 days. Please read over all of the info, and check out our photos and videos, and feel free to comment on whatever you feel is worthy while you're at it!


Other Ways You Can Help

One of the best things that you can do to help us reach this goal is to spread the word to as many people as possible!  In this fancy modern age, word of mouth is the best messenger - so please pass this along through Facebook, Twitter, etc.  We can make this happen!



PRESS RELEASE:

BREAKING BOUNDARIES WITH THE NEW CD 'SEVENTH HOUR'

Canada's Top Touring Bluesman, JW-Jones is moving up with a boundary breaking CD.


On his 7th release, aptly titled 'Seventh Hour', Jones has teamed up with multi-Juno award winning artist/producer, Steve Dawson, to mix the album.

 

Previous releases have featured legendary guests Hubert Sumlin (Howlin' Wolf, Muddy Waters) and David "Fathead" Newman (Ray Charles); heavy-hitters Kim Wilson (Fabulous Thunderbirds) and Charlie Musselwhite; two of the most innovative guitarists of our time, Little Charlie Baty and Junior Watson; and Canadian billboard favorite, Colin James.  Jones has cut records from Hollywood to Sun Studios in Memphis.

 

Guitar World Magazine featured a CD called â€˜Guitar Masters Vol. 2â€™ that put Jones alongside guitar stars B.B. King, Jimmy Page, and Carlos Santana among others, and he recently landed an endorsement deal with Gibson guitars.

 

After performing in 17 countries, 4 continents, and releasing 6 critically acclaimed discs, it's time for a change.  No famous guests.  No fancy studios.  This is JW-Jones and his band doing what they do best - right at home, recorded in J-Dub's living room by his go-to engineer for the last decade, Jason Jaknunas.  Tracked on a crisp fall weekend, this cool release is sure to stir up some discussion about where his music is going as he soars in a vibrant new direction. 

 

Shattering visual boundaries is also an integral part of this project.  Art director and commercial photographer Mitch Lenet (Panasonic, Subaru, Bell), has developed a concept for this package with cutting edge technology that is guaranteed to turn heads in the music and fashion world.  Cyrus Hogg brings it all to life with the graphic design.

 

While keeping one foot firmly planted in the roots he came from, Jones believes that appealing to a younger audience is the most important way to ensure the evolution of blues-based music.

 

And without further adieu, here it is folks... 'Seventh Hour'.  Play It loud.

 

www.jw-jones.com

www.facebook.com/jwjonesblues

www.twitter.com/jwjonesblues

story:
It's been said that the revolution is love!

That's our guiding principal and we're excited for the opportunity to share music from our Heart & Soul! 

With the release of Dragonfly, we're launching the LuvSongs Album and inviting you to help us

Help amplify the frequency of love!

It's been an exciting year!

We’ve been working in cooperation with the Global Coherence Initiative and the Institute of HeartMath to promote a new understanding and appreciation for interconnectivity, the human heart, and love. 

When we started the LuvAmp Project our mission was to “present art, media and events that combine modern science with ancient knowledge to amplify the experience, understanding and impact of love.”

And we did! We produced the LuvAmp Festival, related media, and the music videos for Come to me, yet and Dragonfly. And now... next level... it’s all about the music! 

Our labor of love...

has culminated in LuvSongs: an interactive ceremonial performance that fuses contemporary “science of the heart” with ancient ritual traditions and modern devotional music.  It has become our signature experience: music, community, interconnectivity, and a hyper uplift of love! Because the response has been so enthusiastic, we're recording a collection of LuvSongs favorites and creating the LuvSongs album - produced by Joshua Meltzer and David Bergeaud.

In short, music is the heartbeat of the LuvAmp project. And with your support, we’d like to share it and why we do it with the world!

Why? 

Modern science is confirming what we intuitively know – that there’s a tangible connection between the heart, the mind and the world. Waves and vibrations connect us to the world and each other.  Recent scientific research on heart-brain connection suggests that:

1. The heart is far more than a simple pump. The heart is, in fact, a highly complex, self-organized information processing center that profoundly influences the way we perceive and respond to the world. When we feel positive emotions like love, gratitude and compassion the heart and mind move into a state called, “coherence”.

2. The heart produces the largest rhythmic electromagnetic field in the body. And emotional information appears to modulate into that field impacting the world around us.

Hypothesis: Human emotion can have a measurable impact on the earth.

That’s some news! And if you feel it, help us share it.

We need to raise approximately, $5000 to complete production underway on the LuvSongs CD. The funds will pay for recording, mixing/mastering, and Eco CD packaging that will help share the message and the love! If we're over funded (yes please!) we'll put the funds towards our LuvSongs Documentary!*

Visit our website and see all we’ve accomplished so far.

For your support you get the music, our love and deep gratitude, the cool luv perks listed to the right, and the satisfaction of knowing you’ve helped amplify the frequency of love!

And whether you can contribute financially or not, please help by spreading the word and sharing our campaign to amplify the LUV!!!

We'll contact you at the close of the campaign for your hoodie color choice and size.



       

       


*The Doc: 

We'll ultimately be making a documentary of the same title that will feature awesome, amazing folks sharing their thoughts on, what else... love. We've already received confirmations of participation from, among others, Charles Eisentein, David Wolfe, Howard Martin: the Institute of HeartMath, Chief Marvin Swallow: roadman of the Native American Church and ceremonial Chief in the Lakota tradition, Dr. Neal Marshall Goldsmith, and more to be announced.

story:
My Story

My name is Jennifer Athena Galatis a composer for films, general media and classical music. I studied music at the prestigious Julliard school of music in New York with professor Oxana Yablonskaya.I have composed a collection of pieces five in total for four hands piano entitled A Conversation with Philip Glass and I want to record them at the Chapelle Historique du Bon Pasteur which is a concert hall in Montreal Canada. It will be my dream to record there because the hall owns a Fazioli piano. We only have two in Canada. Fazioli is like a Stradivarius for piano and a very rare instrument to play on. Along with the Conversations I would like to record two studies that I composed in January 2011. Besides recording I want to invite free of charge students of any age to be part of the recording in order for them to experience the Fazioli sound. The recording is set for  May 24th 2011. My goal here is to get 1000$ in order to hire a sound engineer for two hours. After the recording is complete I will publish the music in ITunes.

I will personally fund the rental of the concert hall but I am hoping to raise more money in order to hire a sound engineer and rent any recording equipment necessary.

My real goal here is to expose classical music to a younger audience. I also would like them to play the fazioli piano after recording.

I have placed links where you can listen to the music for free.
Thank you for your help.

story:
"...a more diverse take on Americana with a distinctly female tone, and quite charming." — East Bay Express

Hello and thanks for your interest in my work! Please make a donation to my latest project!

Over the past decade, I've recorded two EPs and two full-length CDs — 'Adding Water To Ashes' (2008) and '2010' — and been fortunate to have the opportunity to perform with a host of great musicians throughout California and the US. Now I'm partway through recording my latest release and am asking your support in taking it to completion. Please make a donation today and you'll be the first to receive the new tunes as well as special perks and benefits.

The songs I'm currently recording were written over the last three years of playing, writing, performing and traveling (including two several-month-long forays to India to study yoga and Carnatic voice). I think is my best work yet. Exploring faith, relationship, lineage and legacy, I'm enthused about this collection both for its lyrical content and the chance it's giving me fill in my Americana palette that much more. And I'm thrilled to be working with noted jazz artist and composer Art Khu — whose played on previous recordings — in the producer chair.

What I Need & What You Get

I'm halfway there....but your donations are crucial to covering the next half of my basic recording costs — $5000 — including studio rental, musician fees, mastering, artwork and design plus publicity and promotion. (I'm happy to send you more details if you want the full breakdown!)

Perks!

As a backer of my project, you get first listen to mixed and mastered tracks, and special benefits including original drawings, lyric sheets, and even song commisions. Moreover, you get the satisfaction of knowing you are helping independent music and musicians stay vital and alive!

Donate!

Other Ways You Can Help

No contribution is too small, whether that's cash, in-kind services  or word-of-mouth.

Please join my promo team and share my campaign on Facebook, Twitter, YouTube, Pinterist and wherever else you know music and art lovers dwell.  Indiegogo has made it really easy to share my campaign-- check out their great tools and post it to your blog or ? I welcome your ideas and feedback.

With much gratitude and appreciation, 

Deborah

"Deborah Crooks makes the case for a return to the roots of rock"- Consequence of Sound

story:
Greetings,

We are The Ancient Order from Toronto, ON, CANADA.

Album DEMO - 08 - The Slumber

Album DEMO - 09 - [r]Evolution

As it stands, we are in the final stages of mixing and mastering our first full length, 13 song concept album based on the evolution of consciousness, and we would love your help.

There will be many different incentives and packages that will include buttons, magnets, patches, posters, T-shirts, CD's, Vinyls, handwritten lyrics and private shows. Most incentives will have a limit; we just want to get enough money to finish post production of the album and create some great lasting impressions for our fans.

The plan is to release the album digitally to the public in early January 2015 and pledges will be redeemed March 2015.
 
www.theancientorder.ca

Since the beginning of time, man has always been fascinated with the ever eluding metaphysical questions of who we are, why we are here, where we have come from and where we are going.  What we've come to realize however, is that it's not the answers that deserve our attention, but the questions that follow.  The answers can be anything we want.  The possibilities are endless.  As Pierre Teilhard de Chardin once said, "We are spiritual beings having a human experience."  It's about time we all wake up. 

Taking a closer look at the social, political and economic structures of our world, it's clear to see our most troubling problems are systemic.  But real change comes from within.  However cliche it may sound, however easier said than done, we hold this to be as true for us as a band as we do for ourselves, individually.

Music is the universal language that isolates time and space.  It allows for information to be experienced as vibratory frequencies that shape our perceptions of understanding reality.  What better way to influence change than to bring awareness to issues that matter and inspire hope through song.

here are just a few of the lyrics on the album

01 )  Totem
Show me the way shaman, Show me a sign
The Ancient prophets were right, time and place is divine
Day and night is sacred, nature's greater design
A higher essence of being we as a people combined

02)  Amen Ra
Underworld duality, a great barrier inside leaves me divided
Read between the lies and redefine this
Superstitious mind
Identify that we are holy and divine!

03)  Temple
Spirit guide, moonbeam lunar eclipse the shifting tides
Sun fire light
Third eye open wide!
Free your mind --- Zero point --- Energize
Chakra's all align, this sacred shrine!

04) Money Tree   ///   2012 Demo [r]Evolution - 01
Central banks control economies
Unholy oil crusade, send in the tanks spreading democracy!
It's the foreign state policy!
Of the Money, Tree of Money, of Money, Tree of Money
Cut down that Money Tree!

05) Peace
Gather 'round the fire ablaze, burning flames of the funeral pyre
Ashes of a fallen empire
Tend the garden's temple, heal the soul, source of energy.
Let the rain dance begin.

06) Warrior
Simple Soldier, marching on
Into battle, sound the alarm
Enemy at the gates, a call to arms
Hear the sirens ring, dispatching the infantry!

07) Shadow
Found my mind like an open book, lost on the top shelf
The dusty pages, a mere reflection of a thought
And I am falling into my shadow self
Black days of darkness, skies of lightning strike down
So profound

08) The Slumber   ///   2012 Demo [r]Evolution - 02
And the burden is on the few of us.
Rise and wake me from this slumber,
Break the spell I'm under,
Light of day, Love is the way
Illuminate

09) - [r]Evolution   ///   2012 Demo [r]Evolution - 03
Impulse, power shift
Flicker of consciousness
Ancient wisdom mixed with futuristic technology
We're not alone
Epic trip spaceship explorer
Warp speed worm hole!

10) Alien
First contact seems so familiar
Reflection in the mirror
Fall back in disbelief, all my doubts disappear
No fear
Death is only as real, as this reality
Marvelous and inspiring beyond the unknown
Home sweet home

11) Seed
With my ear I hear the forest story
With my voice I speak in ancient tounges
With my hands I plant the seed, see it growing
With my love I feed the roots of love!

12) Initiation (Instrumental)

13) D.M.T.
Deep in the gene, the chromosome, the cosmic double helix
from a distant galaxy
Supernova nebula universal multidimensional time machine

All tracks were professionally recorded by producer Michael Phillips at top end Canadian studios: Revolution Recording, Rattlebox and Phase One.

There will be many different incentives and packages that will include buttons, magnets, patches, posters, T-shirts, CD's, Vinyls, handwritten lyrics and private shows. Most incentives will have a limit; we just want to get enough money to finish post production of the album and create some great lasting impressions for our fans.

The plan is to release the album digitally to the public in early January 2015 and pledges will be redeemed March 2015.
 
www.theancientorder.ca


Our Goal

We would like to raise $10,000 CDN to complete the post production process of the album and let the fans have a part in owning a piece of our history.  There will be everything from special edition CD's, T-shirts and posters, to signed studio drum skins and handwritten lyrics.  Design details will be announced soon.

The money will go towards final production costs, mastering, distribution and promotion.  If you don't have the money, but still want to help out, please share this campaign with your friends and post it on your social media pages.  We appreciate any support you are willing or able to give.

Note - If we do not reach our goal, this album will still be a reality and released digitally on January 5th, 2015.

COSTS                                                                                                                                            Drum recording - Revolution Recording - $5000 - recording time and drum rental   Bass recording - Oak Studios - $1500 - recording time and gear rental                 Guitar recording - Rattlebox Studios - $1500 - recording time and gear                 Vocal recording - Cottage on a Lake - $1000 - gear rental                                            Violin recording - Revolution Recording - $4500 - recording time & personnel      Recording, Mixing, Production costs - $5555.55                                                         Artwork - Jonah K - Sigil and Logo - $500                                                                         Artwork - Ryan VanSteenburgh - Crowdfunding Video - $500                                       Artwork - To be Announced - Special edition Poster / CD artwork - $350 

Thank you,

The Ancient Order                                                                                                                         Matt Allen / Andrew House / Andrew Murray / Jeremy Lloyd

Greetings,

We are The Ancient Order from Toronto, ON, CANADA.  

Album DEMO - 08 - The SlumberAlbum DEMO - 09 - [r]EvolutionAs it stands, we are in the final stages of mixing and mastering our first full 
length, 13 song concept album based on the evolution of consciousness, and we would love your help.There will be many different incentives and packages that will include 
buttons, magnets, patches, posters, T-shirts, CD's, Vinyls, handwritten 
lyrics and private shows.  Most incentives will have a limit; we just 
want to get enough money to finish post production of the album 
and create some great lasting impressions for our fans.The plan is to release the album digitally to the public in early 
January 2015 and pledges will be redeemed March 2015.

 www.theancientorder.caSince the beginning of time, man has always been fascinated with the ever eluding metaphysical questions of who we are,
 why we are here, where we have come from and where we are going.  What we've come to realize however, is that it's not the answers that deserve our attention, but the questions that follow.  The answers can be anything we want.  The possibilities are endless.  As Pierre Teilhard de Chardin once said, "We are
spiritual beings having a human experience."  It's about time we all wake up.  Taking a closer look at the social, political and economic structures of our world, it's clear to see our most troubling problems are systemic.  But real change comes from within.  However cliche it may sound, however easier said than done, we hold this to be as true for us as a band as we do for ourselves, individually.Music is the universal language that isolates time and space.  It allows for information to be experienced as vibratory frequencies that shape our perceptions of understanding reality.  What better way to influence change than to bring awareness to issues that matter and inspire hope through song.here are just a few of the lyrics on the album01 )  TotemShow me the way shaman, Show me a signThe Ancient prophets were right, time and place is divineDay and night is sacred, nature's greater designA higher essence of being we as a people combined02)  Amen RaUnderworld duality, a great barrier inside leaves me dividedRead between the lies and redefine thisSuperstitious mindIdentify that we are holy and divine!03)  TempleSpirit guide, moonbeam lunar eclipse the shifting tidesSun fire lightThird eye open wide!Free your mind --- Zero point --- EnergizeChakra's all align, this sacred shrine!04) Money Tree   ///   2012 Demo [r]Evolution - story:
Thank you for checking out our Indiegogo page! We are The Good Fight; a rock band out of Northern Virginia. We have been writing and playing shows for over a year now. During that time we have recorded and produced demos of our own music to build a local fanbase. We are now ready to take this band to the next level. A big part of that will be nationally releasing a high quality debut album. In order to do this we will need your help. Recording, mixing and mastering are all expensive and time consuming. We are willing and able to commit as much time as necessary to this process, but do not have the funds readily available. Our goal is to record with Paul Levitt out of Maryland. He has worked with artists we love such as Circa Survive, Senses Fail, The Bled, All Time Low, The Dangerous Summer, etc. With your help we can work in this state of the art recording facility and have the opportunity to release an amazing album.

Your contribution will help us not only record, mix and master our music, but also help us take the next step as a band. Once this CD is released we will be able to get out of Northen VA and hopefully into a city near you. We know that this is the next step in the evolution of our band.

We know that not everyone has extra money that they can put into this campaign, but if you could help us spread the word that would be just as helpful! Thanks again for checking out this page and feel free to hit us up on Facebook.

www.facebook.com/TGFpoppunk

Thank you,

The Good Fight

story:
Hey, remember that one time you saw a puppy with only 3 legs and it's owner was blind and had a sign saying "please help me get my Limpy a fake leg so he doesnt keep hitting his head on the concrete and sustaining head trauma"? Well, you walked past that guy and his sad little dog and have felt guilty about it ever since. Don't. This is your opportunity to make it better. La Mission is the personification of that guy and his dog, only when you give us money we are going to use it to help change a broken system. So there wont be more brain damaged, off kilter dogs, and that guy might not be blind anymore either. Somehow.

***NOTE: Indiegogo takes payment via CREDIT CARD ONLY!  If you would like to pay with EC/Maestro Card/Bank Transfer/Paypal OR want a receipt for the German tax-man, please see our GERMANY-BASED campaign at http://www.inkubato.com/de/projekte/LaMission or http://www.inkubato.com/en/projekte/LaMission ***

***P.S.  If you would like to support La Mission with a contribution of more than 5K, we'd love to take your money.  We could fly to your location and throw you a private secret society/cult coming-of-age initiation fest with your closest friends. L.M. themed quinceaneara dress or yarmulke-n-tallit included. Contact us for information about how to pay with a check!***

WE ARE LA MISSION

Yo.  I am Pablo aka “Beaner” aka “Skirtchaser” aka “El Frijolero” etc. I am an internationally working musician and dj who has enjoyed a modicum of success, but who doesn’t like what has happened to the musical landscape vis-a-vis “conservatism” in respect to both Money and Art.  I mean the relationship of the two, okay? It sucks. And I want to change it.

This is Mandie (yo) aka “Knuckle Cartel”, a former big cheese and intellectual powerhouse behind the wildly successful Seattle-based experimental theater company Implied Violence.  I, Mandie, agree with Pablo’s qualms regarding the music scene, and I have experienced the same “conservatism” and capitalistic partnership between Money and Art in the performance/theater scene.  Witnessing firsthand the immense power that cash-wielding creeps hold over creatives is sickening, sad, and sordid.  I’ve had enough, and so have you...right?  Let’s fix a broken system.  If we can’t fix it, let’s circumvent it.

Hiya. it's Luis aka "LMGM." I'm a dancer, a writer, a scholar (and an amazing cook of Peruvian food, thankyouverymuch). Somehow, I've turned my years of experience in rave scenes and club cultures into a career as a scholar of electronic booty-shaking music (so to speak). Ethnomusicology, music anthropology, popular music studies, dance studies, gender studies, affect theory: these are all things i do in one way or another. Ever since disco crashed under the exploitative mismanagement of major record labels in the late 70s, dance music has been increasingly shaped by capitalist music markets that only recognize familiar "pop" formulae and massive sales. In the process, electronic booty-shaking music has mostly lost its connection to its original contexts. This music was (and, on some dance-floors, still is) the ass-jiggling soundtrack to the utopian nocturnal worlds of sexual, ethnic, and class outcasts of an unjust system. This history is still urgently relevant, as global neo-liberal capital systems increasingly destabilize communities, neutralize political resistance, and profit off the world's most vulnerable. I want to revive and revisit the politics of booty-shaking in an unjust world.  

BACKGROUND & CONCEPT

In every musical genre EXCEPT for electronic booty shaking music, vinyl sales are up.  In dance music, however, vinyl sales have been steadily dropping, forcing most labels to either fold or become more and more musically and conceptually conservative. This economic reality has left artists who make music that is not easily consumable or disposable up shit creek (so to say).. Self-releasing your music is not easy, people. ALSO the dance music scene (which has its roots in minority identity politics and the politics of resistance) has become a slovenly, hedonistic, individualist capital venture-cum- nightmare. So. Two birds with one stone. You’ve heard the saying.  We, La Mission, want to prove there are other ways to make, release and love music that are not about the accumulation and maintenance of capital.  Eventually we hope to inspire cultural, political, and social offshoots of La Mission.   We want to see OTHER people following our production model.  You can help us jump-start the movement by first helping us to actualize our dream project.  How?  Easy.  Join the Cult of La Mission.

CROWDFUNDING

Right now, crowd funding helps make a lot of dream projects happen.  That's because there aren't any middlemen there to determine what they think people actually want. There is no insidious profiling (PROFIT MONGERING) or archetyping going on; it's just creative people working hard to give people who appreciate their work what they want on their own terms. Crowdfunding is a socially conscious, new method of developing creative communities and raising money for projects without the rules, regulations, depressing beggary, or the rampant compromising of morals/ideals in favor of a chunk of change from governmental granting organizations and money-hungry production companies. As such, it is the ideal platform on which La Mission can introduce itself to potential consumers (blech), supporters, participants, and fellow creatives and intellectuals (double blech).  ATTENTION: Most of this past paragraph was stolen directly from successful crowdfunders ‘Project Possum’. They did a good job ‘splaining what is going on. Thanks, guys. We couldn't have done it better ourselves.  So we didn't even bother trying.  

We are currently fundraising for the first three releases/premieres of our five-part project: your money will go directly towards the creation of three records, magazines, and performances.  

 

ROUSING STATEMENTS

Brethren, Citizens, Plebes, you ALL can be a part of history if this concept takes off!  You can say you were there at the very beginning, you can say you were there before successful horizontalist/anarcho-syndicalist systems (look it up) were built, starting with fucking independent record companies! And even if you don’t give a shit about all that noise, well, we are totally offering you some amazing one-of-a-kind art and culture pieces, too.  Records!  Tracts! Patches! Performances! Sexy times!  Etcetera Etcetera et al!  You could, ya know, like, auction these things off for more than a hundred bucks at Sotheby’s someday, guys.



CONCLUSION

Instead of slaving over our keyboards in order to write a well-written and graceful summary paragraph, we are simply  going to list the expenses and costs for our FIRST THREE RELEASES AND PERFORMANCES below:

  • Mastering each record will cost 400 Euros (1200 total).
  • Pressing of the records will cost 1000 Euros.
  • Printing and design of gorgeous sleeves will cost 250 Euros each (750 total).
  • Public Relations will cost us at least 500 Euros (that’s with a generous friend discount).
  • Printing and hand-binding of each political tract will cost very little (if we steal copies like the sneaky bastards we are and force our friends into slave-labor) but at least 50 Euros each (150 total).
  • Assorted goodies included with each record (cult membership cards, Kool-Aid, Dental Dams, etc) will cost some dough, lets say about 100 Euros each (300 Euros in total).
  • Silk-screened posters and flyers for performances are labor-intensive but will only cost about 100 Euros (300 Euros total).
  • Rehearsal/performance space can also be stolen, squatted, and negotiated to a paltry sum (50 Euros or 150 Euros total).
  • Materials for the performances will cost about 200 Euros each.  We will beg, borrow, steal, and shop at the Euro Shop (aka the "Dollar Tree" in American).  Lets say 600 Euros total.


This sum equals about 2700 Euros per La Mission “Missive”.

HELP THE THREE LEGGED DOG!  Don't be a dumb jerk!

JOIN LA MISSION!

story:
the story so far...

“There are two mistakes one can make along the way to truth: not going all the way and not starting.” (Gautama Siddharta)

In March 2012 we finally finished the VERY-LOW-Budget-Pilot Movie (150min) for the upcoming mystery-series PANTHERION after 50 days of shooting with 100 completely unpaid and voluntarily contributing people and 1,5 post-production years (the uncut director's version incl. english subtitles is accessable under www.pantherion.at); we also got an excellent soundtrack (which is downloadable under http://gschier.bandcamp.com/album/pantherion-o-s-t yet) team, each artist working for no money, too. Now it's time to give something back. We'd like to honor our artists with a quality vinyl-double-album including cover artwork of the soundtrack and the world with the gift of a great new music album for conaisseurs.

Above you can see the live club concert of the soundtrackers shortly after the world premiere of the movie in Graz, Austria.

we need somebody... help!

We need 12000 $ to get the high-quality-album produced (that includes record production, graphic artwork and mastering). If we'll receive more than the target amount we'll give the rest to the artists as a fair compensation for their expenditure of time! Plus: We have some nice perks for our funders.

... rather stay here with all the madmen

PANTHERION is a fully amateur-based Austrian multimedia project with a central tv/internet series core, built on selfless help and creativity, madness and love. now we'd like to start a new level of the project. the first 6 episodes are scripted by our writers, there is a first 30-minutes-radiosode (http://www.pantherion.at/PANTHERION_radiosode01.mp3), currently 3 printed pulp-novels (http://www.pantherion.at/print.html), and, last but not least, the huge pilot episode the soundtrack was made for.

If you help us with your money we assure you to keep the PANTHERION universe financially alive and well, starting with the soundtrack vinyl-double album. with more and more quality-based products we'll more and more able to get supporters for all the other media involved in PANTHERION. We came so far with so many great people who believe in our madness that it'd be a crime to let it die.

more than one of everything

If you are unable to support us with money, please feel free to help us by spreading the word and using the indiegogo sharing tools!
And join our facebbok-page http://www.facebook.com/pantherion!
story_txt:
the story so far...
“There are two mistakes one can make along the way to truth: not going all the way and not starting.” (Gautama Siddharta)
In March 2012 we finally finished the VERY-LOW-Budget-Pilot Movie (150min) for the upcoming mystery-series PANTHERION after 50 days of shooting with 100 completely unpaid and voluntarily contributing people and 1,5 post-production years (the uncut director's version incl. english subtitles is accessable under www.pantherion.at); we also got an excellent soundtrack (which is downloadable under http://gschier.bandcamp.com/album/pantherion-o-s-t yet) team, each artist working for no money, too. Now it's time to give something back. We'd like to honor our artists with a quality vinyl-double-album including cover artwork of the soundtrack and the world with the gift of a great new music album for conaisseurs.Above you can see the live club concert of the soundtrackers shortly after the world premiere of the movie in Graz, Austria.

we need somebody... help!
We need 12000 $ to get the high-quality-album produced (that includes record production, graphic artwork and mastering). If we'll receive more than the target amount we'll give the rest to the artists as a fair compensation for their expenditure of time! Plus: We have some nice perks for our funders.

... rather stay here with all the madmen
PANTHERION is a fully amateur-based Austrian multimedia project with a central tv/internet series core, built on selfless help and creativity, madness and love. now we'd like to start a new level of the project. the first 6 episodes are scripted by our writers, there is a first 30-minutes-radiosode (http://www.pantherion.at/PANTHERION_radiosode01.mp3), currently 3 printed pulp-novels (http://www.pantherion.at/print.html), and, last but not least, the huge pilot episode the soundtrack was made for.If you help us with your money we assure you to keep the PANTHERION universe financially alive and well, starting with the soundtrack vinyl-double album. with more and more quality-based products we'll more and more able to get supporters for all the other media involved in PANTHERION. We came so far with so many great people who believe in our madness that it'd be a crime to let it die.

more than one of everything
If you are unable to support us with money, please feel free to help us by spreading the word and using the indiegogo sharing tools!And join our facebbok-page http://www.facebook.com/pantherion!

story:
In Repair is a band based in Tucson, AZ. The guys hit the studio in July 2012 in order to record their first CD, "Souvenirs". The CD has been recorded and is in the process of being mixed. But In Repair now needs to raise money in order to get the album mastered and to purchase all of the physical copies.... This is where YOU come in!

We'd like to set up a few cool perks for helping us out. Of course the CD will be available for purchase in digital and physical copies, but we also want to have a couple of fun ones as well. We know that some of our fans are not in the Tucson area, so we'd like to appeal to everyone! Take a look at our perks and if you can think of something cool we haven't thought of, let us know! We love new ideas!!

We need to get the funding completed by Sunday, October 21st. We have set a modest goal of $500, but if we could exceed that goal, you make us the five happiest guys in Pima County!

story:
Do you hunger to make a real difference in the world?

Are you frightened by and tired of all the violence in the world? The school shootings? The terrorist attacks? The murdered spouses? The rapes? The cruelty to animals?

Do you feel hopeless and helpless about making a dent in the problem? 

I'm CJ Scarlet and I believe I have a solution--10 in fact.

I am creating a company called 10 for Humanity that will develop 10 technologies to reduce violence globally by 10% in 10 years. Yes, I said "technologies". Why? Because emerging technologies are changing our world faster than you can say "Oh crap! Where's my phone?!!", and it is the future of our world.

Do you believe that in 25 years we will have found a way to decrease violence around the world? Well, if we're going to get there, we've got to start HERE. NOW.

Who Am I to Believe I Can Change the World?

Who am I NOT to do it? Who WE are (you and me) is reflected in the world around us. Changing the world isn't a choice... it's a responsibility.

And I'm just the person to help you do it. I was the victim of sexual violence and suffered for decades from the results. I've spent most of my career as a victim advocate and I hold an interdisciplinary master's degree in Human Violence. When I was Director of Victims Issues for the NC Attorney General's Office, I initiated and co-chaired the implementation of the nation's first Statewide Automated Victim Notification System--a technological solution that notified crime victims by phone before their perpetrators were released from custody. This system was chosen as the national model by the US Dept. of Justice. I am also a geek and futurist with an abiding fascination for all things technology. (Please see my LinkedIn profile at www.linkedin.com/in/rovingcoach)

I've dealt with violence at every level, but I'm sick of reacting to it; I'm ready to do something to keep it from happening at all.

But I need your help. I am honored to have been chosen to attend the summer graduate program at Singulary U (a think tank for people who are using technology to solve grand global challenges like hunger and poverty) (www.singularityu.org). While in the program, and afterwards as an alumna, I will learn about emerging technologies and make connections with people and organizations who will help me come up with ideas for and apply 10 technological solutions, and who will connect me to investors for the larger funds I'll need.

Until then, I need your help to raise $35,000 in start-up funds to begin the important work of launching the company. Funds will be used to help cover my tuition at Singularity University, develop a website and business materials, design the crowdsourcing campaign, travel to/from Singularity University and operating costs.

YOU can make a concrete difference by enabling me to launch 10 for Humanity. Will you help?

 

How You Can Help Launch 10 for Humanity

I am seeking $35,000 to cover the start-up costs for the company, including building a website, developing business collateral (business cards, etc.), paying an intern to design the crowdsourcing campaign, tuition and travel expenses to/from Raleigh NC to Silicon Valley CA, to attend SU, and general operating costs (printer ink, paper, Internet services, etc.).

When YOU make this happen, the world gets that much closer to real solutions to the frighteningly real challenge of human violence.

In return for your generous contribution, you will receive free perks that range from getting a seat at the table as we brainstorm solutions (and, if one of your ideas is used, you'll be nicely compensated!), to a coaching session with CJ Scarlet, to gaining a coveted spot on her advisory board! 

CJ has been a certified coach since 2006 and can coach you on any challenge or opportunity, personal or professional, that you are grappling with. This is your chance to work with an internationally known coach and happiness expert.

The Impact of Your Generosity

When we prevent acts of violence by 10% (or more) through the technological solutions we devise, this will translate into more than ONE BILLION acts averted! That's ONE BILLION children, women, men and animals who will not suffer at the hands of another.

And YOU will have been part of making this happen!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help with a donation today, that's okay. You can still help me achieve our goal by sharing this appeal with your friends using the Indiegogo Share Tool on this page.

Thank you SO MUCH for caring enough about the happiness of others to consider this request. Peace, CJ

story:
**note on shipping: for the perks that require shipping, please don't forget to add it into your contribution! If you forgot that, please just make a no perk contribution for the correct amount! Thanx!

 

Our story!

2011 & 2012 have been great years for all of us here with Forus. We've played more shows than ever, traveled to places we've never been, met some amazing and wonderful people and continued to follow our dream of writing and performing great music «for us»… and you ;)

One thing that truly has kept us going, though, is your enduring and never-ending support. We've seen more and more people coming out to a show for the first time (or 10th time, maybe 20th..), belting out lyrics, offering us a place to stay, and even making food, sex and musical instruments for us! All of that serves as fuel; gets us up in the morning, inspires to keep driving on those long trips in the vans, trains, planes and ultimately reminds us of the large place in your life our music holds.

After performing 70 shows crossing over thousand miles in France, Spain, Holland, Belgium, Germany, Russia, we're spending the months of June and July of 2013 with Christian Carvin & J.P Chalbos at their famous studios in France, recording our new album. The next record will feature a mix of road-tested and new never-before-heard material and is slated for an October release date. But in order for anyone to hear it we need YOUR help! 

 

What we need

To put out our new record we need in totality more than $15,000. That may sound like a lot but consider this: for a full length ten track album it will cost roughly $1000 per track to record from start to finish. It will cost an additional one to two thousand dollars to print and package in addition to feeding ourselves while we are recording and the gas to get to and from the studio. All in all when recording in the studio the expenses add up quickly. Here, we're requesting a minimum of $12,000 to ensure a down payment on the studio but we hope we can earn the whole amount here from the support of our family, friends and fans.

 

What you get

Now, to the prizes! There are 10 different perks listed to the right with a different perk for each contribution amount. We've racked our brains and come up with some great prizes that all include a download from the new album before its October release date! You can also receive hand-written lyrics, tee shirts, caps, vinyls, guitar lessons, Forus iPod nano with our entire discography (plus some extreme rarities), the limited edition Forus skateboard, guitar,…

 

Spread the word

To reach our $12,000 limit in 60 days we're going to need to get the word out to as many people as possible. So help us spread the word and you may be able to win prizes too! Tell friends, family, co-workers, crazy landlords, ex-cons and the new guy/girl who just friended you on Chat Roulette !! Twitter, Facebook, Myspace, Youtube,… it's all good !! Ultimately, we're looking to expand upon this great community we've all created and we know from experience that we can count on you to share our music and message. 

As an incentive for spreading the word we are also giving away a FREE «The DOWNLOAD» pack to the first 10 persons who :

1. "Share" the « Forus Indiegogo Campaign » page (or / and) the Youtube Video « Forus’s new album fundraiser », add in something personal or "Help FORUS put out their new record ». Share it on 10 people wall (you must prove it).

2. Post "MISSION ACCOMPLISHED" on the FORUS’s Facebook wall and add your email by private message and you’ll received a mail with a personal « Thank you » from the band, the FORUS logo in HD, two new FORUS photos in HD, «THE DOWNLOAD» pack.

Help us put out our best record yet this October by donating TODAY !!!

 

Budget

Here's a projected budget we've prepared to give you an idea.
