story:
The car won't start, and the moon is waxing full. You look up at the stars. They resemble headlights. Where are you? Do you belong here? You feel an intense desire to move, but you can't. You are rooted to the spot. You hear something calling your name. The wind, an old lover, your mother when you were just a little kid. If you could turn your head, you might know the answer. But the stars hold your gaze. You are already home. You have been dreaming for hours.

---------------------------------------------------------

Mystics Anonymous is the name of my musical project, best defined as eclectic independent rock. With Mystics, the whole point was to establish a project where nothing is off-limits. From rootsy acoustic material with jazz elements to harder alternative rock to more experimental, ambient, and score music, Mystics Anonymous has been defined by its fierce independence and adventurous eclecticism.

Well, it's been almost ten years since the last Mystics Anonymous album. While I've been playing in a number of bands, my own songs have been piling up at an alarming rate. With the support and encouragement of friends and peers, I finally began work on the next Mystics Anonymous album, titled Dreaming for Hours, and I've elicited a talented group of performers to help realize my dream.

As the project is getting closer to completion this summer, it's sounding SO great and it's becoming clear that it deserves a professional mixing & mastering job, as well as a nicely executed package with great artwork and a booklet containing art, lyrics, and liner notes. I would LOVE to make this happen, but I can't do it without YOUR help! By pre-ordering the album in one of several package deals ranging from $10 to $750, you can help make Dreaming for Hours LOOK and SOUND great.

If you help fund Dreaming for Hours, I can promise a professional and extensive mixing job, conducted in collaboration with Mark Alan Miller of Sonelab, as well as a professional mastering job (also done at Sonelab)!

I can also promise a great-looking package designed by artist Herta Silva. Herta and I are working closely together to design a real piece of visual art--a true album package you will want to hold in your hands, look through, and peruse. You can see a sneak preview of the album cover above. In addition to showcasing Herta's work, the package will also include printed lyrics and extensive liner notes detailing the large group of talented contributors on this album from a wide variety of great indie bands.

To do all of this, I'm hoping to raise $2000 to match the $2000 I have already saved to put toward finishing the project. After paying Indiegogo, the money raised through this campaign will go toward mixing (about $1,000), mastering (about $250), and package production (about $600). There are many other costs associated with creating an album, but much of this I have already paid for or saved up for. What I need from YOU is help making it SOUND and LOOK as good as it possibly can! Raising the the entire $2000 will ensure I have enough to make this album sound as good for you as it does in my head!
 
If you contribute to this campaign, this album WILL happen! Currently, my timeline is to finish recording by the end of August, mix and master in September, while also finishing up the package design. Then the album will be printed in October and I'm hoping for a November release! If you know me, or my work, you know that I am a responsible, disciplined, and dedicated performer and artist. Every penny you put in goes DIRECTLY toward making this album SOUND and LOOK great!
 
It doesn't take much to help, you can help fund the project at whatever level you're comfortable with, and every little bit counts! But the more you fund, the more you get, and the closer I come to reaching my goal!
 
If you absolutely cannot part with any money at this time, then you can STILL help by getting the word out--tell your friends! Tell your family! Anyone who loves independent music and wants to be a part of a great campaign. Indiegogo makes it easy to share campaigns with others!

Thanks so much! I really appreciate you reading this and considering helping me realize this piece of work. With any luck, it will have us all Dreaming for Hours...

 

Cheers,

Jeff

story:
Candy Brain Indiegogo Campaign

We are Candy Brain, and Industrial Rock band from New York. Since we formed in 2011, we have been working our way through the local scene. Since then we have released an EP, titled Checkerboard Master, and opened for various major acts such as Orgy, Davey Suicide, and BILE.


We have made many fans, and generated amazing support in this short time. Because of our support in a recent, we have made it onto the lineup of Triton Festival in New York City, one of the biggest festivals in Industrial and Goth music. For that, we give our deepest gratitude However, to get passed our next hurdle, we are going to need everyone's support. We plan on releasing our debut album, and a music video for our brand new single, Carnage Society, by the end of this year. 

This album and music video release can push us to much greater heights, and if we pull if off, can look on towards touring shortly after. 

This time, we are offering some nice perks for your contributions. (see below)  

$6000 Campaign

While we have poured tousands into this band before, this time, we are going to need your help for the magnitude of this project. In order to reach a professional level of quality, we are going to have to hire recording engineers, producers, photographers, and graphics designers. A heavy cost also goes into the packaging of the album. However, an equally, if not higher cost will go into the making of the Carnage Society music video. A director and crew must be hired, along with an overall budget on props, studio rental, and various other expenses. 

The Impact

In the past two years, Candy Brain has really found their audience in New York, and a few other close cities. However, we are still missing that one thing that will change us from a small local act, to an internationally known touring act. This album and music video are what we need. But most importantly, our fans are who we need the most. You have all pulled through for us before, and this time we have something much bigger, and much greater to deliver. Together we can make this a success. 

Other Ways You Can Help

You can help in other ways than a simple contribution. Share our campaign all over Facebook, Twitter, and all forms of social media. Show our music, and our campaign to anyone who may be interested. Get the word of our vision out there. Show your support.

A heavy cost also goes into the packaging of the album. However, an equally, if not higher cost will go into the making of the Carnage Society music video. A director and crew must be hired, along with an overall budget on props, studio rental, and various other expenses. 


The Impact
In the past two years, Candy Brain has really found their audience in New York, and a few other close cities. However, we are still missing that one thing that will change us from a small local act, to an internationally known touring act. This album and music video are what we need. But most importantly, our fans are who we need the most. You have all pulled through for us before, and this time we have something much bigger, and much greater to deliver. Together we can make this a success. 


Other Ways You Can Help
You can help in other ways than a simple contribution. Share our campaign all over Facebook, Twitter, and all forms of social media. Show our music, and our campaign to anyone who may be interested. Get the word of our vision out there. Show your support.

story:
Who is Radio Avenue

Two life long friends started Radio Avenue LLC with a passion for under served music genres. We have created 4 very unique online radio streams that play an incredible variety of Blues, Jazz, Folk, Lounge, Big Band, Rockabilly and Psychobilly music.  Part of our mission is to have a place for new and independent artists to have their music played. We also offer some really unique syndicated programs that you likely won't hear anywhere else.  We want to offer this experience to a much broader audience.

We Need Your Help

Our annual operating budget includes music purchases, server space, promotions and artist royalty payments. We've already invested all the upfront costs of launching our website, getting all the appropriate licenses, music purchases, creating a logo and brand, and getting our program "on the air".

We are looking to significantly expand our listener base so that we can attract underwriters/sponsors, independent artists and individual supporters.  We are trying to raise $1000 to use for promotions, marketing, and enhancing our music library.  Our plan includes ad space, expanding our facebook footprint, and a marketing plan to get the word out about Radio Avenue.

Why you should Support Us

Radio as we know it is changing. More large corporations are buying up FM stations and on demand and "program your own" stations are the latest wave. Not that there is anything wrong with that....but at Radio Avenue, we are trying to preserve the best of what "terrestrial/FM" radio could offer...on a modern internet delivered platform. And we offer great sound and high quality music choices for our listeners.

By supporting us with a donation, you will be responsible for offering radio listeners something different.

Radio Avenue's slogan is "Music as Unique as You".  We believe in that.

Other Ways You Can Help

Maybe a donation isn't in the cards for you.  That's ok.  We appreciate you took the time to look at our campaign.  We urge you to give RadioAvenue.com a listen.  We're pretty sure you'll like it...and will probably get hooked.

 

No Purchase Necessary to enter Free Drawing

To enter the drawing for a Free Internet Radio by Mutant, send us an e-mail at feedback@radioavenue.com with "Radio Drawing" in the subject and include your name and mailing address in the body of the e-mail.

story:
Hey! What're you kids trying to do?

This is what you would call a shot-gun fundraiser. Help support Field Tripp on our musical journey through AZ, NM and finally Austin, TX, where we will end up at the South by Southwest Music Festival. We're just a bunch of honest kids with okay souls working 9-5's just like you.. only we're taking off work for this.

 

Why should you give us your hard earned money?

We need to get paid somehow & gas ain't cheap. Plus we've got a bunch of cool stuff to give away with every donation made. Your money will help us pay for food, lodging, gas, production & a good time. If not we will simultaneously jump into the Grand Canyon, because that will be as far as we get without your generous donations. 

 

 

What's in it for you?

With every donation you will recieve 1 captivating, original image by the illustrious Elizabeth Christy (mo' $ = mo' detail). With every $20 contribution you get 1 copy of Super Ego Friendly a musical journey of it's own by the talented Mr. Tripply. 

 

 

Seriously though..

The money donated will greatly aid our future album productions for your future enjoyment. So, skip that late-night combo meal or naughty pay-per view flick (you'll only feel guilty in the morning) & support Field Tripp. 

 

Not Familiar?

Check us out at http://www.reverbnation.com/fieldtripp

story:
Short Summary

The Unending Thread is an independent rock band from San Fernando Valley, California. Started in the winter of 2011, The Unending Thread developed a unique sound characterized by complex rhythms and jazz textures in a post-rock context.

It has come to a point where The Unending Thread is ready to go out of the valley and share their music across the state where they hope they will be as well received as they have been at home. It doesn't stop there.

We have consistently put out material for our fans and this is a precedent we intend to continue to uphold. After all, for all the support our fans and friends have given us, it's the least we could do for them.

 

LINKS

Facebook:

https://www.facebook.com/theunendingthread

Tumblr:

http://theunendingthread.tumblr.com

BandCamp:

http://theunendingthread.bandcamp.com/album/the-forum

Twitter:

https://twitter.com/UnendingThread

story:
Short Summary

Some people in the industry refer to him as the Biggest Lil Rapper Alive, but those who know him, know that there's nothing little about his sound or his incredibly wild live shows.  After opening up for members of the Wu-Tang clan and just recently headlining his own show at Fortune Sound Club in Vancouver, Evan "E Buddah" Elman has set his sights on bringing his high energy and potent lyrics south of the Canadian border as part of a west coast tour.

The Plan

Most of the building blocks for this tour are already in place... and by that I mean we already have our "Touring Van”:

 

Travelling down the coast with writer/artist/musician/athlete Frank Mayonnaise, the duo will perform every single night, including multiple open mic sessions when they do not have shows scheduled.  Mayo will be performing under his thrash-pop alias, FisherMayne. The “vehicle” seen above, will serve very literally as a combined art piece/home for the duration of the tour.  We are hoping to acquire a few sponsors and are extremely open to the idea of redecorating and branding our van/house.

 

Why God Why?

1.Of course to gain exposure in foreign markets.

2. But also to capture and tell a ridiculous story of three very different people as they travel and perform in strange and unfamiliar environments.  (Because heights, personalities and egos are sure to clash we are bringing a 6’8” cameraman to film the chaos and mayhem that is sure to ensue.)

3. THE WORLD COULD USE ANOTHER SLICE OF BUDDAH

4.  ???????????

 

Where the Money goes

Almost all of the money will be going to surviving for 2 weeks, ie. food and gasoline.

If we have anything leftover, we will put what little is left into merch shirts, cell phone bills from getting so many girls' numbers, properly editing the footage from tour, general production of dreams coming true, prison bail, any hospital bills incurred, recording new material, lawsuits etc...

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, and we get that. There are some other things you can do to help:

-believe in us
-make some noise on social media
-food donations
-ideas for other venues/cities 
-don't h8

 

Any and all help is greatly appreciated.

Thank you so much.

Love always

Greg, Evan and René




(FisherMayne and E Buddah spending time amongst fans)

 

(Cameraman/artist/tall/the handsome one René Captain living life in the fast lane)

story:
Hey guys!  It's that time of the year again.  A time where you get a chance to help out a good cause.  A damn good cause.  This summer we are filming a music video for our cover of Right Said Fred's epic mmasterpiece "I'm Too Sexy."  We hope to release some merchandise along with the premier of the video.  We have some great ideas in mind but need a little help funding them.  Hopefully, with your help, we can make this dream a reality.  By the way, if you have not fully comprehended it yet, yes we did say "I'm Too Sexy" by Right Said Fred.  So, if you have extra cash laying around that you haven't spent on your sexy selves, we could sure use the help.

 

And, if you were wondering, yes you especially awesome people will get prizes!

 

$5-  A poster of the band signed!

 

$10- An epic KTM wrist band AND a signed poster!

 

$20- An awesome, sick, "you'll actually make friends," brand spankin new KTM shirt!

 

$50-All of what you saw previously PLUS tell us what you want and we'll try our damndest to make it happen!  Anything. ;)

 

$250- A buffet date (Buffate) with Mike "The Incredible Bulk" Valle (Worst person ever).  Bring an umbrella.

 

$500-WE WILL WRITE A SONG ABOUT YOU.  AND YES ACTUALLY PUBLISH IT.

=D

 

We thank you for your time and consideration...your clothes, your boots, and your motorcycles.

story: yikes, dumb young bands do dumb things.
story_txt: yikes, dumb young bands do dumb things.

story:
OUR STORY

Lyra is a band from Toronto Ontario. They formed in the summer of 2010. It was love at first sight (or rather first sound) After a couple months of getting familiar Lyra began gigging frequently in and around the Toronto area, bringing their bundle of psychedelic space joy to the people.
 

Eventually Lyra won the money to record their first EP in the summer of 2011. LISTEN HERE: (http://lyrasounds.com/) Now in the summer of 2012 they are attempting to record another EP, one as flamboyant and succulent as Micheal Fassbender's dreamy eyes.

 
After recording bass and drums however they have run out of money. And Like any dead broke weasel they are now mooching from the public. You might be asking, why help weasels? The answer is simple. Weasels make damn fine tunes.
 

NEEDS

 
Our goal is $1500. That's a lot of money, we know. What we also know is that it takes a lot of money to make a record these days and a lot of hard working people need to get paid, that often go unnoticed in the world of music. They do things like this:
 
$400 Mixing: So we've recorded the instruments, but all we can hear is the bass drum and piccolo flute. That's where mixing comes in
 
$400 Mastering: The song is mixed now, but when I listen to it on my ipod I can't hear anything. It's mastering's time to shine
 
$150 Artwork: Other artists need money too. The only way artists make money is through fellow artists
 
$400 Production and Duplication: The record can't exist in the real world without this one
 
$150 Copyrights: This is so in a few months you won't be hearing a new Nickelback song and be saying "that sounds strangely familiar"
 

THE RECORD

Afternoon Spores is a 4 song E.P. about how weasels steal money from unsuspecting, generous people. No. Well actually it's a record about comforts and how comforts can turn into dangerous things. You'll be clouded in blankets of texture and charming melodies, which grow into thunderstorms of driving rhythms and twisted effects. Sounds yummy right?

I STILL DON'T CARE

For those who don't know, Lyra's about caring <3 And since life has forced us to be geographically separated in the year to come, this record will act as the glue to keep us alive. You may be asking: "why fund a band who's not going to be plaing live or seeing each other for a year anyway?" The answer to this is simple too. Once this record is made it will give us all more incentive to pick up where we left off, having the best time of our lives making music together. Also, you get prizes.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

If you're like us and don't have money to give you can still help greatly by sharing this page with friends, family members, facebook and anyone else you think would be interested in hearing some new tunes from Toronto's greatest space pop quartet. Thanks so much for reading. Infinite love goes out to you

Afternoon Spores is a 4 song E.P. about how weasels steal money from unsuspecting, generous people. No. Well actually it's a record about comforts and how comforts can turn into dangerous things. You'll be clouded in blankets of texture and charming melodies, which grow into thunderstorms of driving rhythms and twisted effects. Sounds yummy right?
I STILL DON'T CARE
For those who don't know, Lyra's about caring <3 And since life has forced us to be geographically separated in the year to come, this record will act as the glue to keep us alive. You may be asking: "why fund a band who's not going to be plaing live or seeing each other for a year anyway?" The answer to this is simple too. Once this record is made it will give us all more incentive to pick up where we left off, having the best time of our lives making music together. Also, you get prizes.
OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP
If you're like us and don't have money to give you can still help greatly by sharing this page with friends, family members, facebook and anyone else you think would be interested in hearing some new tunes from Toronto's greatest space pop quartet. Thanks so much for reading. Infinite love goes out to you

story:
Our Story

The second annual Bayou n’ Brooklyn Music Festival is set for May 11-13 at the Jalopy Theatre and School of Music at 315 Columbia St. in Red Hook, Brooklyn and features legendary Cajun music performers including Al Berard, Forest Huval and Jesse Lege.  It’ll be one big party, and a real Cajun-Creole-Zydeco music scene filled with dance hall bands, community jam sessions & workshops, family dances and, of course, good eats.

Following the success of our first annual music festival, which we reached hundres of people, Bayou n' Brooklyn is looking forward to another weekend of sold-out crowds and down-home fun.  From its initial planning through our grassroots advertising campaign, our first event left a lasting impression on the Brooklyn community with musicians, roots music lovers, those new to Cajun music, and others who were pleasantly surprised to find some amazing culture surrounding this genre of music. Our team is dedicated to once again bringing Louisiana culture to Brooklyn with interactive programming and world-class musicians.

2012 Festival Bands are: Forest Huval and Al Berard, Jesse Lege & Bayou Brew, C'est Bon, Johnny Ace & Sidewalk Zydeco, Empty Bottle Ramblers, Zydegroove, Catahoula Cajun Band, Offshore Aces, Dr. Zsa's Powdered Zydeco Band, and Krewe de la Rue.

Here’s what you’ll get:

We’re asking for your pledge to produce our second year of showcasing a slice of Louisiana culture Brooklyn rarely gets to see. You’ll join in if you live nearby, but if you don’t live in Brooklyn and still love Cajun-Creole-Zydeco music, you’ll find some worthwhile memorabilia.

We need your help to ensure that our ticket prices stay at a low cost to the community. Your sponsorship will allow the festival to feature top Cajun musicians and generate local involvement. In addition, your pledge ensures this music’s continuation as an art form, community gathering, and festive dance hall event for all.

There are soft cotton black and white t-shirts with all bands listed on the back available for purchase.  Also, we have great posters featuring custom-made art, as well as festival bags.  You can help us with only $15 by pre-ordering your ticket and guaranteeing your seat or spot on the dance floor for admission.  

We need to raise $1200 in funding to pay for airfare for our Louisiana guest musicians and help fund payment to our top 10 bands. We pledge to keep our ticket prices low and yet offer you an experience of over 25 hours of top award-winning music. We’re importing authentic ingredients from Louisiana to make a real deal pot of Gumbo. And finally, we’re paying each band a percentage of this campaign’s income.  The show must go on, and this is the balance we need to reach our goal!

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word!  Tell people about Bayou n’ Brooklyn and our effort to raise money to bring authentic Cajun musicians from Louisiana. Send them links to our website, our Facebook page, and our blog. Follow us on Twitter. Help us reach the ears of everyone in the world!


There are other ways to help! Share this link on your Facebook page.  Or please feel free to contact us if you'd like to be a member of the volunteer team!  We could use some help at our event, and it would be a great way to spend the weekend, or an evening. 

Here is the schedule for this year's festival:

Friday, May 11th, 2012

5PM: Workshop for fiddle and accordion with Cedric Watson

8PM: Catahoula Cajun Band

9PM: Dr. Zsa's Powdered Zydeco Band

10:30PM: Forest Huval & Al Berard

Saturday, May 12th, 2012

12PM: Al Berard Cajun Fiddle Workshop

1:30PM: Community Jam Session

2:30PM: Empty Bottle Ramblers

4PM: Zydegroove

5:30PM: Cajun Trio: Jesse Lege, Al Berard & Darren Wallace

7PM: C'est Bon! Cajun Dance Band

8:30PM: Johnny Ace & Sidewalk Zydeco

10PM: Forest Huval, Al Berard and High Bidders

Sunday, May 13th

11AM: I Love Cajun Fiddle! Workshop for Kids

12PM: Cleoma's Ghost Workshops in Guitar Cajun-Creole fiddle, and Song

12PM: Offshore Aces-Family Dance

1:30PM: 'Unwritten Stories' Louisiana Music and Culture

2:30PM: Community Jam Session

3PM: Jesse Lege & Bayou Brew

4:30PM: Cleoma's Ghost & Friends

6PM: Al Berard & Forest Huval

7:30PM: Johnny Ace & Sidewalk Zydeco

story:
New updates!

-A Hardcover autobiography book, 'The Road Up North' will be released in conjunction with the album campaign. Get the limited edition hard cover book (only 100 copies) when you fund the campaign with the Keepsake Pack or All Merchandise Pack. Comes with CD album and cool perks!

Tell me your story

So I'm making my first full length album! Had no idea but I was furiously writing while touring my first EP - Truth is, I never stopped writing even though I was on the road. My phone recorder became my demo scratchpad capturing nuances, ideas, chorus lines and sparks that came to my head (in transit, in the green room, in the middle of a conversation, in the toilet!).

I've spent all of autumn and winter this year hiding away, piecing together the jigsaw puzzle of these soundbites with the help of Kevin Foo and Irving Koh at Beep Studios from Singapore. These are long time friends who started out as indie bands back when we were younger.

I can't wait for you to hear the full spectrum of the emotions, triumphs, stories, anecdotes, ironies that make up this new album. "Maybe Somewhere North" might just represent a surprising departure from my blues-pop influence of John Mayer, Jack Johnson, Jason Mraz. Just saying.

I invite you to jump on board this new boat I am sailing on and go up north with me before it gets crowded with everyone else. I am so excited and cannot wait to share it with you.

Your support and pre-orders will be crucial to put the wind beneath my sails. I can't wait to see you on the road!

 

What We Need & What You Get (Bundles & Perks)

We need to raise about $10,000 or more to help defray the costs of production, touring, making music videos, publicity, marketing, merchandising - the food chain surrounding an artist release - the people who work in the background to design, direct, publicize, manage and support everything from artwork design to sound recording to touring. I want to be able to feed and take care of those who directly help me get the music out there. Good professional work comes at a cost.

I have already put most of what I made and saved over the last two years towards the production of the album. The amount raised here will go towards the following...

- manufacturing of CDs and merchandise,

- designers, photographers, publicists,

- shooting music videos (yes, we wanna do more than just one!)

- touring costs for the release

- production of album, recording, mixing, mastering (if we raise enough, we might even master it at Abbey Road Studios!! Home of The Beatles!!)

What you will get

- Depending on the contribution bundle you pre-order, you will get a variety of things such as Digital Download of the entire album (mp3s), CD album, Posters, limited edition Merchandise, Tickets to the shows, before anyone else gets their hands on it.

- Super and Mega Fan Packages will give you such exclusives like hang outs with the band at the show (Singapore, Malaysia or Melbourne), afterparty, an exclusive house concert, more merchandise!

- You can start as little as $10 contribution. Every little bit helps!

- Or if you like, you can make a no obligation contribution of any amount of your choice if you prefer to give without getting anything in return. Click on 'Contribute Now' underneath funding target on the right above.

- I will thank you personally on my facebook page by name! (Let me know if you prefer to be anonymous)

 

The Impact Of Numbers

The entirety of an independent project release involves every aspect from ground up - recording, production, mastering, touring, design, press, publicity and marketing is around $40,000 - $50,000 as a conservative shoestring budget. My personal pledge towards kickstarting this project is $10,000. The additional amount raised will directly impact paying for a team to work with me on the tour, CD design, posters, merchandise and all that mentioned above. Most importantly I want to bring my awesome band with me on tour! =)

$5000 raised on this campaign will help us get the basics of the release in place. $10,000 or more will help us bring the album mastering to Abbey Road and place the album on the commercial map and do a whole lot more.

It will of course bring the band on tour. Every additional person adds flights, transport, accomodation, living expenses, visas, permit fees when we go to a different city to tour.

We hope to be able to go back to most, if not, all the cities I have performed in 2011. Predominantly, the asian and australian cities. We are planning a South East Asian tour together with a national Australian tour. All this depends on how much budget we can raise.

Other Ways You Can Help

There are so many ways you can help other than contributing financially. Here are some suggestions,

- Tell your friends about the campaign,

- Use the share button and spread it on social media,

- Share the video,

- Like this campaign.

- Bring us to your city by starting a word of mouth campaign. A budget of around AUD$5000 will be enough to cover flights and expenses to bring the band into your city and perform a concert for up to a few hundred people. Send us an email to wenona@soulmannalive.com if you like to explore such a possibility.

 

All rights reserved. 2012 SmallBatch Records.

story:
Help support the educational programs in our local schools. Columbia County Orchestra shares music with area schools with your help. Please help by giving. Use this link to contribute. No amount is too small. 

To learn more about our organization please visit our site http://www.columbiacco.org

story:
Purpose:

We are AMP and for the past 3 years, we have strived to create music that glorifies God and encourages the Body of Christ.  

This campaign will enable us to produce more content, fulfilling what we believe God has called us to.  Your support will help us to serve you and others with music & media, and continue to reach a generation who needs to hear the Gospel.

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to raise $30,000 through this campaign. This will allow us to invest in resources that will help us to produce more music, videos, and overall content.  We are hoping to release at least 4 projects in 2013 consisting of another AMP album and solo albums from Sam Ock, J.Han, and CL and releasing more consistant video content.

We are offering cool perks for different giving levels, which you can check out on the side, including free CD's & T-Shirts, to an exclusive song written just for you, and even spending a day in the studio with us!

The Impact

This campaign is important to us because it will fuel what we believe is the good work that God has prepared in advance for us to do (Eph 2:10). We've been so encouraged by messages, comments, emails, etc. of how AMP's music has been blessing people, strengthening them during hard times, even leading some back to Christ; we desire to continue to be an encouragement to the Church and a beacon to the lost.

Other Ways You Can Help

Other ways to support us are to help promote this campaign, sharing it with your friends on your veious social media outlets, and more than that, we ask for your spiritual support in prayer!

Thank you for taking your time and we hope that you would find it in your heart to continually support us in our endeavors to fulfill our calling to encourage all of God's people!

story:
About the Campaign

     My name is Brooke Murray. I am a former member and the current choreographer for the Sterling Silvertones Show Choir. I have been choreographing for the Silvertones since 2007, when I graduated from the high school and completed my fourth year as a member of the group.
     This campaign is important, not only to me but to the 40+ students who have worked tirelessly and enthusiastically to create a show that is complex and entertaining. To family, friends, co-workers and anyone who likes to support the arts in small-town communities, please donate to send this group to New York, because they REALLY deserve it.

     WHY THEY DESERVE IT:

     In past years the group was great, but this year is different. When we began the process to create this year’s show, instead of learning choreography we started with a discussion. We discussed the qualities of the movement and themes of the songs, but most importantly about how the bar of expectations for the group will be raised. The choral director and I challenged the students to think outside of the box in terms of choreography, but we also challenged them to behave more professionally as individuals and as a unified group.
     Within a week we saw a noticeable change in the attitude of the group. Upperclassmen and new members collaborated to take on the challenges. I was baffled to discover the passion that these students had about performing. I was also surprised to learn that so many of the students had such high levels of dedication and leadership potential.
     We began creating this year’s show without any intention to go to competition. The group has tried to go away on trips to compete in previous years, but due to economic troubles the trips were cancelled because too many students were unable to cover the costs of the trips.

     SO, WHY SHOULD YOU DONATE TO THIS CAMPAIGN?

      You should donate because the students of this group have gone above and beyond all expectations. These students have grown as individuals and as a TEAM since the first day of working on the show.  
      Your contributions will help to send this well-deserving group of students on what could be a trip of a lifetime. When I was in the group we went away on competitions every year. We were fortunate enough to be able to afford the cost of the bus, meals, hotel rooms and other expenses. Looking back though, each trip was worth every penny for the memories that were created.
      These students DESERVE the chance to compete against other show choirs, to see the caliber of performance of other groups their age, and to create amazing memories. The cost for each student is about $500. Five hundred extra dollars is not easy to come by for most families from our area, especially for families of Seniors with expenses for testing, college applications and the traditional senior trip. These students should NOT have to miss out on this wonderful opportunity! Our goal amount to be raised is $5,000. It sounds hefty, but if we reach our goal we will be able to defray the cost per student by about $100. So PLEASE CONTRIBUTE so that EACH member can afford this opportunity! Your contributions will prove to them that WITH HARD WORK COMES GREAT REWARD!! 

What We Need & What You Get

      As stated above, we are trying to raise at least $5,000 to defray the cost of the bus, hotel, competition and other extraneous costs like meals by about $100 for each student. 

What do you get in return?
     We will be enlessly appreciative no matter what type of support you provide. However, we do have special perks for those who contribute!


Contribute Between $1 and $49- 
    Eternal Gratitude! We are thankful for any contribution amount that you are able to make. No matter how much you contribute, just know that we are incredibly grateful! 


Contribute Between $50 and $149 

    Receive Eternal Gratitude PLUS your name will be seen in the program at the Spring Choral Concert 2013 at Sterling High School!

Contribute Between $150 and $249-
    You will receive Eternal Gratitude, your name in the program AND we will send you a personalized Thank-You Group Photograph from a member of the group! This post card will be a personal expression of graditude hand-written by a member of the group along with a photograph of the group. This perk will be great to hang on your fridge as a reminder of how you helped to send the Sterling Silvertones to New York!


Contribute Between $250 and $999
     You will receive Eternal Gratitude, your name in the program AND we will send you a DVD copy of the Silvertones performing this year's show at the Preview Performance from October 3rd. This is the first performance of the show in costume and in front of an audience! See for yourself what the group has been working on, and what they will be performing at competition with the help of your generous contribution!

 
Contribute $1,000 +

      Hey Big Spender! With an incredible contribution of $1,000 you will receive Eternal Gratitude, your name in the program AND members of the Silvertones will perform for you at a place and date agreed upon by the director and the contributor. Do you work at a school? Does your office need a little mid-day entertainment? Members of the Silvertones will gladly perform live in appreciation for your contribution!

What if the $5,000 goal is not reached? 
       If our goal is not reached, we will use all contributions towards costs of the trip. If the group does NOT attend the competition this year contributions will be saved and used by the Sterling High School Choral Boosters towards future shows and trips. Your contributions will not be wasted! Every penny counts!

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute, but want to help?
      Please share this campaign with your friends! Spread the word! If you know someone who you think might be interested in contributing to our group, please send them the link! 
 
Thanks for the support!


SPECIAL THANKS TO KELLY CLAYTON AND ED MUSKA FOR THEIR HELP PUTTING THIS TOGETHER!

It sounds hefty, but if we reach our goal we will be able to defray the cost per student by about $100. So PLEASE CONTRIBUTE so that EACH member can afford this opportunity! Your contributions will prove to them that WITH HARD WORK COMES GREAT REWARD!! 


What We Need & What You Get
      As stated above, we are trying to raise at least $5,000 to defray the cost of the bus, hotel, competition and other extraneous costs like meals by about $100 for each student. What do you get in return?     We will be enlessly appreciative no matter what type of support you provide. However, we do have special perks for those who contribute!
Contribute Between $1 and $49-     Eternal Gratitude! We are thankful for any contribution amount that you are able to make. No matter how much you contribute, just know that we are incredibly grateful! 
Contribute Between $50 and $149 
    Receive Eternal Gratitude PLUS your name will be seen in the program at the Spring Choral Concert 2013 at Sterling High School!
Contribute Between $150 and $249-    You will receive Eternal Gratitude, your name in the program AND we will send you a personalized Thank-You Group Photograph from a member of the group! This post card will be a personal expression of graditude hand-written by a member of the group along with a photograph of the group. This perk will be great to hang on your fridge as a reminder of how you helped to send the Sterling Silvertones to New York!
Contribute Between $250 and $999     You will receive Eternal Gratitude, your name in the program AND we will send you a DVD copy of the Silvertones performing this year's show at the Preview Performance from October 3rd. This is the first performance of the show in costume and in front of an audience! See for yourself what the group has been working on, and what they will be performing at competition with the help of your generous contribution!
 Contribute $1,000 +
      Hey Big Spender! With an incredible contribution of $1,000 you will receive Eternal Gratitude, your name in the program AND members of the Silvertones will perform for you at a place and date agreed upon by the director and the contributor. Do you work at a school? Does your office need a little mid-day entertainment? Members of the Silvertones will gladly perform live in appreciation for your contribution!
What if the $5,000 goal is not reached?        If our goal is not reached, we will use all contributions towards costs of the trip. If the group does NOT attend the competition this year contributions will be saved and used by the Sterling High School Choral Boosters towards future shows and trips. Your contributions will not be wasted! Every penny counts!


Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute, but want to help?      Please share this campaign with your friends! Spread the word! If you know someone who you think might be interested in contributing to our group, please send them the link!  Thanks for the support!SPECIAL THANKS TO KELLY CLAYTON AND ED MUSKA FOR THEIR HELP PUTTING THIS TOGETHER!

story:
Short Summary

Hello!

We are Big City Supreme, a 100% independent rock and roll band hailing from Edmonton, Alberta, Canada and we make fun rockin' music for the people to get down to. 

There comes a time in every bands life when they must hit the studio in order to progress their musical career.  That time is now for Big City Supreme.  As many of you know we have been rocking for a couple years now, taking pride in putting on a full out, fun, energetic live rock show.  We put out a three song sampler EP in late 2011 with the promise of an upcoming album but unfortunately that album has been delayed multiple times until now.  Finally we are hitting the studio in July to finish our first full length album and we need your help!

We have enjoyed local success and gained many friends and fans and thats why this album is so important to us.  We want to give the fans more music and want to show the world what we can do.  It is time to take this band to the next level and we truly believe having a full length album will open many doors for us.  Your contribution and support will be eternally appreciated and never forgotten. 

What We Need & What You Get

Recording an album is not cheap.  Not only does it take hours, days, months, and years of practicing and writing but there are many facets involved with the recording process.  We are hoping to raise $5000 to help cover the costs of recording, artwork, and CD pressing.  Here are some of the costs we will incur:

  • Studio time = $75/hour x 24 hours = $1800
  • Mixing = $75/hour x 35 hours = $2625
  • Mastering = $75/hour x 9 hours = $675
  • Album Artwork = $1000
  • Pressing = $2000
  • Rehearsal Space = $450/month
  • Band Member Salary = $0

Running total = $8550+

 

Now don't think we would ask for support and not give you something in return!  Along with the satisfaction of knowing you helped us create this album we have set up some awesome perks for all contributors!  Check them out below to see what you can get.

 

If you are unable to donate we will still love you.  Feel free to help us by spreading the word to all of your friends. 

 

Visit us at www.facebook.com/bigcitysupreme

Follow us on Twitter at www.twitter.com/bigcitysupreme

 

Rock on and thanks for supporting Big City Supreme!

Dallas, Denver, James and Colin.

story:
Salut mes amis!

Le deuxième album est presque fini!

Il manque à faire le mixage et le mastering afin de pouvoir vous présenter la nouvelle musique que nous avons enregistré au Studio Victor à Montréal.

Entre autres, la chanson du vidéo "San Juan" (St-Jean) une chanson que j'ai composé sur le quai de St-Jean-Port-Joli et que la superbe Geneviève Jodoin interprète d'une façon SUBLIME.

Il y a de belles surprises dans ce nouvel album, des artistes invités comme: Michel Donato (à la contrebasse-Jazz) et Geneviève Jodoin (à la voix solo et back vocals) entre autres.

Après avoir fait la première partie de Paco de Lucia et de Cesaria Evora notre projet a encore besoin un petit support de votre part.

Voir un extrait de la première partie de Cesaria Evora à la Place des Arts (Salle Wilfrid-Pelletier): 

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dU1I7nk-Hcc

Ce dont nous avons besoin:

  • Nous avons eu une subvention de FACTOR de 10.000$ pour faire le deuxième album. 
  • Mais le coût total pour la réalisation de cet album est de 16.500$
  • La date de lancement d'album est pour octobre 2013 car entre la période d'automne 2013 jusqu'à la fin de l'hiver 2014 c'est le temps imparti pour vendre le nouveau show et ansi partir en tournée en 2014-2015 pour vous présenter les nouvelles chansons.
  • Nous devons finir les étapes de mixages et mastering avant le mois de julliet 2013.
  • Si nous n'atteignons pas l'objecttif de 6.500$, le montant ramassé sera utilisé pour l'album. Les fonds manquants seront compenser par la vente des instruments (guitares electriques, amplificateurs, guitares acoustiques, etc.). Ironiquement, nous avons besoin des instruments pour jouer mais, nous avons besoin du nouveau album pour pouvoir remonter sur la scène.

Le deuxième album

Il a beaucoup des gens qui nous demandent constamment: "À quand le prochain spectacle?" 

Nous avons très envie de monter sur scène pour vous faire vivre une nouvelle expérience avec ce nouvel album.

Même dans le milieu artistique (les diffuseurs, les festivals, les radios, les théâtres) attendent et demandent ce deuxième album!

Cette étape est un moment très important dans la vie d'un artiste car ça représente la continuité, l'implantation et l'évolution d'un projet.

Ce que nous avons fait avec le premier album

Les premières parties de Paco de Lucia et Cesaria Evora, les tournées au Méxique et au reste du Canada et, être dans les "charts" des radios nationales (entre la 1ère et 10ème position pendant l'année 2011) nous a permis de vous montrer nos capacité artistiques.

Maintenant c'est le temps de vous montrer l'évolution que nous avons acquis avec toutes ces éxperiences à travers notre nouvel album CARNAVAL.

D'autres façons d'aider

Toute aide économique est bienvenue: les petits, les moyens et grands montants.

Et pour ceux qui voudraient nous aider mais qui n'ont pas les moyens économiques, SVP, passer le mot à vos amis.

Le "bouche à oreille" a toujours été la meilleure manière de vous avoir comme public lors de nos spectacles!

 

 

Je vous aime!

 

Jorge

story:
About Brie and Mary

Mary Richard is an 18 year old singer/songwriter from Miami, Florida trying to change lives through her music. At 16, Mary founded the first ever peer-run texting hotline that caters to teens and young adults that deal with with suicidal thoughts and/or actions, self-injury, eating disorders, etc. Mary connects her music with her experiences with deprssion in order to better connect with people and show them they are not alone.

Brie Goldsobel is a 20 year old singer/songwriter from Jupiter, FL, who's main goal is to inspire anyone and everyone that listens to her music. Her songs range from changing the world, to equal rights, to taking chances, to clever, witty pop songs about past relationships. Right when she walks on stage with her bubbly personality, you know you are in for a good time.
Although you wouldn't think it by looking at her, she has one of the most powerful, unique voices out there, which is sure to take many people pleasantly by surprise.
She has a go-getting mind set, and she isn't slowing down anytime soon, or ever, which is evident in lyrics you find in her song "Rising up:"

"I climb a tree, you cut down the branches
I go to build a fire, you burn out the matches
When will you learn I'm never slowing down
I fly to the moon, you rediscover Mars
You need your friends, all I need is my guitar.."

Mary and Brie would love to go on tour to better connect with people and make new friends and fans by sharing their music with different audiences around the US! It would be such an amazing accomplishment for both Mary and Brie to be able to start living their dream, but we need your help to do so! Even $1 can make a difference!

What We Need & What You Get

Here's where you come in. We will need your help to raise enough money to be able to go on this tour. All the money we raise will go towards gas, food, shelter and other expenses we may need to cover while on the road.

By helping fund our goal, you will recieve different packages of things Mary and Brie will make available to you such as exclusive MP3 tracks of previously unreleased songs, signed photos, shout outs, personal phone calls from Mary and Brie, tickets to a show near you, even a private intimate acoustic show!

The Impact

As stated earlier, even $1 can make a difference. Brie and Mary have dedicated their lives to music and performing, and you would be helping make dreams come true! What's more satisfying than that? 

Every donation counts, no matter how small. Mary and Brie would be so appreciative and happy to do this tour. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some other ways you can contribute to helping our cause is by spreading the word! Tell your friends about us and what we would like to achieve by doing this tour! Who knows, maybe we'll be in a city near you soon! Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Big thanks to everyone in advance, we hope to see you on the road soon!

- Mary Richard and Brie Goldsobel

Mary Richard - http://Facebook.com/OfficialMaryRichard

http://Twitter.com/MaryRichard_

Brie Goldsobel - https://www.facebook.com/briegoldsobelmusic

www.twitter.com/therealbrie

story:
Dear Friends,

The concert date is set for January 23, 2013, at the Culver Center for the Arts in Riverside, CA!  As many of you may already know, an artistic collaboration is scheduled between choreographers, Monica Rodero and Dan Schuchart, and the acclaimed contemporary classical music ensemble, Victoire.   All the wheels have been set in motion, but we could use your help in balancing our budget for Cathedral City, an evening of music and dance.  Please consider giving a contribution to support the travel of independent art-making from coast to coast.

VICTOIRE is a family of musical misfits living in New York City, helmed by composer/keyboardist Missy Mazzoli.  This “all-star, all-female band” (Time Out New York) of strings, keyboards, clarinets, and electronics performs Mazzoli’s hypnotic blend of dreamy chamber pop, minimalism, and rich romanticism.  Their debut album Cathedral City, released in 2010 on New Amsterdam Records, envelopes the listener in a tapestry of classical influences, distorted guitars, multi-layered vocals, vintage keyboard sounds and stuttering samples. The past two years has toured them to exciting places around the US and Europe, however, this will be their first West Coast venture.

We, Monica Rodero and Dan Schuchart, met while pursuing B.F.A. degrees in Dance from UW-Milwaukee and are now both pursuing M.F.A. degrees in Experimental Choreography at the University of California, Riverside. Our professional careers began with Wild Space Dance Company in Milwaukee, Wisconsin, and we have worked extensively as independent choreographers and performers, producing and presenting our own work including independent, evening length dance concerts, and interactive, multimedia gallery events. Working primarily in collaboration for the past ten years, our choreography has been presented throughout the Midwest and coast to coast. 

A collaborative event like Cathedral City would never have been financially feasible for us as independent artists and we are so thankful to have the support of the UCR Department of Dance, UCR Presents, and the Culver Center of the Arts.  These groups have stepped up to show us an extraordinary amount of support.  In our grass-roots efforts to get Victoire out to Southern California for the project, we have whittled the budget down to include only the most essential components: artist fees for the six band members, booking agent fee, transportation, airfare, equipment rental and a lighting designer.  Even with support and creative number crunching, we find our budget $1,000 short and need help to cover the expense of a bit of airfare/travel expense, a bass rental, and lighting design to fully highlight the work in the Culver Center.

All contributions are greatly appreciated and those of $20 or more receive gifts in return.  Be sure to check out the Victoire website www.victoiremusic.com and note that the Cathedral City album was named one of the best neoclassical albums of 2010 by the New York Times, Time Out New York, The New Yorker, and NPR.

Whether you are able to make a contribution today or not, please help spread the word and join us for the event!

Cathedral City 

January 23rd, 2013, 8pm

Culver Center for the Arts, Riverside, CA

Free and open to the public

http://events.ucr.edu/cgi-bin/display.cgi?comp_id=39031:20130123200000

Many thanks,

Monica, Dan and Missy

story:
Matching Donation Challenge:

Thanks to an anonymous donor, every dollar raised will be matched up to $5,500!


About Us and our campaign.

Since 1996 it has been the mission of Consortium Carissimi to bring the long forgotten and seldom heard music of the early baroque to the post modern world.  We do this through live performance, education outreach, and through musical recordings.  It has been too long since we were able to produce a recording. Our vibrant American ensemble is ready for the challenge.  

We can make it happen, with your help!

This will be Consortium Carissimi's first recording by the American ensemble.   Featuring the works of Bonifazio Graziani, this recording will help insure that his unforgettable music will have a permanent place in history.  

Graziani was an Italian organist and composer. The bulk of his compositions have been lost or destroyed.  Consortium Carissimi will include several of Graziani's best surviving works on their exciting new 2 CD project.

The CD.

Oratories and Motets (CD 1)

Two Oratories

Adae

Filli prodigi


Five Motets

Beati mundo corde

Quis dabit capiti meo

O Miracula

Quid est hoc

Venite, audite


Musiche sagre e morali composte ad una, due, tre e quattro voci, opera XXV, 1678 (CD 2)

O che sempre mi scordi

Su lieto mio cuore

Generoso pensiero

Mobil nave è nostra vita

Gran Tesoro dei Mortali

Amici pastori

Peccator dimmi perché?

Germoglino / Combattino

Non ho voglia di penar più

Siamo qui Suore fatali

Ecco aperto l’Abisso

Presso quell sasso

Crudelissime spine/Acutissimi Chiodi

Mal accorto pensier 


The Goal.

With your support, we are confident that we will raise $5,500 toward our successful recording project. Your donation could go toward renting the recording space, printing the CDs, or even sponsoring a musician and featured soloist.

Because of your donation, Consortium Carissimi will be able to imprint upon history a recording that is sure to keep a historic treasure like Bonifazio Graziani's music relevant, and readily available for future generations.

We have prepared several wonderful incentives for those who contribute including:

Donor names will be printed on our website, free tickets to concerts in Minneapolis, free copies of the CD, invitations to an opening night event, invitations to exclusive pre-show presentations, invitations to sit in on the rehearsal processes while enjoying coffee and a Q and A with the artistic director and musicians, and even a chance to experience the musical recording as it is happening, live!  All incentives including events/tickets will be honored during the 2014-2015 season.  The musical recording will be made available upon completion.  Don't forget, all donations are 100% tax deductible.  

Looking for other ways to help?

We know that not everybody has money to spare. There are other ways you can help us out if you’re enthusiastic about this project.

If you can’t contribute financially, please help us promote this campaign by posting the link to your Facebook, Twitter or other social media accounts.

Tell your friends and family about the campaign, and e-mail them the link.

Recommend our project to other people who can support it.

Last but not least, visit our website (www.consortiumcarissimi.org) and find out when you can attend a Consortium Carissimi performance!  Tickets are available to order or at the door, and prices start at $5.

Thank you for your support. Let's make this recording happen together!

Our vibrant American ensemble is ready for the challenge.  We can make it happen, with your help!This will be Consortium Carissimi's first recording by the American ensemble.   Featuring the works of Bonifazio Graziani, this recording will help insure that his unforgettable music will have a permanent place in history.  Graziani was an Italian organist and composer. The bulk of his compositions have been lost or destroyed.  Consortium Carissimi will include several of Graziani's best surviving works on their exciting new 2 CD project.The CD.Oratories and Motets (CD 1)Two OratoriesAdaeFilli prodigiFive MotetsBeati mundo cordeQuis dabit capiti meoO MiraculaQuid est hocVenite, auditeMusiche sagre e morali composte ad una, due, tre e quattro voci, opera XXV, 1678 (CD 2)O che sempre mi scordiSu lieto mio cuoreGeneroso pensieroMobil nave è nostra vitaGran Tesoro dei MortaliAmici pastoriPeccator dimmi perché?Germoglino / CombattinoNon ho voglia di penar piùSiamo qui Suore fataliEcco aperto l’AbissoPresso quell sassoCrudelissime spine/Acutissimi ChiodiMal accorto pensier The Goal.With your support, we are confident that we will raise $5,500 toward our successful recording project. Your donation could go toward renting the recording space, printing the CDs, or even sponsoring a musician and featured soloist.Because of your donation, Consortium Carissimi will be able to imprint upon history a recording that is sure to keep a historic treasure like Bonifazio Graziani's music relevant, and readily available for future generations.We have prepared several wonderful incentives for those who contribute including:Donor names will be printed on our website, free tickets to concerts in Minneapolis, free copies of the CD, invitations to an opening night event, invitations to exclusive pre-show presentations, invitations to sit in on the rehearsal processes while enjoying coffee and a Q and A with the artistic director and musicians, and even a chance to experience the musical recording as it is happening, live!  All incentives including events/tickets will be honored during the 2014-2015 season.  The musical recording will be made available upon completion.  Don't forget, all donations are 100% tax deductible.  Looking for other ways to help?We know that not everybody has money to spare. There are other ways you can help us out if you’re enthusiastic about this project.If you can’t contribute financially, please help us promote this campaign by posting the link to your Facebook, Twitter or other social media accounts.Tell your friends and family about the campaign, and e-mail them the link.Recommend our project to other people who can support it.Last but not least, visit our website (www.consortiumcarissimi.org) and find out when you can attend a Consortium Carissimi performance!  Tickets are available to order or at the door, and prices start at $5.Thank you for your support. Let's make this recording happen together!

story:
Wild Iris Books has existed for decades as a retail indie bookstore, knowing that selling books was the smallest part of what we do.  (Don’t get us wrong – we love the books – every time we sell a fresh copy of Feminism is for Everybody our hearts soar.)  But with the changing book industry, the amazon chokehold, and the advance of e-books and such - selling books is no longer a profitable way for the Iris to sustain itself. 

Here's the most important part of what we do - we create safe feminist space.  We take in interns and volunteers and help them find their authentic voice and gather skills to take forward in the fight.  We expand language to include all sexualities and genders.  We host diverse events that celebrate the many creative aspects of our community and beyond. We love and we care for each other as we battle the patriarchy ingrained in every aspect of our lives.

And so - to continue the fight, Wild Iris must go through a metamorphosis - we must find a new skin to move forward.  We've met with local lawyer Adam Roark to begin the process of making the switch to a corporate non-profit as opposed to a retail business and here's why:

1. The work we do all comes back to activism and empowerment; our mission has always had the heart of a non-profit.

2. Ownership of Wild Iris belongs to the community. We’d like to invite more of the community into the process of creating the future. Changing our structure to a non-profit will create a board so we can truly involve community members to help take us to the next level.

3. For more than 5 years, we've been an all volunteer run organization. Our owners and staff have not received compensation for their work and time.  By changing to a non-profit, we can pursue grants and donations for salary, intern scholarships, and volunteer recognition.

4. Over the years, the store has accumulated significant debt to continue operations.  The financial burden of this debt hinders us from really getting out there and doing the important work.

5. We get it - you probably don't really need a $35 hardcover book - and we also love our libraries and Kobo eReaders.  But if you believe that our feminist mission is worth it and you know firsthand or from others how Wild Iris Books can help transform lives, now you can support us with your donation.

Yes! Yes! Yes! We Will Still Sell Books and Speak Out:

We will continue to sell books, journals, cards, and other feminist treasures - don't worry about that!  Our legal switch is strategic and we will retain our ability to speak out against politicians and policies that serve to oppress women and other marginalized populations.

Just How Much Does it Take to Keep the Iris Going?

Our monthly expenses run just over $1,500 - and again this is just operational costs with no compensation for workers.  Imagine trying to sell over $4,000 worth of books a month to stay in the black.  It won't work and our doors will soon close if we continue this route. 

Your contribution will make it possible to refocus on our feminist work.  It will give us some breathing room to create a strategic plan for debt reduction so that the space can continue to flourish unhindered by this weight.

Your donation will go straight to the core of keeping operations going and help give us the freedom of knowing expenses are covered so that our mental, physical, emotional, and financial energy can focus on the grassroots work we want to do.

Why Your Local Feminist Bookstore(s) Matters:

Just take a look at some of the recent things we’ve been a part of and don't forget our gallery for a random assortment of Iris pics over the years….

  • Partnered with Alachua County Victim Services for the Survivors Art Exhibit, which showcased local art from survivors of sexual assault, while fostering a safe space for the artists to gather privately

  • Annual "Poster for Tomorrow" gallery show, past shows have included international art focused on Gender Inequality and Homelessness

  • Wild Iris Feminist Open Mic, Feminist Book Club & Feminist Meditation Group

  • Partnered with Books for Prisoners to fulfill inmate book requests from women

  • Helped Launch Trans Affairs at Wild Iris – working to provide clothing, referrals, general support, and other trans* resources

  • Sinister Wisdom Release Party – Issue 93 – Southern Lesbian-Feminist History

  • Red Tent Event with Dr. Isadora Liedenfrost,which included the communal construction of a red tent, a documentary screening of previous gatherings and a celebration of the feminine divine

  • Annual Living History Event: a night of queer storytelling with UF Multicultural & Diversity Affairs

  • Provided scholarships to NWL Feminism 101 Summer Workshop Series

  • In-store Advocacy Center – letters, phone scripts and phones focused on activist causes

  • Co-Hosting Hobby Lobby CR Group & Protest Sign Making Party

  • Co-sponsored Roe v. Wade events with NWL and NOW

  • Feminist music, poets, authors, kids story time and more...

We need your help to jumpstart the switch.  Think about the intern who is already struggling to scrape up textbook money, the travel costs for a trans activist to come speak, a donation of a feminist book - maybe the first feminist book of someone's life, a small salary for someone willing to hold down the fort, scholarships to classes that bring feminist history to life, the supplies to make your first (or hundredth) protest sign...... 

With Your Help - The Possibilities are Endless.....

If you’re not in a position to donate financially, please think about sharing this message with your friends and family or become a part of our volunteer team!

story:
About Hamilton World Music Festival

Hamilton is a vibrant, multi-cultural community with a rich arts and music scene.  We have a great history of producing music festivals that focus primarily on rock, pop and folk music from Canada and the United States.   The Hamilton World Music Festival, July 11-13, will fill a gap in this scene by creating an annual festival that showcases the music of The World: Music that reflects and celebrates many of the cultures that are present in Hamilton, but that are often under-represented in the arts scene. The festival is a major project by Matapa Music & Arts, a non-profit, volunteer-based organization promoting diversity in the arts. 

What We Need & What You Get

We've learned the hard way. As a new festival, we do not qualify for most of the funding sources that exist for these types of events; convincing corporations to spend money with a "new" music festival has been a very tough go. Never-the-less, after running world music concerts in Hamilton for the past two years, we KNOW that Hamiltonians will love this festival, and we want it to be FREE for all who wish to attend.                                        

To make this happen, we need your financial support.

With only a few weeks to go, we have a funding shortfall, and look to you to help us out no matter how small or large your donation may be.

  • This campaign represents only a small portion of our total festival budget, but it will greatly help to offset the costs associated with hiring quality talent and paying them a fair wage to perform.
  • All of this money will stay in the community.  
  • We are hiring several local musical acts and also have significant costs involved in paying the city for the use of Gage park, hiring security, hiring professional sound and lighting, and there is advertising and marketing.
  • By supporting us you are joining a growing number of individuals and organizations that believe in what we are doing. You can feel proud to say that you were there as a supporter for the first year of the festival!

    Risks & Challenges

    We've already confirmed great acts and a great venue (Gage Park).               

    We have the support of several local community groups and city Councillors. The festival is full steam ahead. Our only real risk is that we may lose a lot of money running this event, and subsequently risk our ability to continue putting on future world music shows and festivals. We don't want that to happen.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    In addition to your donation, we need help to get the word out.  We are in need of volunteers and vendors. 

    Please tell all of your friends to come celebrate with us at the free Hamilton World Music Festival, July 11-13 in Gage Park.  

    Please "Like" our Hamilton World Music Festival Facebook Page                       Visit our website at: Hamilton World Music Festival for full details. 

    Please contact us if you know anyone that can help or volunteer.

story:
Why?

We could sing about popsicles, but instead we eat them. We want to sing about what is important. History is important; story-telling is important. Lots of things are important. The significance of Constantine is one of them. 

The Gospel of Barn Owl's newest album will musically explore the questions: 

  • Who was Constantine? 
  • Why was the Lateran Council of 1215 AD influential? 
  • Who were the Anabaptist martyrs? 

Sound boring? WELL IT'S NOT. It will be packaged in five song high energy electro rock album that you can dance, jog, bake, sing, and read to. No twerking allowed. 

Who?

For three years, Jared Both has been researching, composing, and recording this five song album. The album will also include the talents of Michael Siegrist, Sebastian Ostertag, Jon Marck, and guest vocals from Brett Klassen and Troy Witherow. Mixing and mastering will be done by Jon Tornblom. 

How?

This is essentially an opportunity to pre-order the album, with some perks of course. 

Watch the video for more info.

story:
Akron Tubas go to ITEC

The University of Akron Tuba/Euphonium Ensemble (UATEE) has been invited to perform at the International Tuba Euphonium Conference (ITEC) in Bloomington, Indiana in May 2014. A few things about this invitation:

  • This is the most prestigious conference invitation for a university ensemble
  • This invitation is the first in the history of the UATEE
  • The ITEC provides students, professionals, educators, and enthusiasts the opportunity to hear performances, lectures, and presentations by leading professionals from around the world
In order to make our appearance possible, we need help! The costs of attending such an event are high, especially for college students!


What are the costs? How can you help?

Here is a rough estimate of some of the costs involved:

With only registration paid for, we are looking at $3,500. The conference is from Monday May 19 and continues through Saturday May 24. Ideally, we would like to fund our lodging for the day preceding, the day of, and the day following our performance in Bloomington. A more precise breakdown of those costs is below:

  • registration is $195 times 18 students = $3,510
  • lodging is $89 (or more) per night times 5 rooms for 3 nights = $1,335
  • If we do not reach our entire goal, the money we do raise will go towards registration. That is the most pressing cost for making this performance possible.
  • If we raise more than our goal, we will apply any excess funds towards lodging for additional nights at the conference.
Please check out the perks below! Some of them are limited edition, but most of them are not. We are really interested in making sure our contributors feel connected to us and to the project, so most of them involve getting some kind of personal correspondence from members of the UATEE while we are in Bloomington. We want you to feel involved in our progression!

*************We will be posting exclusive video, audio, and other behind-the-scences content to the IndieGoGo page for all of you that do contribute.*************


The Impact

Why should you help us?

  • The students at the University of Akron are getting exposed to a high level of performance for the first time in a long time. 
  • This conference attendance has the real likelihood of changing the lives and perspectives of some of us in the studio.
  • Our fearless leader, Dr. Andy Larson, is constantly working to inspire creative and thoughtful musicians and citizens. Our participation in this conference will serve as a hallmark for future achievements while also serving as a catalyst for real and fundamental change and improvement.


Other Ways You Can Help

Sometimes you just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • At the very least, please spread the word about our campaign.
  • Share the news with everyone: your family, friends, hair stylist, mechanic...
  • Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Short Summary

  • We are Osiella, an acoustic fusion band out of Evansville, IN and Ghana, West Africa.  
  • Simply put, music is our passion, our True Blood (hehe), our everything! We've put our sweat and blood into creating music that we feel needs to be heard! That is why we've packed the bags and are going on tour!
  • Any and every contribution counts. The funds we make will help us survive out there on the road. No record-label to back us and no mamas to kiss us goodnight. SO we are counting on you guys to help make this tour successful!

What We Need & What You Get

  • The goal to reach here is $5000. The majority of the funds will go towards fuel to get us from place to place. 
  • All the perks we've listed are true and tested. No matter what you donate, you will receive something. 
  • If we don't reach our goal, we'll borrow the money from Tiko the loan shark!

The Impact

  • As stated earlier, this project is our life-blood. Individually, we have all played countless shows with the up-and-comers and with the big names (Papa Roach, Philip Lawrence, Halestorm just to name a few) but we feel that it's our turn to share with the world OUR version of this art form called music! Through it all, we have become more and more appreciative of our fans. We see this tour as a way to evolve as musicians and we want our fans to be able to experience this evolution with us. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • No worries if you can't donate. Just share the page, listen to our music, and keep in touch with us! We'll be sure to update all of you on our status during the tour. Anything you do will be accounted for and appreciated!

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Our Story

It's 2012 , and I am THE NEW BRUCE. This campaign is for the recording, pressing, and promotion of my cd "BENT". Myself and my fans are on a mission this year to make this dream a reality! Are you with us?


The Impact

If we don't succeed, it means even more delays for this project. It's eclectic, original work by me along with a lineup of independent producers and studio. Leave no one behind. I work with people who are just like me, adventurous, creative, talented, and struggling to show their talents to the world. 


What We Need & What You Get

This campaign will complete the cd "BENT" by THE NEW BRUCE, as well as press and promote it.. allowing me to do shows and sell product. I am offering some truly amazing perks and it should prove to be an exciting time for all of us. You played the part in an artistic success story. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Become a member of my street team. Tell your friends, send emails or post on your networking pages. Lets make this happen. I am so grateful that God has placed so many artistic, creative, and wonderful people in my life. He made me wait til i met you all. Even if you're not an artistic type, join this campaign, stand for new artists and make a difference in what people hear and see. You still can make a difference.!

Even if you're not an artistic type, join this campaign, stand for new artists and make a difference in what people hear and see. You still can make a difference.!

story:
Hello Everyone,
 
I'm Robert Jackson, Host and Creator of the Podcast, A Quiet Mind. I'm also a musician and I've been performing on the plains flute, also called the Native American Flute, for about 20 years. I have an upcoming performance in Venice, California at Mystic Journeys Bookstore on August 8th, 2012. I'm looking for funds to help me bring my healing music to the folks in Southern California and I need your help.

What We Need

  • $250 in train fair from San Jose to Los Angeles.
  • $100 for food for two days.
  • $150 to repay the costs on creating the CD's and the books for the event.

What You Get

The opportunity to be a part of bringing tranquil, calming and healing music to the masses.

 

The Impact

People need more relaxing sounds in their lives. They need to be able to connect to something that can help them heal, relax and calm their rattled minds. An evening of gentle flute music and storytelling creates a space of sacredness in a world full of chaos.

We need to have the opportunity to connect with sound that heals and calms us.

This music has transformed the lives of many and brought peace and lasting transformation into their lives.

Robert has been performing and sharing this healing music with people all over the world.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Joey Clarkson and I am a singer/songwriter from the Comox Valley.

Last March I was fortunate to be asked to do an interview/live performance slot on BBC Introducing in Norfolk. I have been invited back to do another interview on BBC Introducing this summer, and to take them up on this opportunity I have decided to do another mini tour of the UK, this time accompanied by my best friend and backing vocalist Breanne Larson.

So, in typical Joey and Bee fashion: we are heading to the UK for two weeks this August, to promote my new single “Save Yourself” (June, 2012) and my up and coming single “Boy I think I love you” (August, 2012). We have several shows organized, in some very unique venues! We will be playing pretty much everywhere: Pubs, House Parties, In the BBC Studio in Norfolk, in an old theatre, and as always: you can expect to see some good old fashioned busking!

The most exciting part of this project is that Chad Weber of VI Multimedia is going to be following our adventure and capturing it on film! The idea being: to use the footage captured to create 5-7 web episodes of an inside look at an independent artists (attempted) rise to success. At the end of the tour, these “blogisodes” will be compiled to create a documentary style film! 

The tour will take place between August 5 – 18’th, and we are beyond looking forward to being able to share it with all of our fans, friends and family back home, and around the world!

What We Need & What You Get

We have set a goal of raising $3000 to help fund this tour/web series adventure; essentially we are hoping to raise enough money to cover airfare for the 3 of us from Vancouver to the UK. In reality, this isn’t even close to covering the costs associated with an international tour, but we are lucky, and have family and friends in the UK that will be hosting us on couches, floors and in tents while we are there to help cut back on costs!

If we exceed our goal, the funds will go towards covering other aspects of the tour, such as: Printing of CD’s, Car Rental, Petrol to and from gigs, ect.  If we don’t reach our goal, the funds will still go towards our goal!

 

The Impact

This project will be full of tips that will help other independent artists with organizing an international tour to promote their music! We have a tendency to make lots of mistakes, and have absolutely no shame when it comes to sharing them; so, if they can’t learn from how we do things, they can definitely learn from how we don’t!

In the very least, this project is sure to put a smile on your face... and will definitely keep a our Moms happy!

Other Ways You Can Help

You can follow the adventure on youtube, and share it with your friends! If you think the idea is cool, chances are your friends will too.
