story:
Leah Morise - preorder campaign for album #2

Thanks for taking the time to drop by and see how things are going with my newest album. I released my first album in 2006 and figured that I am certainly overdue for the second one. If you know me, you know that I have been justifiably busy for the last few years with having bought this house, renovating and starting a house concert series. I have put my music on the back burner and it is time to focus and take advantage of this lovely space to record my next album. By opening up the opportunity for a presale, I can help pay for the musicians, recording and production in advance and be able to deliver a finished project this summer.

This is what the money will be spent on:

Recording - I have hired a recording engineer (Adam Plante) who will come into the space with his gear and set it all up to make us sound great. We will listen and mix and get the album mastered so it is ready to be pressed.

Performers - There are some talented people who will be joining me by playing or singing on this project. Paying them fairly for their performance is important to me!

Production - The cost of producing the physical CDs. Over one third of the cost will go towards manufacturing the CD, case and insert.

I have been saving so I will be able to put some money towards the recording plus promote the CD and fund an east coast Canadian tour in August. Even if I cannot reach the goal, every bit helps. I am on a mission and when I put my mind to something...  ;-)

Please take a few minutes to check out the perks I am offering. For $20 you can order a signed CD to be mailed to you before it is released to the public. All perks will contain a early release digital copy of the album. There are even some special or unusual one-of-a-kind goods/services being offered. Come back and visit the page for more behind-the-scenes information.

I can't thank you enough for your pledge and your support! I have received so much interest in my music and look forward to sharing more of my songs with the world. Even if you cannot personally afford to contribute, you can help by sharing with friends who might be interested in my music and this project.

story:
Purple Haze is a co-ed a cappella group at Northwestern University in Evanston, IL. In the competitive a cappella scene at Northwestern, we pride ourselves on maintaining high standards of musicality and keeping the fun and love alive!

Every winter we go on tour, where we hold school workshops to connect with the community, and perform at a variety of other venues to spread our love of music beyond the Chicagoland area. Last year we traveled to Washington D.C., the year before, Puerto Rico. This December, we hope to travel to Dublin!

In addition to performing on tour, Purple Haze produces 3 on-campus shows each year and CD’s biennially.  Our past albums been featured on Best of College A Cappella collections, Voices Only CD compilations, received rave Recorded A Cappella Review Board (RARB) reviews, and garnered many CARA and ACA awards. We are currently working on our seventh studio album and are releasing a Christmas single this winter!

Putting together a professionally produced album is a costly endeavor for the group, however, and we’re trying to fill in the financial void so that our December tour to Ireland can go through as planned. Which is why we need your help! Anything you can give would be incredibly helpful and so appreciated. Those who donate $20 or more will receive a signed copy of our album as a thank you! If you have any additional questions, feel free to contact Grace Kennedy, our General Manager at info@purplehaze.ws.

Thanks so much!

story:
'Once you make a decision, the Universe conspires to make it happen'
~Ralph Waldo Emerson

THE MAKING OF CONTACT 


'Every single one of us want's to be believed. Artist are just often louder about it'
~Amanda Palmer, 'The Art of Aksing'

This campaign signifies a bold milestone for myself, the team, you - my community and, the fans. We were successful in kickstarting  for the singles release and thanks to my contributors, YOU GUY'S! our EDM pop-anthem is an intergalactic hit!! Everyone that hear's it confesses to a sincere WOW ... I couldn't be more grateful. My producer, Nataraj Tribino and myself wrote the song and it was released on March 21'st of this year. 

In the last 6 month's I've performed SUPER CONSCIOUS (get it on iTunes) along side my first EP, a Future Sun at venue's and event's around Los Angeles, including the Good Hurt where I had the PLEASURE of debuting my singing pop-pixie act while spinning on the lyra hoop, (think P!nk) + see it here!


So why more funds? 

Because every great artist will always need them. ALSO...

  • Completion of the video, editing, campaigning and promotion - (5k) 
  • A stellar cohesive website and logo to uphold brand AYDRA - (2k)
  • Follow-up songs; a 4 song EP titled 'CONTACT' supported by a stage show - (5k) 

We just need to sign, seal, deliver it and KEEP GOING !!

What you as contributors will be doing in essence is assisting us in acting as our own label. In the modern world, becoming a signed, famous artist is about as likely as getting struck by lighting :/ To be clear, I don't need to be struck by the fame monster, rather, I'd simply like to feel as an artist that I'm free and honored to create, release, and perform content. You, my community, can enable that. 


THE MEANING OF CONTACT, FOR YOU

By getting behind Campaign Contact you will not only be putting the final touches on the AYDRA 'bundle' ie: an awesome single, video and website, but will be a part of making CONTACT with people who need SUPER CONSCIOUSNESS, who are ready for the next breakout artist launching into an outer-worldly, educational and transcendent experience! My goal is to tell a story illustrating our primitive feeling's about arriving on earth, finding and losing love, discovering community, expressing passion and ultimately rising into our highest selves where we are sexy, ONE, crazy, loved and seen infinitely by the creator. . .be that aliens, a 'force' or both. 

This, I might add, is also the premise behind the video.

'No one ever said it was easy' 

~Bono who said it to Jared Leto who said it to me. Learn about 30 Seconds to Mar's documentary film on the music industry and battle with their label here, + watch it on Netflix

So ... PLEASE consider being a minor or major contributor and check out the awesome perks!  



THE IMPACT OF CONTACT

This concept, this show, WILL change peoples lives, so you contributing toward's it's success is a pledge towards not only my happiness, but to that of other's and the team. Together we elevate one-another and that uplift's humanity and that changes things in the world. Ya see! 

Here's the initial track list:

1. Reach out

2. Contact pt. I

3. Lift off

4. Contact pt. II

'If you wish to make an apple pie from scratch, you must first invent the universe'
~Carl Sagan


THE CONSEQUENCE OF NO CONTACT

True ... we may not make goal. Nothing is known in this infinite universe, that's the point! One thing that is great about crowd-funding here at Indiegogo, is FLEXIBLE FUNDING, meaning; you collect all the funds you raise, even if you miss you goal! The catch is that 9% is taxed as opposed to 4% if you don't, so reaching and EXCEEDING the goal is STILL important. 

NOTE: When you contribute - it come's out of your account on transaction, the fund's are then collected at the end of the campaign. 

What would additional funds go to?

  • The complete EP and bonus live track on piano! 
  • Deal with a publicist 
  • Merch
  • perks!
  • Co-collaborators for the stage show


HELP MAKE CONTACT IN OTHER WAYS

Don't feel bad if you can't or would prefer not to pledge, there's always a way to give!

  • Use Indiegogo share tools, send this campaign to your network!
  • Tell people about it, if it indeed inspires you, talk about it!
  • Check out my social media site's and like, share, comment, fan and follow!

https://www.facebook.com/pages/Aydra/198242160221442?ref=br_rs

https://soundcloud.com/aydrasounds

https://twitter.com/AkaAydraJ

https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC9C5XNrrmpcDKD...

And that's all there is to it :) 

GO TEAM AYDRA AND CAMPAIGN CONTACT! 

COSMIC KISS AND HUG! ~

A

story:
The push behind this project is to have fun and create music. Simple as that. The tunes will be recorded at the David Kessner studios. David has been a part of the Marin music scene since the 1970s, and the depth of his musical savvy brings a level of professionalism that's hard to find. For great music to come into the World, there must be great players. Here, in the greater bay area, there are great players behind every coffee bar and serving in every restaurant. You see my point. 

This segues directly to the $3,000. This disc will be a full on Blues album, covers and originals. To achieve this, I will need to hire some accomplished musicians and  pay for the studio time. Please consider contributing. If you do, You will receive downloads or a disc of the finished album. 

you can access some of my earlier recordings on 'Soundcloud'.

Thanks.

session personnel, so far: 

Steve Evans--Bass

Gary Regina--Horns

Dave Kessner--Keyboards, Vocals, Sound Engineer

Dan Durkin--Drums, Harmonica, Vocals

Buck Lacey--Guitar, Vocals, Songwriter.

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Something Involving A Monkey
"Dive Into the Great Blue Waffle"

Something Involving A Monkey is an avant-garde, multi-genre band from Cleveland, OH, that formed in 2010 by guitarist/keyboardist Joe Petrich, drummer Todd Ankrom and bassist/kazooist BeZo. After the tragic loss of Todd Ankrom in 2011, Nick Ritz began carrying the drumming duties later in 2012. The group has issued one release under their name, and has played all over Ohio, Western PA, Indiana, Kentucky, and Michigan, with the likes of Polkadot Cadaver, Psychostick, Downtown Brown, Green Jelly and many others. They've opened for Stolen Babies, Between the Buried & Me, Bam Margera, Dog Fashion Disco, and have piqued the interest of many wherever they perform. They are now ready to enter the studio for their 2nd full length album and are looking for the help of their fans, friends… and even foes… in helping fund this record.

THE GOAL
The $3,500 goal is small in comparison to the cost of most album recordings. But SIAM has been diligently writing this album for the last 18 months and we are ready to go!! Studio time has been arranged. We are hoping this will cover expenses to not only record, but also handle CD duplication and basic promotion of the album. For being a small regional independent act, pre-funding is an essential part of making this album. 

THE PERKS
As you peruse the perks, you will notice that creativity and humor not only encompass SIAM's music, but also in these perks. We have a plethora of monetary options with some basic to very unique perks. Almost all the perks come with a copy of our 2nd studio release, "Dive Into the Great Blue Waffle", with your name listed in the credits. Bonuses increase as you go up. From simple shirt & CD packages to eating BeZo's homemade blue waffle recipe to ditties written about YOU to personal live performances to music videos with YOU AS THE STAR! We guarantee that there is something you will want to try! Please note that NO DENOMINATION IS TOO SMALL. It takes a community of support for an album to be released these days, so whatever you are willing to contribute will be GREATLY appreciated by the band.

THE ALBUM
Something Involving A Monkey is excited to release this album. Our previous album, "The Wasteland", came about after the tragic loss of our former drummer. That album was also pre-funded & released by the band independently. It has sold over 500 copies, which, in this day and age, for a local/regional, unsigned act, is not too shabby. "Dive Into the Great Blue Waffle" is set to be a more energetic, upbeat, and heavier album. Most bands start to hit their stride on their sophomore release, and this couldn't be any more true for SIAM! On top of the 9 main tracks set to be recorded, we have another half dozen tracks of ditties, called "quips", which we will weave through this album. Something Involving A Monkey has proven, and continues to prove, that the music we create is not only original, but maintains a presentation unlike anything you've heard before.

It is always asked, “what risks and challenges might come with recording an album?” And to be honest, there isn't much we as musicians in this band haven't faced. All three of us have been long time contributors to the Cleveland/Northeast Ohio music scene. And we have already proven, during "The Wasteland" recording, that adversity does not prevent us from executing a solid, creative album.

Please consider pledging to this endeavor and help us achieve a new personal milestone. We thank you for your support over the years and into the future!!
story_txt:
Something Involving A Monkey "Dive Into the Great Blue Waffle"
Something
Involving A Monkey is an avant-garde, multi-genre band from Cleveland, OH, that
formed in 2010 by guitarist/keyboardist Joe Petrich, drummer Todd Ankrom and bassist/kazooist
BeZo. After the tragic loss of Todd Ankrom in 2011, Nick Ritz began carrying the
drumming duties later in 2012. The group has issued one release under their
name, and has played all over Ohio, Western PA, Indiana, Kentucky, and
Michigan, with the likes of Polkadot Cadaver, Psychostick, Downtown Brown,
Green Jelly and many others. They've opened for Stolen Babies, Between the
Buried & Me, Bam Margera, Dog Fashion Disco, and have piqued the interest
of many wherever they perform. They are now ready to enter the studio for their
2nd full length album and are looking for the help of their fans, friends… and
even foes… in helping fund this record.
THE GOALThe
$3,500 goal is small in comparison to the cost of most album recordings. But SIAM
has been diligently writing this album for the last 18 months and we are ready
to go!! Studio time has been arranged. We are hoping this will cover expenses
to not only record, but also handle CD duplication and basic promotion of the
album. For being a small regional independent act, pre-funding is an essential
part of making this album.

story:
Be in Our Next Music Video

Do you want to be in Billy Kay's next music video - When You Hold Me Tight? Well now you can! I've actually always made special editions of my videos and my Picture CDs for my friends and associates. And I'm always told I should do the same for my fans. So now it's my fans' time to shine!


We've all felt the feeling! You're in an embrace... the feeling overwhelms you... and you instinctively pull your partner tighter! Everyone has a picture of a hug! Maybe from your wedding. A camping trip. Hec - even in your kitchen - if that's when the mood struck you! It would be so cool to have a bunch of REAL pictures of REAL folks holding each other float across the screen in the music video!

We're in the recording studio now cutting the track. You can hear it's progress as we add instruments and vocals by clicking the music video above.


The Impact

When You Hold Me Tight is scheduled for a March release. It's a hot track about a universal human emotion with a memorable groove that's destined to become Billy's breakout signature song. Now you can be a part of it!

We're funding this project through fan donations and corporate sponsorships and - like all my previous songs - will ultimately have the song attached to a charity, so a percentage of the profits from the song's downloads benefit that charity. I'm implementing the newest method of releasing music that incorporates giving - both musically and fiscally.


The video production company we're using is THE hottest studio in town! They make the commercials for all the hot clubs. They start at $2000 - which is basically the equivalent of filming a band in their garage. Do we want pretty girls in the video? Duh! A song about hugs BETTER have pretty girls! Add $1000. Will there be location shots with additional filming permits? With additional days? That's another $1000 per.

So get on board! Make history! Your sponsorship ($5 to whatever dollars) in exchange for some awesome Billy Kay mementos - like free mp3s, credits in the video, or singing backup vocals. Hec! I'll even "Hold you tight" in the video! Just click the big Sponsor button.


What We Need & What You Get

Your Song Sponsorship money will go towards:

  • Recording studio time.
  • Musicians, singers and producer.
  • Video production, crew, filming permits.
  • Makeup, catering, security, wardrobe, actors.
  • Manufacturing and shipping.
  • Friggin' paperwork - releases, etc..
  • Marketing and PR - getting the word out


Disclaimers: The producer and directer are the sole discretion of submitted photos, so don't submit off-color shots. Transportation to filming venue and recording studio is at sponsor's own expense. While we try to give as much advance notice as possible, past experience has shown that we get calls like "Hey! We got such and such venue at our disposal on Wednesday - be there at noon!" Releases must be signed before participation. We reserve the right to change and modify perks as applicable.


Other Ways You Can Help

Unleash the DIWO! -- 'Do It With Others'! Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. Don't forget to use the share tools!

story:
KC ARMY!

You guys knocked it out of the park with the "Uprise" Indiegogo campaign and helped us make "Uprise" such a huge success.  Now we want to give you what everyone has been asking for...

...The VERY FIRST Kingdom Collapse full-length album! 

We are attacking the debut album as a 100% independent band. This means that we will have no funding or support from a label. However, we know the strength of the KC Army and the tremendous support that you all continually show us will get us there.

This is why we want to involve YOU, in playing a part of making our first full-length record happen.

 

Our campaign goal is to raise AT LEAST $10,000. This money will be used in several ways including:

- The Recording and Making of the Studio Album
- Music Video Production
- Distribution of Album
- Printing of Physical Copies
- Marketing and Promotion

 

PACKAGE OPTIONS:


Aside from normal donations, we are offering a few different exclusive packages:

PACKAGE 1
$50 Contribution (only 100 available)
- First EVER Kingdom Collapse Zip-Up Hoodie

PACKAGE 2
$100 Contribution (only 100 available)
- Exclusive KC Indiegogo Shirt 
- Hand Written lyrics to your favorite KC song
- KC Logo Wall Flag
- "Uprise" Acoustic Version

PACKAGE 3
$200 Contribution (only 25 available)
- Personal  (One on One) Acoustic Live Stream Performance 
- Everything included in Package 2


We are so excited to release this album to every single of you that have been anticipating it's arrival! We have a considerable amount of material taking shape as we speak and are incredibly excited to include YOU in part of Kingdom Collapse history!

 

DISCLAIMER: Indiegogo is SEPARATE from pre-orders. Pre-Orders will become available once the album is completed and sent off to distribution.

story:
We are Body Hound: overly-ambitious Prog Rock band from South Yorkshire coming to beat up your Dad with debut album No Moon

"After [..] catching their incredible set [...] it’s fair to say they’re not pissing about. Rhombus Now wasn’t a one off. It wasn’t a bedroom project or a joke. It was the start of something new. Something good. Something unique." musicalmathematics.co.uk

"Stingingly angular and sharpened enough to be in violation of the festival’s health and safety guidelines, [...] it’s no surprise that this act is requested and praised year after year."  Dan Hillier, Noizze.com

Recorded by producer Tom Peters (The Fall, various bands from the UK Mathrock scene like Alpha Male Tea Party, Cleft and Vasa, and uhh... X Factor semi-finalist Grace Davies),  No Moon reflects our descent into trying to make the best album we can.

Having successfully and sneakily ridden on a recorded output of just 6 tracks since 2014, it's time to show you what we've forged. 

"This is going to be AOTY stuff…" Nikk Hunter, Fecking Bahamas

Our passion to create a thoroughly engaging and enjoyable record has carried us through personal strife of multiple levels. Illness, death and all associated states could have derailed us at any time, but we stayed on course and are thoroughly proud of our horrible and serene baby. We hope you love it as much as we do!

 

What we need from you

We've already recorded the album. It's in the bag. It's so in the bag it might be The Bag. Now we need your help in the next stage of our project. We're looking raise £5000 to take this album as far as it can go.

Your contribution will go towards:

  • Mastering

  • Beautiful and terrifying physical copies of the album on vinyl and CD - Over half of the money we raise will go towards this. Double LPs are very expensive to produce, but we want to give No Moon to you in the best package that we can.

  • Producing T-shirts and Posters

  • Shipping

  • Tour costs- we want to come and play this thing for you!

Lastly, we make relatively niche music and it would be great if you could introduce us to friends who might dig us. Share the shite out of this campaign! We appreciate any and all kinds of support.

 

Mmmmmmm... Delicious perks

All our perks will include a digital copy of the finished album. We're also offering:

  • Tickets to the launch

  • physical copies on both gatefold sleeve heavyweight black vinyl and CD

  • Shirts

  • Posters 

  • Guitar/bass/drum lessons - we have a combined experience of 73 years to share with you!

 

Thanks for reading!

You can keep in touch with us at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Bodyhound/

Instagram: @body_hound

Twitter: @BodyHound

Bandcamp: https://bodyhound.bandcamp.com/

Email: bodyhound@gmail.com

story:
Bookish was written and recorded last winter -- my first winter living on the coast of Maine. It was bitterly cold outside and there was ice and blowing snow, and I hibernated upstairs in my writing alcove and downstairs in Peter’s Gallway Bay studio to work on this record – solo, live-in-the-studio, unguarded, focused. Peter mixed the recording, beautifully, with great skill and great ears. It will be mastered in Portland, Maine, by Michael McInnis, and manufactured through Crooked Cove, in Kennebunk.

I’ve been unable to travel for several years because I have chronic Lyme Disease. It has turned my world upside down and made it very small. Touring and performing are out of the question. But I keep writing, constantly, and I’ve recorded these new songs to sound the way I would play them on stage if I were able to bring them to you in person.

I am fortunate to be able to record here at home in Peter’s studio, and to create the packaging design, websites, videos, photos and promotional materials upstairs in my office space. Working here in our two-hundred-year-old home is a dream come true. And much of the cost of making this record was absorbed because it was created in-house.

Now the recording is complete, the weather is spectacular, I’ve come out of hibernation and am asking for your help in getting this project mastered, manufactured, marketed, on the radio, and into your hands. There are CDs, perks and swag in the form of Bookish book bags! (They are really nice – they have a zipper, and are all cotton. I love them.)

I miss seeing you all and hope to be able to travel again to your town someday. Meanwhile, thank you for listening. Thank you for your support. Thank you for helping to give this collection legs.

Love, Annie

story:
CIRCLE of LOVE

My name is Pratibha, I was born in Copenhagen. Over many years I have been singing and playing music for dancing and meditations. In 2002 my first CD 'Heartdance' was born, followed my 'Here with You' and 'Echo of a Star'. I have been facilitating Heart Dances and Voice journeys in many different festivals and venues all over Europe for the last 20 years. It gives me immense joy to see everyone light up in a singing circle and in no time it truly becomes a circle of love. But a circle of love can also happen when you are on your own listening to music that touch your heart. It is my deepest wish that the songs may nourish the listener, be a kind of embrace in these, for many, troubled times. 

6.500 Euro for recording and producing the album

Any amount will be gratefully received! The money will go to finance the recording and producing of the CD. It will also be available on the various digital outlets. I will be working with my friend, a professional, gifted musician and wizard David Springborg in Copenhagen. We will start the recordings as soon as the goal is reached :-)

There are a few so-called 'perks', which means special offers to the ones with greater contributions, like web based voice coaching, house concerts and heart dances at your own events....

The Impact

It gives me great joy to hear when people tell me how much they enjoy my music, have played it at special occasions both happy and sad or having daily sing alongs in the car. I believe music and singing is an immense healing factor in our lives. That's also why I have created the Voice Healing Journeys to help expand and open the connection to your own voice. For self expression, inner peace and creativity. If you like to get a taste of my music go to www.pratibha.dk 

Risks & Challenges

Since I have worked with David Springborg before ('Echo of a Star') and I know his skills both as a gifted musician and a producer, I feel an excitement about entering on this new journey because we both have quite a bit of experience in creating albums. It will be my fourth one and I'm really exited to get started. We never seem to run out of inspiration. Can't wait to get started! :-)

there is always a risk in creating something new -but one worth taking 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't have means to spare I would be very grateful if maybe you can help me share this page to all and everyone you know ....that would just be fantastic:-) 

please remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
What is Dreamer's Waltz: An ArtsCan Circle Fundraiser?

  • Dreamer's Waltz features original fiddle tunes inspired by the north and reimagined with  jazz harmonies, plus guest appearance by vocalists  BJ MacLean and Kate Weeks on two original songs.
  • Dreamer's Waltz is being released exclusively as an online fundraising campaign. Only 100 copies of the albums are available.  
  • All proceeds from album sales go towards ArtsCan Circle music programming.
  • The goal:  To sell 100 albums and raise $1500 for ArtsCan Circle music programming.
  • All purchased albums will be mailed out Dec. 19 (when the campaign ends). Need them in time for Christmas?  We can deliver to your door if you live in Whitehorse. 

 

 

 

 

 

Who is Keitha Clark?

  • Keitha has taught and performed across the north for 12 years.
  • She knows first hand the importance of music in communities and wanted to create a project that would bring more music and arts to youth in the north. 
  • Keitha  has founded fiddle programs in Teslin and Haines Junction, and is the artistic director of the Fiddleheads, a 30 member youth fiddle ensemble.
  •  She has performed with everyone from Gwitchin fiddler Boyd Benjamin to vaudeville pianist Grant Simpson, everywhere from the community centre in the fly-in village of Old Crow to concert halls in China.
  • Keitha has appeared on more than 15 albums, including the Juno nominated Annie Lou. 

 

Want to know more about the album?

  • This is Keitha's first solo  album of all original material.
  • For this project she teamed up with Toronto jazz pianist Andy Slade, as all as respected northern musicians Olivier De Colombel (saxophone), BJ MacLean (vocals/guitar) and former Yukoner Kate Weekes (vocals/guitar).
  • The album was recorded with Bob Hamilton at Old Crow Recording Studio in Whitehorse.
  • Cover art image, Remember the Rain, donated by Whitehorse painter Simon Gilpin. (www.simonjamesgilpin.com)

 

Want to know more about ArtsCan Circle?

Check out their website here: https://artscancircle.ca

"In each of these communities, the kids are so amazing in the face of really incredible challenges every day. We know that music, art and theatre are ways for them to 'voice' these experiences and feelings in a language others can understand - and need to hear. Their art is accessible. And it is powerful. These kids have lots to say, and we have lots to learn from them. Our job is simple: to inspire these kids and give them the tools to breathe in their world and breathe out their music."     -ArtsCan Circle Founder Mike Stevens
story_txt:
What is Dreamer's Waltz: An ArtsCan Circle Fundraiser?

Dreamer's Waltz features original fiddle tunes inspired by the north and reimagined with  jazz harmonies, plus guest appearance by vocalists  BJ MacLean and Kate Weeks on two original songs.
Dreamer's Waltz is being released exclusively as an online fundraising campaign. Only 100 copies of the albums are available.  
All proceeds from album sales go towards ArtsCan Circle music programming.
The goal:  To sell 100 albums and raise $1500 for ArtsCan Circle music programming.
All purchased albums will be mailed out Dec. 19 (when the campaign ends). Need them in time for Christmas?  We can deliver to your door if you live in Whitehorse. 


 
 
 
 
 
Who is Keitha Clark?

Keitha has taught and performed across the north for 12 years.
She knows first hand the importance of music in communities and wanted to create a project that would bring more music and arts to youth in the north. 
Keitha  has founded fiddle programs in Teslin and Haines Junction, and is the artistic director of the Fiddleheads, a 30 member youth fiddle ensemble.
 She has performed with everyone from Gwitchin fiddler Boyd Benjamin to vaudeville pianist Grant Simpson, everywhere from the community centre in the fly-in village of Old Crow to concert halls in China.
Keitha has appeared on more than 15 albums, including the Juno nominated Annie Lou. 


 
Want to know more about the album?

This is Keitha's first solo  album of all original material.
For this project she teamed up with Toronto jazz pianist Andy Slade, as all as respected northern musicians Olivier De Colombel (saxophone), BJ MacLean (vocals/guitar) and former Yukoner Kate Weekes (vocals/guitar).
The album was recorded with Bob Hamilton at Old Crow Recording Studio in Whitehorse.
Cover art image, Remember the Rain, donated by Whitehorse painter Simon Gilpin. (www.simonjamesgilpin.com)


 
Want to know more about ArtsCan Circle?
Check out their website here: https://artscancircle.ca
"In each of these communities, the kids are so amazing in the face of really incredible challenges every day. We know that music, art and theatre are ways for them to 'voice' these experiences and feelings in a language others can understand - and need to hear. Their art is accessible. And it is powerful. These kids have lots to say, and we have lots to learn from them. Our job is simple: to inspire these kids and give them the tools to breathe in their world and breathe out their music."     -ArtsCan Circle Founder Mike Stevens

story:
Short Summary

Hello! Welcome to my first ever solo album crowdfunding campaign! 

Some of you will know me from my work with UK folk rock bands Oysterband, Levellers and John Jones and the Reluctant Ramblers - among others.

You may have seen me on tour in the UK earlier this year as chain maker, ‘Bird’ in Townsend Theatre Productions critically acclaimed folk opera ‘Rouse Ye Women’ (written by Neil Gore and John Kirkpatrick). You may have even found my music independently… To those of you who don’t know me at all … welcome, it’s great to have you here!

Song writing and making music has been a part of my life for as long as I can remember. The songs I write express my feelings, thoughts and experiences of the world we live in - some shared and some solitary but all human. I find myself drawn to themes of nature in my writing. I also enjoy working with traditional songs and creating lush vocal arrangements. For example: https://rowangodel.bandcamp.com/track/the-lark-... 

I'm often asked at gigs, when I will release a full length studio album. I've wanted to do this very much for a long time but the music industry has changed and record companies aren't investing in artists in the way they used to.

So what is an artist to do when they want to make work and put it out there but don’t have the financial backing of a record company? 

These days, more and more artists are finding other ways to support their creative projects - including crowdfunding - and involving their biggest supporters … you, their audience! 

I’m hugely excited to share this with you all and I hope you’ll enjoy walking alongside me as my project develops and grows into the album I want to make for me and for you. 

I have some incredible musicians involved already, including multi instrumentalists Benji Kirkpatrick and Tim Cotterell, with the amazing Al Scott (Oysterband / Levellers) on production. 

I feel very privileged to have the opportunity to work with such fantastically talented people. 

All funds raised will be used to pay for musicians time and skill, studio time and production, CD art work and manufacturing and a proper PR campaign to support the albums release in March to help make it a success.

With your help, it's time to make it happen!!! You can choose your "perk" or if you just want to contribute, hit the "Back It" button and enter any amount you like!

Over the next weeks, I’ll be sharing exclusive news with you as the album progresses and I look forward to seeing you at a Rowan Godel Trio gig somewhere on my album release tour in March 2020. You can find my website here for dates! https://rowangodel.co.uk/live-dates/

Thanks for taking the time to check out my music. Your support is invaluable and very much appreciated! 

Keep popping back to see what’s going on …

Here we go!!! 

Rowan x

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

  • Musicians: £950.00

  • Studio time: £2,000.00

  • Mixing: £1,000.00

  • Mastering: £200.00

  • CD artwork and manufacturing: £1,100.00

  • Album launch PR campaign: £750.00

 

  • Total album budget needed: £6,000.00

 

* Of any funds raised over the target amount (after any fees and charges are recouped) 70% will go towards March tour expenses. The remaining 30% going to homeless charity #Shelter .

 

  • It's important that those involved are paid for their time and skill and that the end product is of a high quality and standard both for them, for investors and for me.

  • The target amount is the minimum amount needed to produce this quality and launch the album properly.

  • Making a high quality album and having a proper PR campaign will also help me to take the next step in my professional music career.  

  • If the target is not reached, it may be that some of the ingredients above need to be simplified. For example, a shorter, less involved PR campaign or changes to packaging. Of course, ideally, it is better to have these things; however, if the target is not met, you will still receive your pre ordered album ahead of the official release and any other goodies you order, in return for you kind support and generous contributions. 

  • Should the funding campaign exceed the target amount: Of any funds raised over the target amount (after any fees and charges are recouped) 70% will be used in relation to the album launch tour expenses - for example, advertising/ flyers and posters , travel and accommodation costs. The remaining 30% will be donated to homeless charity #Shelter

  • There are a number of goodies on offer in exchange for your kind and generous support and investment - from or pre ordering or being among the first to receive a copy of the finished product before it’s official release date in March - right up to your very own house concert (UK only). Take your pick! Or if you'd just like to contribute, hit the "Back It" button and choose any amount!

 

The Impact

 

Those of you who know me and my work, will know how much difference this funding will make. I'm grateful for your constant support over the years. I wouldn't be doing this without you! To all investors, I don't ask for your contributions lightly and I take creating a quality CD for you to enjoy very seriously. Thank you for being here. I look forward to seeing you at a gig somewhere in March and being able to thank you in person for your support!

     

    Other Ways You Can Help

    • If you would like to help but aren't able to invest financially, perhaps you'd consider sharing this page and helping me to get the word out and gather support! 
    • Please use the Indiegogo share tools too!

    *Photo's by Kerstin Maier at kemai.de

Or if you'd just like to contribute, hit the "Back It" button and choose any amount!

Those of you who know me and my work, will know how much difference this funding will make. I'm grateful for your constant support over the years. story:
Jeremy Wilms' "LARGE FORMAT" Studio Recording and Master's Thesis

My name is Jeremy Wilms. I've been a professional musician based in New York City for over 20 years. In that time I've had multitudinous and widely varied musical experiences. Here's a partial list of things I've been up to:

I've jammed with Ornette Coleman at his loft and played Broadway revues at retirement communities in New Jersey (sometimes in the same weekend). I was briefly in Chico Hamilton’s band playing guitar, and played bass on Broadway in Fela! the musical. During the tour for Fela! I played with Fela Kuti’s son Femi at the Shrine in Lagos and other venues around the world. I have recorded with artists as diverse as Bebel Gilberto and Beyoncé. I am currently a guitarist in the orchestra for MacArthur Fellowship winner Taylor Mac’s “24 Decade History of Popular Music” as well as the bassist on ABC Network’s “The Gong Show” with host Mike Meyers. I am also the arranger and musical director for The Heathens and other acts based at the fabled Mckittrick Hotel, home of “Sleep No More” in NYC.

I am launching this campaign to finish funding a "large scale" recording project I started this past spring. What was begun as a Master's thesis for the completion of my Composition Degree at Queens College has now become a behemoth of musical diversity and exploration. In the process I have realized the importance of properly finishing the project and getting it released in a legit fashion.

So far the whole recording has been paid for by student loans and personal financing. I've now come to the point of needing contributors to get it properly finished, packaged, publicized, and released to the world. Your contribution will help this goal be achieved and birth what I feel to be my most important work to date.

What We Need & What You Get

The goal is to raise $8,000. This will cover most of the costs of recording, musician fees, mixing and mastering, publicist costs, and money for physical merchandise.

The recording is very broad and far reaching, therefore it has required using many musicians to complete. At current count there are over 30 musicians (!) on the record. As there is still one more song to be recorded, this number could go up to 40. The vast majority of the money raised will go towards musician fees. The contributors are an extremely diverse group culled from top players across scenes and genres I have traversed over my years in NYC. They all have contributed not just time and skill, but love and soul to this project.

The record has also utilized 4 recording studios (and a couple of non-traditional recording facilities) and 4 engineers for tracking. The second largest portion of funds goes to these expenses.

The record is being mixed by the legendary Scott Harding. The third allotment of funds goes to the mixing and mastering of the record.

The record needs design, manufacturing, and distribution of the final product. Although it will be available on the internet for streaming and download, I am also providing physical copies (CD with full liner notes). Any one who donates $20 or more will receive a CD with full artwork and digital download link.

I am confident I can reach the goal, however, if we fall short I will distribute the money to the musicians and engineers first.

The Impact

This project is important to me, and I believe to the community, in many ways.

First of all, it provides an opportunity for wide scale, non-commercially based art music to be created and disseminated without any constrictions on the creator. I have made the music I heard in my head, with some help and guidance from mentors, but without a label or an entity that needed to change or decide things based on commerce. This is extremely important in the world where decisions on what we hear and consume are being made on almost entirely commercial factors. 

Secondly it employs a large number of top musicians and brings people together from varied backgrounds, both socially and musically. It really is a boundary-less community I am involved in and it is important for me to create and share music made this way with the world.

I've produced and performed on many records at this point in my career. In addition to being a side person on a lot of records, I have 3 instrumental records and 2 singer songwriter records as a bandleader. All of these I've produced myself and have used my community to help in the process. 

Making this record is currently the number one focus of my career and will be a very important milestone.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't give money please spread the word! The bigger the network the more chance I have of meeting my goal. Share on facebook, instagram, twitter, the telephone, email, telegram, smoke signal, whatever you got!!!

story:
After almost 8 years since our last full-length album, we are excited and ready to go into the studio for our next addition entitled The Autumn Night Sky (The Starts and I). 

We will be using the contributions exclusively for recording, mixing, mastering, pressing and distribution. 

This is a great way for you to directly incluence the outcome of our next release.

story:
We're STICKY BISCUITS from Berlin and we sing, blip, hoot and occasionally howl about the naughty and nerdy, the raunch and the rocket science, the kinky and the kitchen sink.

Do you need advice on how to make your special evening with your loved one(s) work on the sexual fullfillment level? Are you overwhelmed by your new partner's kinks and ideas? Do we have answers for you on this upcoming EP o(^▽^)o !


(some cover drafts ^_^)

Thanks so much peeps for being interesting in giving us a boost *\(^o^)/* In the last 3 years we've felt wonderfully supported by you. Some of you are already in our Patreon and may ask "Why should I shell out for this too?". Well, a recording project is always a big animal and also we can use this crowdfundey thing as a pre-order for the EP! Obviously you can also just support us because you want us to go on (っ'з')っ



Also we want to do a new video and want it to be the most awesome and wild one we've done so far. More action! More green screen! Oh yeah. All the toys. After touring to many lovely film festivals with 'Sock Puppet' and 'Fuck First' we're ready to get into video making mode again! As always we'll do most stuff ourselves, from the initial songwriting and composing to planning, storyboarding, prepping, puppet/backdrop building to the actual recording, shooting, animating and editing.

Here's how we plan to spend the money:
400 Recording and Mixing
300 CD production costs
300 Material, Studio Rental for new Music Video
 

(a recent live performance of 'Cute Kittens', one of the songs that will be on the EP)

We'll try to send the EP out before Xmas, though depending on where you live we can't guarantee it'll reach you in time for the presents to be unpacked. We'll do our best ᕦ(ò‿óˇ)ᕤ The digital download will definitely reach you before that holiday is here.

thank you so much for supporting (シ_ _)シ !
happy holidays!
Naomi+Marc
STICKY BISCUITS

(P.S. if you want to support us throughout the year so we can put more stuff out (it's not that we ain't got enough ideas!), hop on our Patreon!)

story:
Short Summary

Hi, I'm Bonnie Lowdermilk and excited to talk about my upcoming new CD, "Borderless Crossings".  In summer of 2014 I did a 15,000 foot pass on a trek to Machu Picchu.  It occurred to me that the arduous ascent was a metaphor for the difficult transitions I'd made in life to become a more complete person and musician.  I summited the peak and saw the other side, and crossed over into new territory where former borders of fear and psychological impediments had been torn down.  Today, I live more and more on the other side of these borderless crossings.  The journey became a song, and the song became a title track.

That same summer I was awarded the "Pathways To Jazz" Grant by the Boulder County Arts Alliance to make a jazz CD.  It was so wonderful to go into the studio and just create music, free from the kind of psychological impediments that had hindered me so much in life.  And it was magical the way the music came together.  For example, I wrote some songs specifically for this album.  I had the melody, chords, lyrics, but I really had no concept of how the music would sound when we played it together.  I was blown away by the rich textures, colors, and flavors that resulted.  The stellar cast of musicians include Art Lande on piano, Ron Miles (cornet), Gonzalo Teppa (bass), and Paul Romaine (drums). 

The Pathways to Jazz Grant supplied me with resources to make a wonderful recording.  Now I'm seeking funding for the final product - a jazz CD, available to the public as a CD or digital download.  I'm in the process of doing the mastering, song licensing, artwork, and duplication.

We'd be so grateful for any support you'd like to give us.  Just choose one of the perks that feels right for you, and join us, on these Borderless Crossings!  I can't wait to celebrate with you at the CD release party at Boulder Piano Gallery Performance Space on November 21 at 7:30pm with the musicians!!  (See the perks for more info on that.)  And if you can't make the release party, but want to contribute more, let me know and I'll use your release admit for a volunteer or someone who can't afford the ticket!  We will play a concert of songs from the CD with myself,  Art Lande, Josh Reed (subbing for Ron Miles), Gonzalo Teppa, and Paul Romaine.

The Pathways to Jazz Grant supplied me with resources to make
a wonderful recording.  Now I'm seeking
funding for the final product - a jazz CD, available to the public as a CD or
digital download.  I'm in the process of doing the
mastering, song licensing, artwork, and duplication.
We'd be so grateful for any support you'd like to give
us.  Just choose one of the perks that
feels right for you, and join us, on these Borderless Crossings!  I can't wait to celebrate with you at the CD release party at Boulder Piano Gallery Performance Space on November 21 at 7:30pm with the musicians!!  (See the perks for more info on that.)  And if you can't make the release party, but want to contribute more, let me know and I'll use your release admit for a volunteer or someone who can't afford the ticket!  We will play a concert of songs from the CD with myself,  Art Lande, Josh Reed (subbing for Ron Miles), Gonzalo Teppa, and Paul Romaine.

story:
Where I've Been (Believing Again)

I can't believe it has been over 6 years since I released my EP! 

That was such a huge step for me in believing in myself and seeing myself as a musician.  I'm so thankful for that process.  However, coming out of that, it never felt like it was completely me - this Singer-Songwriter/ Folk style EP.  It was a huge piece of my heart and opened me up to writing and recording, but I knew I needed to find myself in a more full and authentic way.   

So, for the past few years, I've been studying music, writing new songs, and discovering more of my sound.  I got to work on a showcase with a 9 piece band that really helped my see where I could take my songs, and own this bigger Pop/Rock sound that feels so much more like me.  

I am so excited for you guys to hear this new album! You'll get to see how my new sound has come together with a full band, and incredible production team. I'm dreaming big and believing I can see my songs come to life in a big way!

Your support through this campaign would help me finish recording the album, have it mixed and mastered, create some amazing album artwork, and help get my songs on the radio, music blogs, and Spotify playlists.   

There's still so much work left to be done, but with your help I know its going to be amazing! 



Here's the Deal 

Releasing an album on your own is a HUGE undertaking!  Thankfully, I have the help and support of some incredibly talented musicians and engineers who believe in me and what I'm doing (not to mention all of my friends, family, and fans (you guys!!) who have given me so much encouragement along the way). 

The money from this campaign will go towards:

  • Completing Recording - $700 (so close to being done!) 
  • Mixing and Mastering - $3,300
  • Album Artwork - $600-$1,000
  • CD Manufacturing / Printing - $1,500 

If we raise MORE than the goal, the money will go towards:

  • Marketing Campaign 
  • Music Video
  • CD Release Party 
  • CD Release Tour

It's super exciting, and sometimes overwhelming, to see all the possibilities of what I can do with my music (like make a music video or plan a tour?!) but it doesn't magically happen on its own, and I need your help!  SO to thank you for your support, I've come up with some pretty great perks (I think!) for you guys. 

If you liked the song you heard on the intro video, you're in luck!  Everyone who donates at least $5 will get a download of the live off the floor recording of Change Me sent to your email right away.  Now, of course, the whole reason we're here is the album, so you can also get a pre-release download of the album a week before anyone else, a signed physical CD, and even a "Behind the Lyrics" handmade booklet. The perk I'm most excited about is a stripped down acoustic EP of 5 of the songs from the album! The best part?  The EP will be available EXCLUSIVELY to campaign supporters!  AND you don't have to wait for the album to be done - I'll send you the high definition download by the end of June!

Check out the rest of the perks on the right. ---> 


 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren't able to support the album financially, that's totally understandable.  

There are still other ways you show your support and help me out:

  • Share my Indiegogo Campaign on your social media platforms. (There's a share tool right here on Indiegogo)
  • E-mail any friends and family that you think would love my music and might be excited to be a part of the campaign.
  • Like and comment on any of my posts (it really makes such a big difference in how many people see them). 

If you've read this far thank you so much for caring about what I'm doing, whether you are able to contribute or not. I would love to hear your thoughts and any questions or ideas you may have!

Take care,
Bethany

story: My name is Ryan Vetter and I am a Christian Hip Hop producer. I started making beats in January of 2014 when I received Ableton Live music production software the Christmas before. What inspired me to begin producing was watching the Rapzilla Beat Battle 2013 on YouTube, which is a competition annually held in Tampa Bay, FL where a few selected producers are chosen to show off one minute beats in alternation to win the crowd over. Seeing the videos of the producers getting into their own beats and the creativity flowing through their music made me want to begin producing myself. When I first started making music, I had one goal; make it to the Rapzilla Beat Battle 2014. I hoped and prayed that I would reach my goal, and eventually my prayers were answered. When the time for the beat battle came around, Rapzilla had made a contest for any producer to submit a 1 minute track consisting of two 30 second snippets of their best music. Although I submitted mine, I had doubts I would make it because I had the ability to listen to others submissions which made me blind to see my own creativity. You can listen to my submission here:  https://soundcloud.com/ryanvetter/rapzilla-beat-battle-2014-submission. After a few long weeks had passed, I received an email that I had been one of the 8 selected producers to compete. I was in awe. Before I knew it I was flying to Tampa to live out my dream as a producer. You can watch my first battle here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VsDm3n_isZw. I was blessed with the opportunity to compete in the final round but then lost in a rule breaking third beat (regulation was two beats each in alternation). After the battle I felt so extremely grateful and amazed that I even had the chance to compete, and the exposure that it gave me as a producer was awesome. A lot of people after the competition asked me if I had any beats for sale but I didn't since I hadn't even been producing for a year. So about a month after the beat battle I released my first Beat Sale on SoundCloud hoping to make a name for myself and make some good music with some fellow believers in Christ. The beat sale received little to no buzz at all which was confusing because of the hype I got after the battle, but I kept my head up, kept creating, and set new goals. So currently my goal is this album. Instead of trying to bring beats to artists, your donation will bring artists to my beats. Your generous donation will give me the funds to work with known artists in the Christian Hip Hop industry such as Dee-1, Dre Murray, B. Cooper, Thi'sl, Los and many others. With your help I will make this a memorable and life changing project that will be a light to those in a dark place. The album will be available for free download upon release so a donation would much appreciated. Thank you so much!

story:
Our Dream.

Thank you for taking the time to get to know us.

My Background: I'm Corey Ferrugia, an artist, educator, entrepreneur, social activist and above all, a wide-eyed child at heart. Since graduating from The University of Arizona School of Music, I launched my own company, MyTown Music. In 2012, I packed up everything I had from Arizona and moved to Los Angeles with a dream to show the world how my music and the music inside the many young kids I've mentored could make a significant and positive impact in the industry, culture and most importantly... education.

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to raise $80,000. This will go toward the recording, production, mixing, mastering and all the other cost involved of creating multiple EPs, as well as, documenting the entire experience along the way. This is what we've called our MySong Series- the journey of these four students in producing their own EPs.

Every dollar you contribute will not only go toward the making of my record but also, we are going to give these four kids the exact same experience. At every level of contribution, we are offering some awesome perks including handwritten lyrics that we’ll mail to you, CD’s, tee shirts, a private concert and so many other surprises.

    Our Impact

    This project is special because it's a testament of how an individual making art can empower and mentor young kids to do the same. It's my goal to help them pursue their dreams through education and this campaign.

      Other Ways You Can Help

      Help us spread the word about MyTown Music, the MySong Series and this campaign. I strive to empower young artists so the more shares on Facebook, tweets on Twitter, photos on Instagram, and people you tell, the more students I can help reach their dreams.

      Find everything MyTown here:

      www.mytownmusic.com

      www.facebook.com/mytownmusic

      www.facebook.com/corey.ferrugia

      www.twitter.com/mytownmusic

      www.twitter.com/coreyferrugia

      www.instagram.com/mytownmusic

      www.instagram.com/coreyferrugia


        And that's all there is to it.

story:
Sometimes things don't go as planned...

but in a more INCREDIBLE way. 

We are Sit Kitty Sit.  A girl/guy piano and drums "Classical Rock" duo based out of San Francisco, CA.  We've been touring the country making beautifully intense music since 2010 and things have not gone the way we planned. 

Going into the studio in January 2014 we were expecting to lay down a standard kick-ass record and release it in our standard full-color cardboard sleeve packaging. Little did we know that after a few days of recording we would come to realize that this album needed So. Much. More. 

Our 2014 release, "Everlasting Fire", is turning out so beautiful, so glorious and so epic that in order to even do it justice we need to give it the full packaging treatment. 

We have decided on a 1 cd, 6-panel package with an additional 8-page removable booklet all in full color and complete with both imagery and lyrics. We want to take you, the in-depth listener, on a true musical journey with the storyline of this album.

We know the audiophiles are going to be asking "Why not put it on vinyl then?" and we'll tell you; because it's an hour long.  That's why.  Otherwise, if y'all have a couple extra grand laying around please feel free to toss it our way and we'll send you all the double vinyl sets you can handle! (vinyl maxes out at 18 min. per side) 


Please and Thank You...

Truth:  We flat out did not budget for this (mostly because we weren't expecting it).  However, we did budget for our standard cardboard sleeve, which is the same packaging we used for "The Push" (2010) and "Beautiful/Terrible" (2012). 

In order to afford this packaging upgrade we need $3,000. That covers the packaging for 1,000 units, the taxes and the shipping to get the disks into our (and thusly, your) greasy little hands. 

If, by any chance, we surpass our goal the overage will be used on additional SKS merchandise and possibly a long overdue website upgrade.  A band can dream, can't they?  :)

Please check out the perks along the side. They are fun as Hell. Haha!  "Hell".  Album humor. 

(See Below)


Nerd-Alert: The Story of the Album

Our third studio album, "Everlasting Fire", is based entirely on "Inferno" by Dante Alighieri.  Written in the 14th century, "Inferno" (Italian for "hell")  is part one of a three-part allegorical epic poem called The Divine Comedy in which the lead character (Dante, himself) is lead through Hell, then Purgatory, then Heaven.   "Inferno" is the most well-known of the three parts and many of the gruesome and malevolent images of hell we use in mainstream society today actually stemmed from this writing.  Its reference of the seven deadly sins and its graphic imagery have been used in endless art pieces for centuries.  In more modern times, "Inferno" has been used in such movies as "Se7en", "What Dreams May Come" and "Dante's Inferno".  Most of us have at one time or another heard the phrase "Abandon all hope, ye who enter here". Ever wonder where that came from?  That's what's written on the door of hell in "Inferno".  We, as a people, have been using a line that Dante coined for over 700 years.  How cool are we?

As a storyline album, "Everlasting Fire" walks through each circle of hell in the same order as the epic poem. 

The album includes 9 songs for each of the 9 circles of hell, 3 cantos for each of the 3 sections of hell (incontinence, violence and fraud), one song depicting the journey from the 7th to 8th circle and the song "Superbia" (latin: Pride. the worst of the 7 deadly sins which is actually included in every circle of hell) for a total of 15 songs.  Current estimated running time to date: 58 minutes 13 seconds. 

In order to do the storyline justice we had to reach far outside our normal scope of music to include other genres, writing styles, lyrical styles, a slew of guest artists and sounds that are not-quite-human.  All composed and arranged by Kat Downs and Mike Thompson, the album includes:  Rock, Nuevo-Gregorian Chant, Heavy Metal, Folk, Tango, Circus, Contemporary and Blues all while maintaining the Classically-doused Rock sound that Sit Kitty Sit is known and loved for. 

No idea how we pulled that off.  Just enjoy it, okay? 
But seriously - it's amazingly good.  Almost gross.


Kat and Mike, I Have No Money!!

Do not fret, dear friend.  You need good music too.  There are lots of ways you can help:

  • Listen to us on Spotify (both of our previous records are there!)
  • Sign up for our email list on our website
  • "Like" us on Facebook 
  • Watch our music videos from our past releases - My Beloved and Purge
  • Write a review for one of our other albums on iTunes or CDBaby
  • Ask Pandora why they don't have us in rotation.  Ask them a lot.  Ask them all the time. Never stop. Get a team together.  Make a game out of it.
  • Spread the word of our fundraiser along, or use the Indiegogo share tools
  • TELL OTHER PEOPLE ABOUT US!  Nothing actually helps more than word of mouth.  We are the band that's cool to like because we're not cool yet. Get on board, Other People, before we get cool and are therefore no longer cool.

Thanks for reading!

story:
Our Story


  • We are the band Silentts, in the Summer of 2013 we were under a different name and embarked on our first ever across America tour. To be able to do this we had to put ourselves in a temporary debt by buying a bus which would be paid back by the end of the tour. However things went sour, the bus broke down multiple times and after 2 of the members left we were stuck with over $8000 of debt to take care of. Due to this we decided to change our name to Silentts, start over fresh and record a new EP but we were still left with this huge debt.

  • We are aiming to clear ourselves of previous band debt and pay for new music to release to our fans.

  • Anyone who contributes will be helping us pay off a debt that could take us years to clear and help us start releasing new music as soon as possible so that we can start looking forward to the future and not be stuck in the past.
    Contributers will be receiving one of a kind prices that you can not get anywhere else.

Our Goal and Perks

  • For us to be able to start moving forward we will need roughly $15,000
    Here is a breakdown of where everything will be going.
    -($8000) Will be going to clear our bus debt.
    -($3000) Will go to recording, mixing, mastering and press of our New EP ''Young & Reckless".
    -($2000) Will go to recording and releasing a music video for a song on the EP.
    -($2000) Will go to stock the band with new merch which will help us get tour ready.

  • Contributers will be receiving unique and one of a kind prizes and perks.
    these perks include:

    - Personal Thank you shoutouts on our Twitter account (This applies to anyone who contributes $1 or more!)

    - A digital download of our New EP "Young & Reckless"

    - Our first ever limited edition SILENTTS wristband

    - A 10 minute personal phone call with all the members of the band.

    - A 20 minute personal video Skype with all the members of the band.

    - A 100 page personalized notebook address to you. (This notebook will be unique and drawn/written in by all the band members until all the pages are full. This book will also include lyrics written from one of the songs on our New EP "Young & Reckless" as well as all the band signatures on the back page)

    - Your name hand printed for life on the back of Aiden Von Rose acoustic guitar (If you have watched any of our YOUNOW sessions you have for sure seen him playing on this guitar)

    - Your name in the Thank You section of our New EP "Young & Reckless"

    - The full band experience! (When we come to your town to play a show you will show up an hour early and join the band behind the scenes. This includes FREE entry, loading in with the band, sticking around during sound check, free dinner out with the whole band, Hangout during the whole show as well as helping us behind the merch table. This also includes a shirt and wristband of your choice as well as a copy of our New EP "Young & Reckless") (Must provide your own transportation to the show)

    - Your name tattooed on Mike Silentts (Vocalists) leg. (Mike will get your name tattooed on his leg, this includes first name only)

    - A Bass Guitar played by Aiden Von Rose and signed by the whole band (Picture proof of Aiden playing Bass Guitar will be provided)

    - An Electric Guitar played by Nick Nightmares and signed by the whole band (Picture proof of Nick playing Bass Guitar will be provided)

    THIS IS FOR THE PEOPLE WHO HAVE ORDERED ALREADY....

    I'm going to start collecting info now, so it's not a cluster fuck at the end.

    Please email

    silenttsofficial@gmail.com 

    WITH YOUR NAME AS THE SUBJECT LINE

    1. What package you ordered

    2. Your Shipping Address for the Wristband and Personalized Notebook!

    Thanks!

  • If we do not reach our goal of $15,000. The money will go to help record our New EP "Young & Reckless". Anything after $3000 will go towards paying off our debt.
    Anything after $11,000 will go towards Filming a music video for one of our New songs. Anything after $13,000 will go towards New merch to help us get tour ready.

The Impact

Your contribution could help move us forward by months and months. By helping us record this EP and clear this debt we will be able to give our loving fans the music that they deserve and have supported us so long for.

  • With your help we can also move faster towards touring and meeting so many fans that have supported us throughout the years.
  • Thank you so much for your support, you are really helping to make a difference in our lives and helping us move forward.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even just $1 will help us out so much and if you can't afford to contribute with money there are other ways you can help.

  • You can spread the word of this campaign and try to get other people to contribute.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to help spread the word!

And that’s all there is to it.
story_txt:
Our Story

We are the band Silentts, in the Summer of 2013 we were under a different name and embarked on our first ever across America tour. To be able to do this we had to put ourselves in a temporary debt by buying a bus which would be paid back by the end of the tour. However things went sour, the bus broke down multiple times and after 2 of the members left we were stuck with over $8000 of debt to take care of. Due to this we decided to change our name to Silentts, start over fresh and record a new EP but we were still left with this huge debt.

We are aiming to clear ourselves of previous band debt and pay for new music to release to our fans.

Anyone who contributes will be helping us pay off a debt that could take us years to clear and help us start releasing new music as soon as possible so that we can start looking forward to the future and not be stuck in the past.Contributers will be receiving one of a kind prices that you can not get anywhere else.

Our Goal and Perks

For us to be able to start moving forward we will need roughly $15,000Here is a breakdown of where everything will be going.-($8000) Will be going to clear our bus debt. -($3000) Will go to recording, mixing, mastering and press of our New EP ''Young & Reckless".-($2000) Will go to recording and releasing a music video for a song on the EP.-($2000) Will go to stock the band with new merch which will help us get tour ready.

Contributers will be receiving unique and one of a kind prizes and perks. these perks include:- Personal Thank you shoutouts on our Twitter account (This applies to anyone who contributes $1 or more!)- A digital download of our New EP "Young & Reckless"- Our first ever limited edition SILENTTS wristband- A 10 minute personal phone call with all the members of the band.- A 20 minute personal video Skype with all the members of the band.- A 100 page personalized notebook address to you. (This notebook will be unique and drawn/written in by all the band members until all the pages are full. This book will also include lyrics written from one of the songs on our New EP "Young & Reckless" as well as all the band signatures on the back page)- Your name hand printed for life on the back of Aiden Von Rose acoustic guitar (If you have watched any of our YOUNOW sessions you have for sure seen him playing on this guitar)- Your name in the Thank You section of our New EP "Young & Reckless"- The full band experience! (When we come to your town to play a show you will show up an hour early and join the band behind the scenes. This includes FREE entry, loading in with the band, sticking around during sound check, free dinner out with the whole band, Hangout during the whole show as well as helping us behind the merch table. This also includes a shirt and wristband of your choice as well as a copy of our New EP "Young & Reckless") (Must provide your own transportation to the show)- Your name tattooed on Mike Silentts (Vocalists) leg. (Mike will get your name tattooed on his leg, this includes first name only) - A Bass Guitar played by Aiden Von Rose and signed by the whole band (Picture proof of Aiden playing Bass Guitar will be provided)- An Electric Guitar played by Nick Nightmares and signed by the whole band (Picture proof of Nick playing Bass Guitar will be provided)THIS IS FOR THE PEOPLE WHO HAVE ORDERED ALREADY....I'm going to start collecting info now, so it's not a cluster fuck at the end.Please emailsilenttsofficial@gmail.com WITH YOUR NAME AS THE SUBJECT LINE1. What package you ordered2. Your Shipping Address for the Wristband and Personalized Notebook!Thanks!

If we do not reach our goal of $15,000. The money will go to help record our New EP "Young & Reckless". Anything after $3000 will go towards paying off our debt.Anything after $11,000 will go towards Filming a music video for one of our New songs. Anything after $13,000 will go towards New merch to help us get tour ready.

The ImpactYour contribution could help move us forward by months and months. By helping us record this EP and clear this debt we will be able to give our loving fans the music that they deserve and have supported us so long for.
With your help we can also move faster towards touring and meeting so many fans that have supported us throughout the years.

Thank you so much for your support, you are really helping to make a difference in our lives and helping us move forward.

Other Ways You Can HelpEven just $1 will help us out so much and if you can't afford to contribute with money there are other ways you can help.
You can spread the word of this campaign and try to get other people to contribute.

Use the Indiegogo share tools to help spread the word!

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Hello everyone!

It's me, Justin Marc Lloyd! You might know me because you have one of my tapes, or maybe I'm one of your weird Facebook friends. Maybe I exited your birth canal on September 24th, 1984. Or possibly you know the beautiful lady. Perhaps we are blood related! Or, you could have no idea who I am whatsoever. If you fall into any of these categories (I think I covered everyone in existence), then qualify for reading this.

First: I debated setting up one of these things for this particular purpose for a long time now. It's been on-and-off a "ok I'm gonna do this" since last year. On one hand, I felt as if this would be a really silly reason to try and raise funds. It's not benefiting any touring bands, it's not a charity for the needy, it's not helping the (really) poor, homeless, or disabled. I felt as if this may be too self-important or self-centered to make into a real thing. But on the other hand, there are rewards involved in your contributions, and if you are someone whom I care about and/or vice versa, I feel like it's perfectly okay for me to accept help with something. Or maybe you are just swimming in dollar bills because you have a great job, and you like to help people with the excess. Maybe you're a war criminal, and you need something to go on the books to prove that you're not a fascist sociopath. Either way, if you'd like to help me with this, I appreciate it.

Second: The last thing I want, is for someone who can't give, to give. I don't want $50 from you if you live barely paycheck-to-paycheck with debt collectors calling you every morning and afternoon. If you are that person, we're in the same boat, and that boat is precisely why this campaign exists.

Basically, due to a blizzard of surprise financial woes, car accidents, insurance problems, my difficulty finding work, and intrusive health issues, I am what they would call "the hole" to say the least! I have family I need/want to visit, and some stuff I'd like to bring from the east back to the midwest in which I've never been able to find the money/time/space to transport.

Here are the details, and we've only got 2 weeks!

First: I want to visit my mom, dad and sister, who across the US. I've seen them a few times since I moved, but only for extremely brief periods amidst a tour. The last few times I was going to visit, I had to cancel due to uncontrollable circumstances. I would like to see my sister for her birthday, my parents for their anniversary, my grandmother who is very sick, and my #1 best friend in the world. That requires funds for fuel and a little food.

Second: There is a deductible I have to pay before I can get my car fixed, which is something that is imperative I do before I even attempt to travel. (The damage is due to an accident I got where my tires blew out and I collided with a highway divider). Needless to say, that tour, where I was going to visit Maryland for one day, was abruptly cancelled.

Bang! Crash! Blast-beat!

A lot of you know that I am a drummer at heart, first and foremost. I've never had a way to get my drums to Chicago. I was just using two cars to get my belongings here in the first place, so I had to leave some furniture, an entire drum set, and other instruments behind. I'd love to get my hands on my drums again. There is actually a band here who I've been wanting to play for and we are all just basically waiting until I can get my drums back to have a first rehearsal! This is actually another good chunk of the reason why I want to make this trip, and specifically outside of a tour. This way, I will have room for the drums, instead of having a car full of friends and gear getting in the way.

If You Can't Help

I love you anyway! If you want to help in a way that doesn't involve money, there is really not much I can suggest for you. I hate to say it, but the root of all evil is exactly what I need to be able to get home, let alone home and back. My happiness in seeing my peeps will take care of the rest. Don't feel guilty! Don't feel pressured! If you like having fun and/or making art, there is a mixtape opportunity below for you to submit to. That'll help contribute to the perks on your right.

Additional Information

First: If you don't care for limited edition CDr's or cassettes of experimental music released on a DIY label run out of an apartment, but you'd still like to donate, let me know and we can figure out a custom "perk" for you that doesn't involve a bunch of stuff (and discounts on stuff) that is useless to you. Perhaps some more artwork can be thrown in, or some chores or favors. If you live near me and only ride a bike or take public transportation, hit me up for a ride somewhere!

Second: The actual amount I will receive, after fees, is $465. Honestly, this is about $15 above what I will need, bare minimum, for my car and the trip. I am not trying to make a profit, I am trying to cover necessary expenses and nothing more, so that I can drive to Maryland and back once. I will pay for the shipping of perks with my own money when I get back home.

Third: If I receive more than my goal, I will use the extra money to take my family out to dinner or lunch for my parents' anniversary and my sister's birthday!

Compilation/Mixtape!

If you are interested in submitting a track for the compilation tape/mixtape that will be distributed to those who donate the sufficient amount, please do! I have set no genre limitations, but I suspect most submissions will be experimental in nature considering my social community. Maybe I will have some fun with it and remix a few tracks. Or throw on a few songs I like by other artists. If you don't play music, record yourself reading something. Record your TV with your smartphone. Send me a funny voicemail someone sent you. Leave me a voicemail. Send me someone else's song. These tapes will be free to contributors, and not sold, so anything goes. It'll be fun. There is no time limit but please be modest. The deadline is the same as the deadline for this campaign.
