story:
You can preorder Mou 1.0 from our store with 50% discount if you missed our indiegogo campaign!

http://25.io/mou/store/

Update August 31, 2015: We planned to ship Mou 1.0 on August 31, but the new OS X brings serious compatible issue, we're still working on it. Sorry for couldn't ship it on time, we feel so ashamed. We'll update this page upon any news. Until that, please continue enjoy the free Mou 0.8.7 beta, thank you!
Update July 27, 2015: Things goes well, we're going to release Mou 1.0 this August. The release date will be August 31. No more delay this time.
Update April 4, 2015: Mou 1.0 is a little difficult than we’ve expected, we’re still working on several issues, not sure if we can finish it at the end of this month. If we couldn’t, we have to delay, very sorry about this.

Mou, the Markdown editor loved by 300,000+ users


Mou 1.0 is not only about new features, but also performance improvement and bug fixes.

Mou has been in beta for years, it was once Chen Luo's personal sparetime project. After 3 years of development, more than 300,000 people are using Mou, and this number is keep increasing.

But Chen has never thought of Mou could become so popular today, as the user group grows, more and more feedback comes, he soon realized the bottleneck of one man sparetime development: There're too much planned for 1.0 and there're so little a single developer could do with his sparetime.

To finish the 1.0 goal, early this year, Chen even thought of selling Mou to a team with enough ability, but didn't find a suitable one.

Chen Luo didn't give up, instead of selling Mou to another team, today he is trying to build his own team (25.io Inc), wanting to work full-time on Mou.

We need funds to build the team. We need your help. Your funds could help us hiring extra developers, working full-time on Mou. In return, we'll listen feedback from our contributors, implement the most wanted features, make Mou 1.0 for you.

Previous donators still will get 1.0 license for free, but your contribution here could help us to make Mou 1.0 actually happen.

How Much Funding We Need

Our goal is $20,000 USD.  It'll be used to pay basic salary to our developers. It's enough for supporting 1 developer working full-time for 1 year, or 2 developers working full-time for half year. That'll be enough for us to finish Mou 1.0.

Please follow  @Mou on Twitter and spread the words to help us to reach the goal, post it on Twitter, Facebook or anywhere you could reach. We appreciate your help!

You know journalists work for tech media? Help us spread the words！


What You Get

The most exciting parts of supporting us is that we listen feedback from our contributors. We'll pick the most wanted features from our contributors, implement them in 1.0. We don't make Mou 1.0 for ourselves, we make it for you.

We'll send a secret email address to our contributors where you can make feature requests to Mou 1.0.

We'll mark our contributors' feedback as high priority compares to non-contributors.

Besides that, you'll also get a license for free when Mou 1.0 releases, and other benefits depends on the amount of your contribution.

  • Contribute $10: Mou 1.0 license + Feature requests
  • Contribute $20: Mou 1.0 license + Feature requests
  • Contribute $30: Mou 1.0 license + Mou Stickers + Feature requests


  • Contribute $40: Mou 1.0 license + Jumping Frog + Feature requests

  • Contribute $99: Mou 1.0 license + MouStand Black White + Feature requests


  • Contribute $199: Mou 1.0 license + MouStand Color Packs + Feature requests


  • Contribute $299: You'll get all the above! Mou 1.0 license + MouStand Color Packs + MouStand Black White + Jumping Frog + Mou Stickers + Feature requests

Official Mou Partner: 


Being an Official Mou Partner means that we'll place your company's link and logo on the homepage of the most popular Markdown editor on the Mac!

  • Contribute $5000: Place your company's link and logo on Mou's official website for at least 5 years! That's only $2.7/day!

Limit to the first 8 companies.

Update October 28, 2014:

coding.net contributed $5,000 and become our second partner!

Update October 23, 2014:

「知乎」contributed $5,000 and become our first partner!


When will Mou 1.0 release?

We hope to release Mou 1.0 in early 2015, if we reach the goal. Please follow  @Mou on Twitter and spread the words to help us to reach the goal, post it on Twitter, Facebook or anywhere you could reach. Thank you!

You know journalists work for tech media? Help us spread the words！

Can you open source Mou?

We'll be glad to open source Mou if we can reach $100,000 USD (5 times of our $20,000 USD goal).

If we can't reach $100,000 USD but reached $20,000 USD, we won't open source Mou but will still offer Mou 1.0 license for free to our contributors.

Forget the crappy clones, let's open source the original Mou!

story:
THANK YOU EVERYBODY! WE HAVE REACHED OUR GOAL! 

PLEASE DO NOT SEND ANYMORE MONEY THROUGH THIS INDIEGOGO. We were not able to shut it down completely because of Indiegogo's rules and because of their fees, we have raised over $650, but have only been sent $615. 
For more information on the Ad itself, follow @Princess_Karah and @_BoysOnTheBlock on Twitter and visit www.boysontheblock.com. 

Summary

We are a group of Backstreet Boys fans from BoysOnTheBlock.Com who want to show Brian Littrell and Kevin Richardson how proud we are of them by taking out an ad in the Kentucky Music Hall of Fame Program to Brian and Kevin from ALL Backstreet Boys fans. 

What We Need & What You Get

In order to take an 8x11 inch full page ad out in the program, we need to gather up $600. 

The ad will have a short letter written to the boys, telling them how proud we are and will be signed "Love, the Backstreet Army" or either "Backstreet Boys fans worldwide."

Also, we plan on (in small type at the bottom) listing those that donated money to help take out the ad. More things may be added to the ad later on as we see how quickly money can be raised. 

What if we don't get $600?

According to indiegogo.com, with the set up we made, if we do not reach the goal of $600, everybody will be refunded the money that they gave within 4-5 days. Let's hope that doesn't happen!

Will Brian and Kevin even see the ad?

According to the people at the Kentucky Music Hall of Fame, both Brian and Kevin have been confirmed by their management to be in attendance at the event in April, so they will see them. 

Stay up-to-date

To stay up-to-date on the latest on this project, visit www.boysontheblock.com or follow the site on Twitter @_BoysOnTheBlock.

Stay up-to-dateTo stay up-to-date on the latest on this project, visit www.boysontheblock.com or follow the site on Twitter @_BoysOnTheBlock.

story:
Pieneņu Vīns showcase in Japan

International music conference is a very important event in the music industry. Imagine a whole bunch of concert venues fully dedicated to musicians from all over the world who showcase their music to the music fans and industry professionals, making valuable industry connections and showing their creative product to promote and sell it.

Kansai Music Conference is the only independently run, globally oriented music conference in Japan that features a wide range of music, sponsors seminars and workshops about the music industry, bringing together musicians and industry professionals from all over the world and providing them all possible opportunities to promote their product to wide audience. The event takes place nearby Osaka, the city that in the year 2014 has become a home for All-Star concert of the International Jazz Day on April 30th.

This year a Latvian band with a 10-year stage experience Pieneņu Vīns (Dandelion Wine) has been appraised by Kansai Music Conference board and selected to represent Latvia in the funk/jazz/fusion genre. The dates selected for Pieneņu Vīns are September 19-20, 2015.

Pieneņu Vīns is known for participating in numerous festivals, concerts, contests and awards (International Jazz Day Latvia 2014, Riga Funk Fest 2014, Best Debut 2011, Clazz Jazz and many others), collaborating with different musicians (Inga Bērziņa, Fil Straughan, Tommaso Troncon etc.) and launching various digital projects, e.g. the first immersive music video in the country STOP360.  This year the band is launching it's debut album and this, along with representing Latvia in Kansai Music Conference, would be the best present for it's 10th anniversary.


What We Need & What You Get

In order to fulfill its noble goal and showcase its music worldwide, Pieneņu Vīns needs to cover travel expenses, musical instrument transportation and accommodation expenses. That's where we need YOU. Every word that you spread matters. Every euro you share gets us closer. Every friend that you tell about us helps us to share what we've got and what we've learned during 10 years of our existence. 

So we need a couple of thousands euro funding for:

  • Travelling through half of the globe from Riga, Latvia to Kansai, Japan, and returning back;
  • Bringing our musical instruments with us (these things need cautious safe transportation too);
  • Transportation inside the country and accommodation for us - 6 people on the stage, a manager and a photo/video/technical specialist.
Give&get is what we love most: for every contribution you will be awarded, just choose: brand new signed CD as soon as it's done, Ray Bradbury's book as an inspiration for the band, real Latvian produced dandelion wine, honey or sweets, a whole concert just for you, your logo/name placement on our webpage or even an opportunity to choose which dress will the frontwoman of the band Evilena wear to represent Latvia in Japan!
In case we don't reach our entire goal the money you've donated will go to working on our second album and probably making a brand new music video out of it.

You matter!

As for every small but beautiful country, bringing its name loud on the worldwide arena is very important. Especially if the cause is hidden in culture, music, the genre of funk and jazz that unites people, stimulates intercultural dialogue, diversity and mutual understanding. 

We want to make this impact, so please:

  • donate some money if you feel like it
  • make some noise and ask friends to help
  • share information on your blog/social media and see how the world slowly turns a better place because we make it so! :)

story:
When I was 9 years old my father surprised me with 3rd row center Cyndi Lauper tickets! During the concert I jumped two rows  just to reach my hand up to hold hers while she sang 'True Colors' to me and thousands more. 

As fate would have it, I met one of the beautiful writers of True Colors while living in L.A. pursing my musical dreams.  Billy Steinberg  actually reworked a song of mine called Cake!  Here is my version of True Colors that I recorded on my I Phone via  Soundcloud https://soundcloud.com/vessymink/vessy-sings-true-colors-at?utm_source=soundcloud&utm_campaign=share&utm_medium=twitter

Ever since 1989 when this rock star seed was sewn, I have wanted to be a recording artist.  With a loving supportive fan base who understand and feel the songs that  I write, I know that anything is possible and that the bigger picture is quite more beautiful than any of us can imagine.Truly we have a beautiful common red thread that connects us all and reminds us why we are here...to love and be loved.          

Having one studio album and one live record under my belt, along with having 4 children in 5 years from 2009-2013, I feel very blessed to have accomplished what I have thus far. That said, I have yet to make the album of my life. I believe it will be my best musical work to date. I have been working on these songs for the past 8 years and there are a few amazing co-writes that will be included. During this time I have licensed my music quite a bit.                                                                                         Here are two collaborations  that I did with birth, newborn and family filmmaker,         Jodie Myers:

 https://vimeo.com/55677738           https://vimeo.com/59263653

I  know what studio I would like to record my  album in. I know who the bright lights are that I would like to work with in making this said record.  All I need now is the funding to realize my goal. It will cost $2000 per song. I want to do 13 of them so really I want to raise $26 K but I cannot edit the amount now that I have launched this campaign. I will make a great record with my band HOT NOISE no matter how much I raise is what's what.  Following the completion of my dream album,  it is my intention to complete another record of all the wonderful children's songs that I have come to know and love through my Bulgarian and German roots as well as a plethora of original kids songs that I have written in the past 6 years that have been wildly inspired by my most precious gift ever, my 4 beautiful children and of course my amazingly brilliant and resilient intelligent loving giving husband, Kevin Hill, who ROCKS on the drums (and is a beautiful songwriter whom I would be utterly lost without.)

I must shed light on my very first introduction into the beautiful world of music that has accompanied me throughout my life and that is at the heart of everything I am as an artist and human being for that matter. If it were not for my beautiful parents, grand parents and 4 siblings who have given me the voice to sing and the experience to sing about, I would never be here writing this to you. It is to them that I owe my biggest debt of gratitude  for all their love support and sacrafice that they have poured into me and my dreams. My whole family is very artistic indeed and I feel that I am the luckiest person I know.

Thank you from the utter core of my being for every supportive word and thought that anyone has ever sent my way as well as the critiques and criticisms that have garnished a determined individual within me.  It is because of you that I have had the courage to continue living my dream. And to those who I do not yet know, that have stumbled upon my story, thank you for finding me:)

I love you all and I love my life!!!

Now let's make a record!!!

Love,

Vessy Mink

campaign_city: Lake in the Hills, United States

story:
For those of you who don't know...

My name is Dan Romans. I'm a musician living in New York City. In addition to drumming, singing and playing keyboard I am a composer and songwriter. I have a band called the DRX that is my compositional vessel. Although the DRX has been inactive for long periods of time it has existed, produced albums and performed live since 2009. The DRX is a unique and dynamic rock band. The music is heavy, emotive, and lush and marries a diverse set of musical tones into a cohesive sound. Explore the first two albums by the DRX at thedrx.bandcamp.com.
The Purpose

This campaign is meant to support the completion and release of a concept album entitled Throughout Within. The writing of this album started in 2011 and has slowly progressed amidst other musical endeavors, work and the activity of life. After completing the writing of this album, rehearsing the material and organizing logistics I am now in the last phase of the recording process. Vocals will be tracked during April, the album will be mixed during May and then mastered and completed in the beginning of June. 

Your contribution will help me compensate the wonderful musicians and technicians who have offered me their skill and talent to produce my vision. Some because they require it and all because they deserve it. This album, as it is intended to be, would not be possible without their efforts nor would the act of creating it be quite as gratifying. 

The Album

Throughout Within is a full length album with a total of eight tracks nearing one hour in play. It is grand in scope and deep in meaning. The album is conceptual in its lyrics and music. 

The story of the album is about the understanding of our existence, socially and spiritually. The story of the album confronts the topics of oppression, the many forms of inconspicuous modern slavery, denial and irresponsibility, fear and depression, disconnection, anger and shame and ultimately, perspective and unity.

The songs of the album are wholly thematic and motif based. They are melodically, harmonically and rhythmically aligned and reflective. From a hardcore breakdown, to a choral passage to a pop chorus; each moment of this album is a seamless and uninterrupted immersion into one world. The composition presents a diverse array of variations that are always anchored by repeating hooks. 

The core instrumentation of Throughout Within is voice, tenor saxophone, keyboard, electric guitar, synth bass and drum set with additional instrumentation on several tracks including clarinet, trumpet, flugelhorn, bass saxophone, violin, cello, electric cello and choir. 

The album is engineered by Jon Grabowski and Tyler Hartman, mixed by Vince Welch (Bent Knee) and includes performance by members of these bands: Beauchene Skulls, Blank Paper, Buke and Gase, Jerseyband, Kayo Dot, Mount Gomery, My Mountain, Emily Peal and Stern.

The Request

I am reaching out to you, my community and fellow humans, to inspire and request your participation in this campaign and consequently in the full potential of this album. My goal is to raise $2000 to supplement the expenditure of my own earnings and properly compensate the musicians and technicians who have given me their skill, talent, effort and time and have helped me to produce a beautiful and evocative recorded shareable version of my music and message.  The collected contributions from this campaign will be solely dedicated to the production and release of this album. No steak dinners for Dan Romans : )

The Incentive

I regret asking for money because I do not value money and feel it is divisive and destructive to our society, however, it is integral to the strong standing paradigm that we live in and it is a tool I must use amongst convention. Considering this, I must allow a balance and accept the usage of the thing that I criticize; knowing that I am using it out of necessity to produce something that is indeed wholesome.

You should contribute to this campaign if you have an interest in what I have created, a fondness of music, an appreciation for art. You should contribute if it will make you feel a part of this work, connected to the message, a promoter of expression. You should contribute to this campaign as much for yourself as you would for me. To put energy into something that you can adopt. To know that you procured the chance to sing along to this album and call it your own.

I encourage you to share this information with anyone you think would be interested in the DRX and my new album, Throughout Within. For every word of this you've read and every thought put towards it and every consideration or contribution I extend the most profound thanks and praise. As I have extracted this music from my mind, body and spirit my greatest hope and reward will be to share what I have created with others and pass on a message and experience of realization and positivity.

"Trichotomy, of which a wisdom sees, is all, is simply to be, peace and stillness, loving oneness, resonating concentric beauty"

Dan Romans

story:
Hello wonderful people.

Thank you for checking out my indiegogo fundraiser.

Some of you know me but for those who don’t I am Bronwen Clacherty. I am a musician and I have been working as a percussionist for 5 years. For the past year I have been working on a solo project where I sing, play keyboard, umrhubhe (mouth bow), uhadi, percussion, vibraphone, kalimba and mbira I have an obsession with Xhosa music and instruments and so I wanted to try and use some songs that I know in Xhoza and re arrange them to become more like my own sound. I then got inspired and wrote some original songs as well.

You can hear my music at: http://www.youtube.com/channel/UCFM8Ju737e6U93pdg01SlOw

And

https://soundcloud.com/bronwen-clacherty/tracks


I have decided to record some of this music on an EP in order to promote the project and for people to have a taste of what I’ve been up to.


I need your help to be able to pay for the whole process.

It will cost roughly:

R4000 to record

R4000 to mix and master

R2000 for the musicians

R2000 for the cover art

R5000 for printing

 

I am so excited to create this EP for everyone to hear the music that I love!

 I would really appreciate any donations that you can give. A little money or a lot or even just spread the word to other people who can donate.

story:
Greetings! 

Welcome officially to my INDIEGOGO Campaign for:

EGREM: Digging in the Crates of the Island of Music.

A multi-media project to pay tribute to the most extensive historical account of one of the world’s most complete and influential collections of Cuban music.

My name is Ariel Fernandez Diaz, professionally known as DJ ASHO.  I am a Cuban entrepreneur, journalist, lecturer, DJ, cultural promoter and filmmaker from Havana, Cuba now living in New York City. I have been involved in the Cuban music community for the past 20 years producing events and festivals, magazines, record compilations, as well as documenting and lecturing at prestigious universities. Music and people are my passions, the epicenter of everything I do. I am an avid vinyl/record collector. I own a very precious collection of Cuban records, and I need your support to help me share it with the world. How? By being a part of my upcoming endeavor.

For more info about myself please visit: www.arielfernandezdiaz.com

EGREM in CUBA: Digging in the Crates of the Island of Music is a multi-media project which celebrates half a century of Cuba’s music production and recordings at EGREM (Empresa de Grabaciones y Ediciones Musicales), Spanish for Recordings and Musical Editions Enterprise. On March 31, 1964, EGREM was born, heir to all the record labels that existed previously in Cuba. EGREM is the oldest Cuban record company founded after 1959, and is home to numerous labels including the original EGREM label, and sub-labels such as the renowned Areito and Siboney. EGREM is also home to the Estudio EGREM recording studio which is known as the home of the Buena Vista Social Club project, which brought a revival of international attention and interest to Cuban music over the past decade.

THE EGREM PROJECT.

The EGREM project consists of a coffee table book with original images of album covers of the most important records in the label’s history. The book will be accompanied by a compilation CD and a feature length documentary DVD with interviews of the musicians, technicians, label employees and executives, visual artists and graphic designers, who have nurtured and maintained the label over the last 50 years.

This will be the first multi-media project to pay tribute to EGREM; the most extensive historical account of one of the world’s most complete and influential collections of Cuban music. By documenting fifty years of recordings, graphic design, pressing and distribution, the EGREM project will reveal, for the first time, the behind the scenes history of the birth and development of contemporary Cuban recorded music. It will be a testament to the impact of the record label and it’s recordings in Cuba and around the globe, and will provide a visual history of the vibrant subculture of record collecting through the art of the album cover. It is essential simply because it will vividly explore an element of music culture that has withered with the advent of MP3’s and digital downloading: vinyl records and the stories behind them.

This multi-media project will gather together a unique and worldly selection of records and covers that spin deep, bizarre, and mind-boggling narratives. The project is not deciphering mysteries but merely re-discovering and re-introducing those records to old and new generations of music fans, DJ’s and record collectors, just adding and paying homage to the mythos and legacy of those records and recordings.

THE GOAL.

This project can’t be completed without your support. We need to raise $25,000 (more than $5,000 will be consumed itself on IndieGogo and PayPal fees as well shipment of perks) for the "first stage" of the project: shooting the documentary part.  Funds will be spent exclusively on hiring photographers, cinematographers and a production team to shoot for a whole month throughout the country and interview musicians, technicians, employees and executives behind the label. By the end of May we hope to have enough material to edit a trailer to attract potential producers for post-production funds and distribution of the whole project. Funds in this "first stage" will be also used for digitization of all of the record covers.

THE ULTIMATE GOAL.

To have the book and documentary ready in December of 2014 to be presented at Festival of Nuevo Cine Latinoamericano de la Habana. The book, compilation CD and documentary will be released exclusively in the U.S and Europe.

WHY EGREM? WHY VINYLS?

EGREM is the quintessential Cuban label. For nearly 35 years, EGREM remained the only record label in Cuba and was the place where Cuba’s most celebrated artists made their first recordings. From Chucho Valdes & Irakere, Frank Fernandez, and Omara Portuondo, to Adalberto Álvarez, Juan Formell y Los Van Van, Elena Burke, Silvio Rodriguez and Pablo Milanes, EGREM has been the cradle of Cuban music recordings and continues to house the most extensive catalog of Cuban music across genres in the world. With over 10,000 published masters of Rumba, Cha-cha-cha, Guaracha, Danzon, Mambo, Son, Bolero, Classical, Salsa, Rock, Hip Hop and Fusion, EGREM has also hosted international legends such as Nat King Cole, Josephine Baker, Sonia Silvestre, Soledad Bravo, Vicente Garrido, Susana Baca, and Roy Brown.

It is a vast archive that holds true musical gems. Imagine a small island like Cuba -with a population of 11 million inhabitants- that many referred as La Isla de la Música (the Island of Music) because such extensive musical history, traditions and richness in music and musical genres, and ALL of this music for fifty years, being absorbed in his vast majority by just one record label.

Until the early 90’s EGREM catalogue was published and printed solely on Vinyl, which today have become collector’s items and very hard to find pieces developing a vast cult of music aficionados who try to catch them when it is possible in records stores and fairs around the globe. Vinyl records possess a visual as well an aural capacity for storytelling. The record cover -often eye candy for the music lover- speaks a language rooted in the environment and era of the music itself. A record can create a profound sense of intimacy with its owner, and it's this relationship that we all share. Every album cover tells a story and speaks directly to the people who make music relevant and popular. By putting them together in a book -as both archive and sideshow- we can easily evaluate and define the visual and sonic aesthetics of a whole era.

READY TO JOIN ME?

This project "first stage" goal is totally achievable and possible; let’s make it happen together. If you cannot give money to our project there are many other ways you can help us! Get the noise around, tell people about this project and how they can help! Tweet, share on Facebook, take a snapshot and Instagram it, shout it out from the rooftops! You get the drift! Do you know someone who would be interested to give to our project or help in anyway? Let us know! Thank you!

PERKS. HOW WORKS?

Next to right are the perks we are offering to contributors, please select a category and please read the instructions. If you are not interested in perks, you can simply select any category from the right then "change perks" and pick the "no perk" option.

We will be updating this page marking sold-out perks and adding new ones so check back!

How will you know my size for the T-shirts?

If you picked a perk that includes a T-shirt, sizes available are S, M, L, XL.

We will be in touch to get your t-shirt sizes.

Can I pick more than one perk?

Yes but you must pay for them separately so that we can keep track of what you chose.

Can I contribute more money than a particular category?

Sure, if you chose a perk that is $50 and you want to give $100 or more go ahead and enter the number manually upon checkout.

I don't want a perk, can I still donate?

Sure, first pick any perk from the Indiegogo menu on the right, in the next page click "change perk". Then choose "No perk I just want to donate".

I chose my perk, now what?

Please refer to the REFERENCE DIAGRAM and then choose the perk from the Indiegogo menu on the right, check out and enter the code next to your shipping address.

Make Payment trough PayPal at djasho@gmail.com

For questions check the FAQ or send us an email at djasho@gmail.com

MI GENTE: I am not simply asking you for money but to collaborate with me. To be a Part of this AMAZING project so I can look to your face and hug you and say THANK U: I did it because of YOU! Clicking LIKE is beautiful but contributing is the REAL DEAL. 

Let's go!. 

Donate and Share!

The journey has just begun!  

Ache’!

story_txt:
Greetings! Welcome officially to my INDIEGOGO Campaign for:EGREM: Digging in the Crates of the Island of Music.A multi-media project to pay tribute to the most extensive historical account of one of the world’s most complete and influential collections of Cuban music.My name is Ariel Fernandez Diaz, professionally known as DJ ASHO.  I am a Cuban entrepreneur, journalist, lecturer, DJ, cultural promoter and filmmaker from Havana, Cuba now living in New York City. I have been involved in the Cuban music community for the past 20 years producing events and festivals, magazines, record compilations, as well as documenting and lecturing at prestigious universities. Music and people are my passions, the epicenter of everything I do. I am an avid vinyl/record collector. I own a very precious collection of Cuban records, and I need your support to help me share it with the world. How? By being a part of my upcoming endeavor.For more info about myself please visit: www.arielfernandezdiaz.com
EGREM in CUBA: Digging in the
Crates of the Island of Music is a multi-media project which celebrates half
a century of Cuba’s music production and recordings at EGREM (Empresa de Grabaciones
y Ediciones Musicales), Spanish for Recordings and Musical Editions Enterprise.
On March 31, 1964, EGREM was born, heir to all the record labels that existed
previously in Cuba. EGREM is the oldest Cuban record company founded after 1959,
and is home to numerous labels including the original EGREM label, and sub-labels
such as the renowned Areito and Siboney. EGREM is also home to the Estudio EGREM recording studio which is known as the home of the Buena Vista Social Club project, which
brought a revival of international attention and interest to Cuban music over
the past decade.THE EGREM PROJECT.
The EGREM project consists of a
coffee table book with original images of album covers of the most important
records in the label’s history. The book will be accompanied by a compilation
CD and a feature length documentary DVD with interviews of the musicians,
technicians, label employees and executives, visual artists and graphic
designers, who have nurtured and maintained the label over the last 50 years.
This will be the first
multi-media project to pay tribute to EGREM; the most extensive historical
account of one of the world’s most complete and influential collections of
Cuban music. By documenting fifty years of recordings, graphic design, pressing
and distribution, the EGREM project will reveal, for the first time, the behind
the scenes history of the birth and development of contemporary Cuban recorded
music. It will be a testament to the impact of the record label and it’s
recordings in Cuba and around the globe, and will provide a visual history of
the vibrant subculture of record collecting through the art of the album cover.
It is essential simply because it will vividly explore an element of music
culture that has withered with the advent of MP3’s and digital downloading:
vinyl records and the stories behind them.This multi-media project will gather together a unique and worldly selection of records and covers that spin deep, bizarre, and mind-boggling narratives. The project is not deciphering mysteries but merely re-discovering and re-introducing those records to old and new generations of music fans, DJ’s and record collectors, just adding and paying homage to the mythos and legacy of those records and recordings.THE GOAL.
This project can’t be completed
without your support. We need to raise $25,000 (more than $5,000 will be consumed itself on IndieGogo and PayPal fees as well shipment of perks) for the "first stage" of the project:
shooting the documentary part.  Funds will be spent exclusively on hiring photographers, cinematographers and a production team to shoot for a whole month throughout the country and interview musicians, technicians, employees and executives behind the label. By the end of May we hope to have enough material to edit a trailer to attract potential producers for post-production funds and distribution of the whole project. Funds in this "first stage" will
be also used for digitization of all of the record covers.THE ULTIMATE GOAL.To have the book and documentary ready in December of 2014 to be presented at Festival of Nuevo Cine Latinoamericano de la Habana. The book, compilation CD and documentary will be released exclusively in the U.S and Europe.WHY EGREM? WHY VINYLS?
EGREM is the quintessential
Cuban label. For nearly 35 years, EGREM remained the only record label in Cuba and
was the place where Cuba’s most celebrated artists made their first recordings.
From Chucho Valdes & Irakere, Frank
Fernandez, and Omara Portuondo, to Adalberto
Álvarez, Juan Formell y Los Van Van, Elena Burke, Silvio Rodriguez and Pablo Milanes, EGREM has been the cradle
of Cuban music recordings and continues to house the most extensive catalog of
Cuban music across genres in the world. With over 10,000 published masters of Rumba, Cha-cha-cha, Guaracha, Danzon, Mambo,
Son, Bolero, Classical, Salsa, Rock, Hip
Hop and Fusion, EGREM has also
hosted international legends such as Nat
King Cole, Josephine Baker, Sonia Silvestre, Soledad Bravo, Vicente Garrido,
Susana Baca, and Roy Brown. 
It is a vast archive that holds
true musical gems. Imagine a small island like Cuba -with a population of 11
million inhabitants- that many referred as La
Isla de la Música (the Island of Music)
because such extensive musical history, traditions and richness in music and
musical genres, and ALL of this music for fifty years,
being absorbed in his vast majority by just one record label.
Until the early 90’s EGREM
catalogue was published and printed solely on Vinyl, which today have become
collector’s items and very hard to find pieces developing a vast cult of music
aficionados who try to catch them when it is possible in records stores and
fairs around the globe. Vinyl records possess a visual as well an aural
capacity for storytelling. The record cover -often eye candy for the music
lover- speaks a language rooted in the environment and era of the music itself.
A record can create a profound sense of intimacy with its owner, and it's this
relationship that we all share. Every album cover tells a story and speaks
directly to the people who make music relevant and popular. By putting them
together in a book -as both archive and sideshow- we can easily evaluate and
define the visual and sonic aesthetics of a whole era.READY TO JOIN ME?
This project "first stage" goal is
totally achievable and possible; let’s make it happen together. If you cannot give money to our project there are many other ways you can help us! Get the noise around, tell people about this project and how they can help! Tweet, share on Facebook, take a snapshot and Instagram it, shout it out from the rooftops! You get the drift! Do you know someone who would be interested to give to our project or help in anyway? Let us know! Thank you!
PERKS. HOW WORKS?
Next to right are the perks we are offering to contributors, please
select a category and please read the instructions.
If you are not interested in perks, you can simply select any category from the
right then "change perks" and pick the "no perk" option. 
We will be updating this page marking sold-out perks and
adding new ones so check back! 
How will you know my size for the T-shirts?
If you picked a perk that includes a T-shirt, sizes
available are S, M, L, XL. 
We will be in touch to get your t-shirt sizes.
Can I pick more than one perk?
Yes but you must pay for them separately so that we can keep
track of what you chose.
Can I contribute more money than a particular category?
Sure, if you chose a perk that is $50 and you want to give
$100 or more go ahead and enter the number manually upon checkout.
I don't want a perk, can I still donate?
Sure, first pick any perk from the Indiegogo menu on the right, in the next page click "change
perk". Then choose "No perk I just want to donate".
I
chose my perk, now what?
Please refer to the REFERENCE DIAGRAM and then
choose the perk from the Indiegogo menu on the right, check out and enter the
code next to your shipping address.
Make
Payment trough PayPal at djasho@gmail.com
For questions check the FAQ or send us an email at djasho@gmail.comMI GENTE: I am not simply asking you for money but to collaborate with me. To be a Part of this AMAZING project so I can look to your face and hug you and say THANK U: I did it because of YOU! Clicking LIKE is beautiful but contributing is the REAL DEAL. Let's go!. Donate and Share!The journey
has just begun!

story:
Hello everyone!

Thank you for taking time to get to know me. My full story is captured in this video. In short: I came from Latvia to Canada to pursue my music career. I'm recording my debut album of original songs in Europe this fall. This campaign is put together to raise missing amount of funding needed to complete this project.

Lots of people believe in me and support my music and that`s what makes me keep going. Because of them, I am determent to get my songs out there for you to enjoy. And it's easier to do by recording an album that you can listen to, rather than me walking door to door and introducing my music to you live! I'll keep this drastic measure as the last option.

 

Where your money goes

With help of family and friends my team collected nearly 80% of the budget, all we are missing now is 10,000$. For full budget we will get:

  • recorded, mixed and mastered album of 12 original songs
  • 1 music video
  • several photo shoots for the album cover and a webpage
  • make up/hair/design for photo shoots and a music video
  • 3000 copies of the album
  • media support
  • the tickets to Europe for me and my team

If we don`t reach our goal we still will record an album, but some of the songs will not be included and you will lose a chance to enjoy this album fully. Then I'll be forced to use my last option and sing to you live, either you want it or not!

What you get out of this

For helping us you will get lots of perks, not only digital downloads but also much more . Check them out on the right side of the page -->

Also, you  will support  an independent music in general and will give a chance to avoid being ripped by major labels.

Other ways to help

My dear friends, fans, followers and Indiegogo visitors! Please spread the word and click Indiegogo Share Button to share this campaign! This is the least that you can do, but it means a lot to me and goes a long way!

story:
**English Below!!!**

Bonjour, Hi, Buenos Dias, Bom Dia!

Je m'appel Akawui Riquelme et je suis le fondateur du groupe Afro-brésilien ''Banda Aydê''qui réside a Montréal, QC. Avant tout nous avons voulu faire un petit sketch pour la vidéo mais soyez en sur, tous ceci est bien vrai!!. Cela fait trois ans que Banda Aydê existe et notre plaisir est de fusionner la musique Afro-Brésilienne/ Afro-Latine chanter en Français, Portugais,Anglais et Espanol. Nous avons participé à plusieurs événement de grande renommé comme le Festival international du Jazz de Montréal ainsi que Festival International Nuits d'Afrique. Notre but premier avec la musique  est d'établir un pont culturel avec les racines du Sud, le Canada et le monde entier

 L'an passé nous somme allées au Brésil pour le temps du Carnaval pour enregistrer notre premier vidéo clip qui s'intitule ''Dia de Festa'' ainsi qu'un deuxième vidéo clip qui est en production ''Reggae Girl''. Cette année nous avons quelques places au Carnaval de Salvador Bahia où  nous allons jouer. Malheureusement  trois membres du groupe n'ont pas reçu l'appui d'une bourse de déplacement. Nous avons la chance de connaître des amis artistes qui sont prêts à nous donner une place pour jouer durant le Carnaval et montrer au publique brésilien notre travail. Cela ouvrira nos horizons en tant qu'artistes et musiciens et sans aucune doute sera très bénéfique pour le cheminement professionnel du groupe.

La musique en général évolue tous les jours  et c'est pour cette même raison que nous trouvons très important qu'en tant que groupe de pouvoir nous produire au brésil pour faire partie de cette évolution.

Ce dont nous avons besoin et ce que vous obtenez

Tous les fonds collectés serviront à payer le billet d'avion de notre trompettiste  (Rachel Therrien), notre Bassiste (Paul Tibere )ainsi que notre caméraman (Khalid Salahadin) de ''Nuvola Productions'' qui se chargera de filmer nos prestations pour les publier par la suite. Bien sur en échange de votre généreux appui vous aurez des articles en échanges.  Avec le groupe nous avons décidés de faire ça le plus original possible... héhéhé!!

Les membres sont conscients qu'ils ne peuvent  pas dépendre  uniquement des sous collectées par indiegogo. Ils travaillent présentement fort au cas ou notre objectif ne sera pas atteint.  Si notre objectif n'est pas atteint nous diviserons les gains obtenus en trois parties égales et les membres qui pourrons compléter pour leur billets ce joindrons à nous pour cet aventure. Le reste de l'argent servira pour l'équipement et l'assurance de l'équipement ainsi que l’hébergement des musiciens une fois rendu au Brésil.

L'impact

L'an passé nous avons eu l'opportunité d'enregistrer 2 vidéos clip ainsi qu'enregistrer la  trame sonore de ''Reggae Girl''  avec les percussionnistes du groupe de Samba Reggae ''Olodum''. C'est pour cette raison que le groupe as acquis une certaine crédibilité et nous avons la chance de montrer les chansons original du groupes au publique brésilien. Les retombées de cette expérience seront cette fois-ci plus grande. Nous pourrions par la suite collaborer avec des musiciens brésiliens, pour aboutir à  un travail musical plus riches et diversifié.

D'autres façons d'aider

Il y a également d'autres moyens de nous aider à atteindre notre objectif. Vous êtes invités à venir participer à la 3ème édition du Pré Carnaval de Bahia qui se tiendra dans la ville de Québec le 7 Février  à 21:30 au Studio P, 281 Saint-Joseph Est. Pour les gens de Montréal l'événement se produira le 8 Février  à 22:30 au Petit Campus, 57 rue  Prince Arthur Est.  Cet événement à pour but de promouvoir la musique afro-brésilienne au Québec. Il y aura aussi comme invité spécial Julia Freitas de Salvador de Bahia avec son band pour bien vous transmettre l'énergie du Carnaval de Bahia. Pour plus d'informations vous pouvez consulter la page FB de l'événement. 

https://www.facebook.com/events/801815403177554/?fref=ts  

Un autre moyens de nous aider serait s.v.p de bien vouloir partager l'événement dans les réseaux sociaux!!

 Au nom de tous les musiciens ....Merci beaucoup, Thank you very much, Muchas Gracias, Muito Obrigado pour nous faire confiance et faire en sorte que la musique transperce les barrières culturels.

Sincèrement,

Akawui Riquelme


----------------ENGLISH-------------------ENGLISH---------------------ENGLISH---------------


Hello, Hi, Buenos Dias, Bom Dia!

My name is Akawui Riquelme and I am the founder of the Afro-Brazilian group " Banda Aydê " which resides in Montreal, QC. Above all we wanted to make a small sketch for the video that would make you smile, :) ... but be sure, all this is very true!!. It has been three years since Banda Aydê exists and our pleasure is to merge the Afro-Brazilian/Afro-Latine music in many different languages; French, Portuguese, English and Spanish. We participated in several big music event  such as the Festival International de Jazz de Montréal as well as Festival International Nuits d'Afrique. Our first purpose with this kind of music is to establish a cultural bridge between the roots of the South, Canada and the whole world.


Last year the band went to in Brazil for the time of the Carnival to record our first video clip which is entitled "Dia de Festa" as well as the second video clip which is in production " Reggae Chorus girl ". This year we have some places in the Carnival of Salvador Bahia where we are going to play. Unfortunately three members of the group did not receive the support of a travel grant. We are lucky to have the opportunity to know artists and have friends from there who are ready to give us a space to play during the Carnival and show our work to the brazilian public. This opportunity will open our horizons as artists and musicians and without any doubt we will be very beneficial for the professional progress of the group.

Music generally evolves every day and it is for the same reason that we find it very important as a group to be able to be produced in Brazil in order to be a member of this evolution.

What we need and what you obtain

All the collected funds will serve to pay the plane ticket of our trumpet player (Rachel) Therrien, our Bass player (Paul Tibere) as well as our cameraman ( Khalid Salahadin) of "Nuvola Productions" who will take care of filming our performances to publish them afterward. In exchange for your generous support you will get back different sorts of articles that will hopefully please you and also make you smile as we decided to be the most original as we could in gift exchanging part of this campaign hahaha!


The members are aware that they cannot depend only on money collected by indiegogo. They're working hardly in case our objective will not be reached. If our objective is not reached we will divide the gains obtained in three equal parts and the members who can complete for their tickets will join us for this adventure. The rest of the money will be needed for the equipment and it's insurance, as well as for the accommodation (hosting) of the musicians once in Brazil.

The Impact

Last year we had the opportunity to record 2 video clips as well as recording the soundtrack of " Reggae Girl " with the percussionists of a very known and popular  group called "Olodum" a Samba Reggae group from Salvador de Bahia. This is why the group acquired a certain credibility and we are lucky enough to have the opportunity of showings our original songs in Brazil. This time the outcome from this experience will be even bigger as it will open up for us new and better opportunities to collaborate with Brazilian musicians, and give us the chance to produce a musical work that is richer and diversified.

Other ways of helping

There are also other ways to help us to reach our goal. You are invited to come to participate in the 3rd edition of the Pré Carnival of Bahia which will be held in the city of Quebec on February 7th in 21:30 in the Studio P, 281 Saint Joseph Est. For Montreal people the event will take place on February 8th at 22:30 at Petit Campus, at this address - 57 Prince Arthur Est. There will also be a special artist guest, Julia Freitas a singer from Salvador de Bahia with her band to farther let you experience the carnival's energy of Bahia. This event serves to promote the Afro-Brazilian music in Quebec. For more information you can consult the Facebook page of the event. 

https://www.facebook.com/events/801815403177554/?fref=ts

An other way to help us would be to share the event in your social networks!!

In the name of all the musicians....  Thank you very much,Merci Beaucoup, Muchas Gracias, Muito Obrigado for your trust and for making music pierce cultural barriers.

Sincerely,

Akawui Riquelme

It has been three years since Banda Aydê exists and our pleasure is to merge the Afro-Brazilian/Afro-Latine music in many different languages; French, Portuguese, English and Spanish. We participated in several big music event  such as the Festival International de Jazz de Montréal as well as Festival International Nuits d'Afrique. Our first purpose with this kind of music is to establish a cultural bridge between the roots of the South, Canada and the whole world.Last year the band went to in Brazil for the time of the Carnival to record our first video clip which is entitled "Dia de Festa" as well as the second video clip which is in production " Reggae Chorus girl ". This year we have some places in the Carnival of Salvador Bahia where we are going to play. Unfortunately three members of the group did not receive the support of a travel grant. We are lucky to have the opportunity to know artists and have friends from there who are ready to give us a space to play during the Carnival and show our work to the brazilian public. This opportunity will open our horizons as artists and musicians and without any doubt we will be very beneficial for the professional progress of the group.Music generally evolves every day and it is for the same reason that we find it very important as a group to be able to be produced in Brazil in order to be a member of this evolution.What we need and what you obtainAll the collected funds will serve to pay the plane ticket of our trumpet player (Rachel) Therrien, our Bass player (Paul Tibere) as well as our cameraman ( Khalid Salahadin) of "Nuvola Productions" who will take care of filming our performances to publish them afterward. In exchange for your generous support you will get back different sorts of articles that will hopefully please you and also make you smile as we decided to be the most original as we could in gift exchanging part of this campaign hahaha!The members are aware that they cannot depend only on money collected by indiegogo. They're working hardly in case our objective will not be reached. If our objective is not reached we will divide the gains obtained in three equal parts and the members who can complete for their tickets will join us for this adventure. The rest of the money will be needed for the equipment and it's insurance, as well as for the accommodation (hosting) of the musicians once in Brazil.The ImpactLast year we had the opportunity to record 2 video clips as well as recording the soundtrack of " Reggae Girl " with the percussionists of a very known and popular  group called "Olodum" a Samba Reggae group from Salvador de Bahia. This is why the group acquired a certain credibility and we are lucky enough to have the opportunity of showings our original songs in Brazil. This time the outcome from this experience will be even bigger as it will open up for us new and better opportunities to collaborate with Brazilian musicians, and give us the chance to produce a musical work that is richer and diversified.Other ways of helpingThere are also other ways to help us to reach our goal. You are invited to come to participate in the 3rd edition of the Pré Carnival of Bahia which will be held in the city of Quebec on February 7th in 21:30 in the Studio P, 281 Saint Joseph Est. For Montreal people the event will take place on February 8th at 22:30 at Petit Campus, at this address - 57 Prince Arthur Est. There will also be a special artist guest, Julia Freitas a singer from Salvador de Bahia with her band to farther let you experience the carnival's energy of Bahia. This event serves to promote the Afro-Brazilian music in Quebec. For more information you can consult the Facebook page of the event. https://www.facebook.com/events/801815403177554/?fref=tsAn other way to help us would be to share the event in your social networks!!In the name of all the musicians....  Thank you very much,Merci Beaucoup, Muchas Gracias, Muito Obrigado for your trust and for making music pierce cultural barriers.Sincerely,Akawui Riquelme

story:
Current version of the application (for iPhone) is available here




Who We Are and Our Campaign?

We are group of passionate entrepreneurs and mobile applications development professionals who have created a number of successful mobile applications projects over the period of time [See portfolio section for reference].

We have developed WorldRadios application for iPhone and launched it back in May 2011 with the intention to offer a verity of radio content for iPhone users. Since then more then 100,000+ copies of this application have been downloaded in different app-stores worldwide. We have received enormous feedbacks from the users asking to make improvements, enhance features, refresh the user interface and port the application to other platforms, especially Android.

As this application is being offered free of cost to the audience (and is planned to remain free forever), and we can't invest much on our own to invest into the application for these enhancements, however we are willing to contribute to run this project and come up with an enhanced product based on the requirements of the users.

What We Need & What You Get

You as a contributor to the project would help us to make this project happen to bring a new life to the application for iPhone devices while bring to to reality for Android phones and tablets. And of course help us to keep this app offered as free of cost for public.

As a note, we must make this project happen if we get at-least some funding and would divide the project into different phases based on the funds we'll get.

The costs would be for following services where the money would be spent,

  • Hire professional graphics designer and usability experts for the new user interface designs
  • Hire the mobile applications development professionals for developing Android application and make enhancements to the iPhone version.
  • Hiring Quality Assurance and Testing professional
  • Purchasing hardware resources required to develop and test the applications.
  • Pay the incubator rent and utility bills.
  • Other miscellaneous costs.

* We  would be offering our management and project leading services without any cost.

As a contributor and backer to this project, in addition to free application you can get following (as perks to the project),

  •  Your name under contributors section of the application and product website for lifetime of the application.
  • You can be part of 100 beta users who can get the application copy prior to launch for iPhone/iPad.
  • You can be part of 500 beta users who can get the application copy prior to launch for Android.
  • You can get the WorldRadios designed T-Shirt with international shipping, colours available are Black, White, Grey and Blue.






  • You can get WorldRadios branded premier quality stereo earphones (either for android or iPhone device).


Expected Features for Newer Version:

Here is the list of planned features for newer version planned as result of this project,

  • Enhanced rich user interface for iPhone application.
  • Support for iPad devices.
  • Design and host a dedicated product web-site
  • A newer version for Android phones and tablets.
  • Recording playing radio streams and playback feature.
  • Backup the recordings to third party services i.e DropBox, Skydrive etc.
  • Social sharing of the recordings, channels and programs to Facebook, Twitter and send through email.
  • User would be able set reminders for the programs and application would alert at the set time.
  • Social feature for the application where people listening to a particular channel and program can comment and interact.
  • Stream playing content to external devices through AirPlay.

Past Experience and Portfolio

We as a team have worked on successful word class mobile applications developments in the past. Few examples of our work are,

iPhone/iPad Projects

Bum Chin Booth HD

​Fine Wine App

Celebrity HairStyles

Mir Fabergé

Spot Goes To School (got selected as the app of the week on launch)

Orbyt

Yoga App

Breathing Well

Fake Caller Utility

Christmas Tree Decor

Android Projects

Nirsham

Breathing Well

Forex Conversion App

Bus Guru for London

TwitYap

Congress App

YouSeeYou

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute through money, we still thank you to read through our campaign, but that doesn’t mean that you can’t help other way. You can even contribute by,

  • Ask your friends and people in your social circle to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • You can use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word.

Thank you to read through, contribute, spread the word, wishing for the success of this project keep following to this campaign.

More

Application Review Comments from current users of the application that shows their trust to this product and same would be offered for Android users if this compaign gets successful,

Best app 4 Iphone

Best free app for world live radio on the AppStore. Can not compare to any free live international radio.

Loved this awesome application of huge collection of streamed radio stations for your iphone. There are rich feature set and even plays in background. Must give it a try and you'll be addicted to this app, I bet !

just the great app. it's the most working radio out of all the radio app.

Just great!

I moved to England after spending 16 years of my life at my birthplace. I had everything here for me but what I didn't have here was my fm station which I missed the most. Now with this app I have all of my favourite station in my pocket where ever I go. I cant thank enough for the developer for this app.

story:
A Rare Event for Period Opera!

Conductor Edward Elwyn Jones and the period-instrument orchestra Grand Harmonie will present a concert performance of Mozart's serenata Il Re Pastore on June 13, 7:30pm at Harvard's Paine Hall. The fantastic cast includes internationally-acclaimed singers

  • Dominique Labelle [Aminta]
  • Zachary Wilder [Alessandro]
  • Amanda Forsythe [Elisa]
  • Teresa Wakim [Tamiri]
  • Jonas Budris [Agenore]

For the second summer in a row, Grand Harmonie continues its groundbreaking contributions to opera on period instruments, capitalizing on last year's spectacular performance of Rossini's Cenerentola with Boston Opera Collaborative. The orchestra features concertmaster Sarah Darling, assisted by a full complement of strings and winds, including two period English horns!

Our Budget

Opera is expensive, but a concert performance eschews the lavish sets and staging in favor of highlighting the immense talents of the singers and instrumentalists. Over 50% of the budget goes towards musicians' fees so that we can attract the highest-caliber historically-informed performers that New England has to offer. We are lucky to have the support of several private donors, but we need your contributions to help get us across the finish line!

If we exceed our goal thanks to your generous support, any extra funds will go towards supporting future Grand Harmonie projects, including a very exciting orchestral concert with Edward Jones in November 2014 featuring oboist Kristin Olson performing Mozart's oboe concerto.

The Impact

Boston has a strong tradition of Baroque opera performance. For years the Boston Early Music Festival has been putting on world class performances, at which many of our cast members have been regular favorites. However, operas from the Classical and Romantic eras are rarely performed on period instruments, and Grand Harmonie is proud to be expanding the gamut of historical performance to these works. Mozart's operatic works have delighted audiences for centuries, but even the most avid Mozart lover may not be familiar with Il Re Pastore. We aim to change that by bringing this lesser-known work back into the repertoire, and showing how Mozart's talents for vocal and instrumental writing shine through in a historically-informed performance. In particular, Mozart's inspired use of four natural horns in two different keys and two English horns is an orchestral color which is impossible to duplicate on modern instruments.

The internationally acclaimed cast has graced the stages of the world's most famous opera houses; all established Mozart singers, they are local favorites who will delight in this charming work, full of elegant vocal writing. Conductor Edward Jones leads the performance from the fortepiano. 

Grand Harmonie has already shown its commitment to historical performance of opera as the pit orchestra for Rossini's Cenerentola in August 2013 with Boston Opera Collaborative. This performance was praised by the Boston Globe, which noted that Grand Harmonie's "24-piece orchestra gave the Overture a raw, rustic flavor, with piquant winds and horns," and the Boston Musical Intelligencer noted that "what stood out was [Grand Harmonie's] ability to balance with and support the singers, creating a very satisfying overall musical palate."

story:
Who Are We?

We are Vital Signs, an Alternative Rock band from Orlando, Florida. We've been together for over 2 years and played over 70 shows in that time period. We have really tried to cultivate our own original sound while staying within the realms of the Alternative Rock scene.

In October of last year we took on a new attitude towards our music under the name Vital Signs. Our goal has always been to make really good music so our fans have a great musical experience. We have been working on writing new songs for months and are finally ready to make an EP, but it's been a difficult process trying to afford recordings of our material. We would really like to have recordings that are professional quality.

That is why we have decided to reach out to you. And... we thought that IndieGoGo was the perfect medium to help us do just that. Any contribution in helping us make this EP would be wonderful, because it has been a dream for us to get to a point where we could professionally make this EP. Achieving this goal means opening doors to bigger and better things for Vital Signs. We want to use this EP to help us nationally expand our audience, to get radio distribution and to get label and press coverage.

 

What We Need & What You Get

To cover the costs of mastering and music production, cover artwork, music video and marketing, it has been estimated that we will need to raise about $3,000. Any money we raise beyond $3,000 will go towards releasing a full-blown album and if we don't reach our goal, the money will go towards recording individual songs. 

Here is a break down of what we need:

EP - $2,000
Radio Distribution - $300
Cover Design - $150
Music Video - $550

The Perks

We have a wide-range of incentives for donating to our campaign. We have tried to make it easy for possible supporters to contribute as much or as little as they want.  The incentives include your name in our EP's liner notes, a digital copy of our old album, our new EP and even a chance to be in our music video!

Track Record and Impact

We have made an IndieGoGo Campaigns in the past and while we did not meet our goal, the funds went towards recording our first album in studio. We were able to get our music played on international internet radio stations and we received press coverage for our song "Hey! Mister!" because of the contributions that every individual made for that campaign. We were even able to make a music video using that song because of the donations.

You can hear some of the songs we recorded using the funds here: http://reverbnation.com/vitalsignslive

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people can’t contribute in times like these, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help! Here is a list of ways you can help us without donating:

  1. Send the link to your friends
  2. Tell people about Vital Signs
  3. Connect and Share our Facebook, Twitter and Myspace account

story:
(English Downstairs)

אטליז / אלבום מן העתיד
(עזבו אותי מהסברים, קחו אותי ישר לחבילות בעברית)

אהלן

אנחנו להקת אטליז. אחרי שנים של עשייה רבה יצאנו לדרך חדשה, כשאנחנו עוזבים את היד של  חברת התקליטים ומממנים בעצמנו הוצאת אלבום רביעי. עם סולנית חדשה שמזרימה דם חדש ומתוק ללהקה, ועם מפיק חדש, אנחנו פונים אליכם לעזור לנו להוציא את מה שאנחנו מרגישים שהוא היצירה הטובה ביותר שלנו, אך אנחנו חייבים את האמונה שלכם בנו כדי שנצליח להוציא אותו לאור.

קצת על האלבום
באלבום הרביעי בחרנו לעבוד עם היוצר והמפיק איתמר ציגלר. ציגלר הוא נגן הבאס בהרכב המוערך "בלקן ביט בוקס", ויוצר מוערך בעצמו, אשר הוציא שלושה אלבומי סולו בארץ ובחו"ל, וכתב מוזיקה לפסקולים. מלאכת כתיבת המילים הפכה להיות בשיתוף עם סיון אבלסון, סולנית הלהקה, כותבת ותסריטאית. באלבום זה העולם הלירי הינו שונה ושואב מסגרת מעולם מספרי הסיפורים. בשונה מהאלבומים הקודמים, שבעצמם היו שונים אחד מהשני, בחרנו לחקור תחומים של מוזיקה אלקטרונית.

כלהקה חרטנו על דיגלנו התפתחות אמנותית ויצירה לשם היצירה, ולא סיפוק קהל זה או אחר, וגורלנו להמשיך להשתנות. אנחנו מכווננים להתקדם ולהתפתח, והנכונות לעזוב את המרחב הבטוח שקצר הצלחות ולהמשיך לשאוף קדימה הכרחית להתפתחות זו.

מדוע אנחנו מבקשים את תמיכתכם?
אנחנו עובדים על האלבום כבר מעל לשנה ואנחנו ממשיכים להשקיע בו את כל המשאבים שלנו. עכשיו לקראת סיום האלבום המשאבים נגמרו, אך ההשקעה הנותרת רבה: סיום מיקסים, מאסטרינג, עיצוב עטיפת האלבום, ייצור והדפסת האלבום, יחסי ציבור, הוצאת סינגלים לרדיו, מופע השקה לאלבום ועוד המון דברים. מאוד בפשטות, לא נוכל לעשות את זה בלעדיכם.

כמה מילים על הלהקה
אנחנו להקת ארט-רוק, המשלבת את עולם המוזיקה עם עולם הויז'ואל. המוזיקה נאמנה לעצמה באופן טוטאלי אך עדיין מצליחה לתקשר עצמה לקהלים רבים ובכך עושה את הבלתי אפשרי. אטליז אינה תחומה לסגנון מוזיקלי קופסאתי אלא משלבת סגנונות רבים בצורה ייחודית לה, ביניהם מטאל, רוק אלטרנטיבי, רוק מתקדם, פאנק, מוזיקה ערבית קלאסית, רוק פסיכאדלי ובוסה נובה.

העשייה הרבה שלנו, כמו גם התכנון השאפתני לעתיד, מסתמכים על קבלות שזכינו בהן בזכות, בעבודה קשה וחשיבה ארוכת טווח, נחישות ונאמנות ליצירה. אך אנחנו מפוכחים ומודעים לכך שללא עזרה כספית יהיה בלתי אפשרי להמשיך ולהגשים את החזון. נודה לכם על כל תמיכה אפשרית בפרוייקט האלבום הרביעי.

אפשר ליצור איתנו קשר בפייסבוק שלנו וכאן לשמוע קצת מהמוזיקה החדשה.

מכיוון שאנחנו פונים לקהל מרחבי העולם, האתר הוא בינלאומי ובאנגלית. אך אל דאגה. ליד כל מחיר בדולרים תמצאו את המחיר בשקלים, וכאן תמצאו תרגום של החבילות לעברית

תודה לכולם ולכולן, הרבה אהבה מאיתנו.

אטליז.

Eatliz / Making a new album

Hi 

We are Eatliz. After years of great achievements we are hitting the road again. We have parted from our record label and are now completely self-reliant in funding our fourth album. Our new lead singer infuses the band with sweet new blood, and we have joined forces with New York music producer Itamar Ziegler. Now we turn to you to help us bring into life what we think is our best work yet, for your faith and support in the upcoming album is vital for the release of the album. 

We want to tell you a little about the album:  
We chose to team up with Itamar Ziegler, and brought him on board as the producer for this album. Ziegler is the bass player in the well known and respected band “Balkan Beat Box”, and an appreciated musician, who has released three solo albums in Israel and abroad, and also wrote several film scores.

Sivan Abelson, the new lead singer, who is also a writer and a screenwriter, had joined in in writing the lyrics for the album. In this album the lyrical world is new and is more akin to the world of storytelling. Unlike the band's prior albums, that were diversified and varied in style from one to the next, we chose to also explore the territory of electronic music.

As a band we have made it our goal to keep evolving and to create for the purpose of creation, and not for the contentment of an audience. Our destiny is to always keep changing. Working outside of our safe zone is vital for our evolution. 

Why do we need your support?
We have been working on this album for over a year and have put all our resources into it. Now, the album is almost done, but we depleted our resources, and there is still a lot of work to be done before release: Mixing the album, mastering, designing the cover, manufacturing and printing, public relations, releasing singles, the album launch concert and much more. To put it very simply, we won't make it without you.

A few words about the band
Eatliz is an art-rock band, that combines music with a visual world. Our music is completely true to itself but still manages to be communicative for many audiences, thus achieving the almost impossible. Eatliz is not bound to a specific genre but combines various styles, from metal to alternative rock, progressive rock to punk, oriental Arabic music to psychedelic rock and Bossa nova.  

Our great achievements, as well as our ambitious plans for the future, are well deserved after proving ourselves to be a hard working and long term planning band. Our decisiveness and dedication to music have taken us far, but we are realistic and aware that without financial support it will be impossible to keep realizing our vision. We thank you for any way of supporting our fourth album.

You can contact us here , and listen to the debut single from the album here.

Thank you one and all, with alotta lotta love from all of us.

Eatliz.
